original: re re las ni skye ba grub pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: re re las ni skye ba grub pa yod ma yin //

analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin pa'i phyir gnyis ka las skye ba yod pa ma yin no //

analyzed: de 'gral  pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: For example,

original: re res bskyed par 'gyur na ni //
analyzed: re res bskyed par 'gyur na ni //
translated: If each were to generate,🔽then there would be production from both.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag gam gzhan gang yang rung bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag gam gzhan gang yang rung bas so //
translated: That is, by either self or other.🔽Even many such natures,

analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin can mang po rnams kyis kyang zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'i nus pa can mang po rnams kyis kyang ngo //
translated: that is, even many that have the ability to generate.🔽Therefore, etc.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis ka las skye ba 'gegs pa'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis ka las skye ba 'gegs pa'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: concludes the refutation of production from both.

original: da ni rgyu med pa las skye bar 'dod pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: da ni rgyu med pa las skye bar 'dod pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir ;
translated: Now, in order to refute the assertion of arising from a noncause,

original: 'dir rang bzhin smra ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir rang bzhin smra ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the root text] states, “Here, the proponent of intrinsic nature . . . .”

original: nyes pa de dag tu 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan dang / gnyis ka las skye bar 'dod pa'i phyogs la skyon gang brjod pa rnams so //
analyzed: nyes pa de dag tu 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan dang / gnyis ka las skye bar 'dod pa'i phyogs la skyon gang brjod pa rnams so //
translated: “These faults would ensue” refers to the faults that were stated in the context of the positions that assert arising from self, from other, and from both.

original: dngos po rnams kyi skye ba ni rang bzhin las byung ba kho na yin te zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams rgyu la ma ltos ngo bo nyid kyis 'byung ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi skye ba ni rang bzhin las byung ba kho na yin te zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams rgyu la ma ltos ngo bo nyid kyis 'byung ba yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “The arising of things would occur only from their intrinsic nature” means that things would arise from their own intrinsic nature without depending on a cause.

original: rang bzhin las 'byung ba rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin las 'byung ba rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach extensively about arising from intrinsic nature,

original: 'di ltar pad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar pad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the root text] states, “In this way, a lotus . . . .”

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni rgyu'o //
translated: “Something” is a cause.

original: rtsub pa dang 'jam pa dag ces bya ba ni sdong bu rnams rtsub pa dang ; 'dab ma rnams 'jam pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtsub pa dang 'jam pa dag ces bya ba ni sdong bu rnams rtsub pa dang ; 'dab ma rnams 'jam pa nyid do //
translated: “Rough and smooth” refers to the stems being rough and the petals being smooth.

original: de'i 'dab ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni padma'i 'dab ma dang ze 'bru la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'dab ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni padma'i 'dab ma dang ze 'bru la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Its petals, etc.” refers to the petals, anthers, etc. of the lotus.

original: sna tshogs pa dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa dag ces bya ba la /
translated: “Various” means

original: 'dab ma rnams ni dmar po'o ze 'bru rnams ni ser po dang dkar po dag go //
analyzed: 'dab ma rnams ni dmar po'o ze 'bru rnams ni ser po dang dkar po dag go //
translated: that the petals are red, the anthers are yellow and white,

original: snying po rnams ni ser po nyid do //
analyzed: snying po rnams ni ser po nyid do //
translated: and the pistils are yellow.

original: de bzhin du dbyibs kyang tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbyibs kyang tha dad pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the shapes are different.

original: de bzhin du pa na sa dang bal po se'u la sogs pa sna tshogs pa yang 'ga' zhig gis byed par mthong ba ma yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du pa na sa dang bal po se'u la sogs pa sna tshogs pa yang 'ga' zhig gis byed par mthong ba ma yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, various things such as paṇasa fruit and pomegranates are not seen to be made by anyone.

original: pa nas zhes bya ba ni shing thog gi khyad par ro //
analyzed: pa nas zhes bya ba ni shing thog gi khyad par ro //
translated: “Paṇasa” is a kind of fruit.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni star ga la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //🔽phyi rol gyi dngos po rang bzhin las skye ba yin no zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni star ga la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o // phyi rol gyi dngos po rang bzhin las skye ba yin no zhes bstan nas /
translated: The word “etc.” includes walnuts and so on.🔽Having thus shown that external things arise from a cause,🔽in order to show that internal things also arise from a cause,

original: nang gi dngos po yang rang bzhin las skye ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nang gi dngos po yang rang bzhin las skye ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: he says:

original: phyi rol dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phyi rol dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “The external, etc.”

original: ti ti ri zhes bya ba ni bya'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: ti ti ri zhes bya ba ni bya'i khyad par ro //
translated: Titiri is a particular bird.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ne tsho la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ne tsho la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes parrots and so on.

analyzed: de la lan bstan @218b par bya ba'i phyir / 'di la bshad par bya ste /
translated: In order to demonstrate the response to that,🔽it is said:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Here, it is said, etc.”

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par skye bar 'dod pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par skye bar 'dod pa'i tshe'o //
translated: “At that time” means when it is asserted that arising is causeless.

original: mtha' dag rtag tu thams cad las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po mtha' dag dus rtag tu rgyu 'am rgyu ma yin pa thams cad las skye bar 'gyur te gzhan la ltos pa med pas so //
analyzed: mtha' dag rtag tu thams cad las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po mtha' dag dus rtag tu rgyu 'am rgyu ma yin pa thams cad las skye bar 'gyur te gzhan la ltos pa med pas so //
translated: “The whole, always, from everything” and so on means that the whole of things would arise at all times from everything, whether it is a cause or not, because it would not depend on another.

original: 'bras 'byung ched du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skyon gnyis pa ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras 'byung ched du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skyon gnyis pa ston pa yin te /
translated: “For the sake of the arising of the effect” and so on teaches the second fault.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyis sa bon la sogs pa sdud par yang mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyis sa bon la sogs pa sdud par yang mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because worldly people would not gather seeds and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gos dang rgyan la sogs pa 'dod pa rnams kyis snal ma dang gser la sogs pa sdud par byed par yang mi 'gyur ba bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gos dang rgyan la sogs pa 'dod pa rnams kyis snal ma dang gser la sogs pa sdud par byed par yang mi 'gyur ba bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The words “and so on” should be understood to include the case where those who desire cloth, ornaments, and so on, do not gather cotton, gold, and so on.

original: ci ltar sa bon la sogs pa sdud par byed na smras pa /
analyzed: ci ltar sa bon la sogs pa sdud par byed na smras pa /
translated: How is it that seeds and so on are not gathered?

original: brgya phrag dag gi sgo nas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: brgya phrag dag gi sgo nas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He says, “because of the hundreds of ways.”

original: thabs du ma'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: thabs du ma'i sgo nas so //
translated: Because of the many methods.

original: 'dis ni mthong ba dang 'gal ba nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni mthong ba dang 'gal ba nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: This shows the contradiction with what is seen.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “If it were the case that the fruit of the mango tree, and so on,

original: glo bur bar 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu la ltos pa med na'o //🔽des ni shing thog gi zhes bya ba ni pa na sa'i 'bras bu yi'o //
analyzed: glo bur bar 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu la ltos pa med na'o // des ni shing thog gi zhes bya ba ni pa na sa'i 'bras bu yi'o //
translated: were to arise without depending on a cause,🔽then it would follow that it would arise without a doubt even in the absence of the mango tree, and so on.🔽But that is not the case.🔽Therefore, the fruit of the mango tree, and so on,

original: nim pa dang aa mra la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni shing gi khyad par ro //🔽de dag las kyang zhes bya ba ni nim pa dang aa mra la sogs pa rnams las kyang ngo //
analyzed: nim pa dang aa mra la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni shing gi khyad par ro //🔽de dag las kyang zhes bya ba ni nim pa dang aa mra la sogs pa rnams las kyang ngo //
translated: arises from the mango tree, and so on.

original: rgyu ma yin pa nyid du 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni pa nas dang / aa mra dang / nim pa la sogs pa rnams rgyu ma yin pa nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa nyid du 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni pa nas dang / aa mra dang / nim pa la sogs pa rnams rgyu ma yin pa nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is, because they are similar in not being causes, such as rice, mango, neem, and so on.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni shing pa na sa'i'o //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni shing pa na sa'i'o //
translated: “Just like that” refers to the pānasā tree.

original: de ltar rgyu med pa las skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu med pa las skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba nyid bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having shown the consequence of arising without a cause,

original: nga ni dus thams cad du skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nga ni dus thams cad du skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to show the consequence of arising at all times,

original: yang gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yang gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “If it arises from its own nature, why does it not arise at all times?”

original: dus tshigs la ltos shing zhes bya ba ni dpyid la sogs pa'i dus rnams la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: dus tshigs la ltos shing zhes bya ba ni dpyid la sogs pa'i dus rnams la ltos pa'o //
translated: “Depending on the seasons” means depending on the seasons such as spring.

original: smin pa las skyes pa'i skye ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba stobs kyis gang dkar po dang dmar po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs khyad par can skye'o //
analyzed: smin pa las skyes pa'i skye ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba stobs kyis gang dkar po dang dmar po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs khyad par can skye'o //
translated: “Arising from ripening” means that arising is powerful, and a special state such as white or red arises.

original: aa mra dang la gu tsa la sogs pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni shing thog gi khyad par rnams kyis so //
analyzed: aa mra dang la gu tsa la sogs pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni shing thog gi khyad par rnams kyis so //
translated: With mangoes, breadfruit, and so on means with the various fruits.

original: res 'ga' mngon par zhes bya ba ni 'dis ni dus tshigs la ltos pa'i brjod pa nyid do //🔽mngal gyi gnas skabs na yang @219a * //
analyzed: res 'ga' mngon par zhes bya ba ni 'dis ni dus tshigs la ltos pa'i brjod pa nyid do // mngal gyi gnas skabs na yang @219a * //
translated: Sometimes manifestly means that the statement is dependent on the season.

original: zhes bya ba ni nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang ngo //
translated: Even in the womb means even in the stages of kalala, etc.

original: rtag tu skye bar 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni dus kyi khyad par las skye bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rtag tu skye bar 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni dus kyi khyad par las skye bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If it were always born means it would not be born dependent on a particular time.

original: des ni yod pa yang ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni rtag tu skye ba yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: des ni yod pa yang ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni rtag tu skye ba yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Since it is not existent by that means that it is not always existent.

original: rang bzhin du smra ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par smra ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin du smra ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par smra ba'o //
translated: The proponents of svabhāva means the proponents of causelessness.

original: rigs pa dang 'gal bas brjod nas zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par skye bar khas len na mi 'dod par thal bar 'gyur ba bstan pas so //
analyzed: rigs pa dang 'gal bas brjod nas zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par skye bar khas len na mi 'dod par thal bar 'gyur ba bstan pas so //
translated: Having stated the contradiction with reasoning means that if one accepts arising without a cause, the consequence of the undesired is shown.

original: mthong ba dang 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: “Contradicted by perception” means contradicted by direct perception.

original: skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach another fault,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “Moreover, if the world were without a cause,” and so on.

original: gal te 'gro ba rnams la rgyu med par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'gro ba gzung du med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'o //🔽de la dpe ston pa ni /
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba rnams la rgyu med par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'gro ba gzung du med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'o // de la dpe ston pa ni /
translated: If the world were without a cause, then it follows that the world would be ungraspable.

original: nam mkha'i autpala'i dri'i mdog ji bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽dper na nam mkha'i autpala'i dri dang kha dog la rgyu med pa'i phyir gzung du med pa de bzhin du 'gro ba rnams kyang gzung du med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i autpala'i dri'i mdog ji bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / dper na nam mkha'i autpala'i dri dang kha dog la rgyu med pa'i phyir gzung du med pa de bzhin du 'gro ba rnams kyang gzung du med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: In order to illustrate that, he says “Like the color and scent of a sky-lotus,” and so on.

original: rgyu yis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu yis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, the color and scent of a sky-lotus are ungraspable because they are without a cause. In the same way, the world would be ungraspable because it is empty of a cause.

original: 'gro ba rnams gzung du med pa nyid kyang ma yin pas rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams gzung du med pa nyid kyang ma yin pas rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that the world is not ungraspable, and therefore not without a cause, he says

original: shin tu ches bkra'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shin tu ches bkra'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Very colorful” and so on.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i dbye bas shin tu ches bkra ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i dbye bas shin tu ches bkra ba'o //
translated: It is very colorful due to the various divisions of color, shape, and so on.

original: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that with an example,

original: rang gi blo bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rang gi blo bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “like one’s own mind” and so on is said.

original: ci ltar rang bzhin las skye bar smra ba po rnams la sngon por snang ba'i blo sngon po med na mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir blo rgyu las skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: ci ltar rang bzhin las skye bar smra ba po rnams la sngon por snang ba'i blo sngon po med na mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir blo rgyu las skyes pa yin la /
translated: Just as for those who propound arising from a cause, the mind that appears as blue does not occur without blue, and therefore the mind arises from a cause,

original: de bzhin du 'gro ba 'dzin pa yang 'gro ba med na mi 'byung bas 'dzin pa rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba yang rgyu dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gro ba 'dzin pa yang 'gro ba med na mi 'byung bas 'dzin pa rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba yang rgyu dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o zhes pa'o //
translated: in the same way, apprehending a world does not occur without a world. Therefore, because apprehending is caused, the world also would be caused.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that with an example,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “If one says” and so on is said.

original: 'dzin pa'i lam du mi 'gyur ba nyid na zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i lam du mi 'gyur ba nyid na zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Not becoming a cause of grasping” means not becoming a cause of the apprehension of true existence.

original: rang gi blo ji ltar zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi blo ji ltar zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of “just as your mind” is

original: khyod kyi ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: khyod kyi ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: “according to you, etc.”

original: khyod kyi zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin smra ba'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin smra ba'o //
translated: “You” refers to the proponents of intrinsic nature.

original: de ltar rang bzhin las skye bar smra ba bkag nas /
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin las skye bar smra ba bkag nas /
translated: Having thus refuted the assertion of arising from intrinsic nature,

original: mthong ba rgyu ru smra ba'i phyogs snga ma bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba rgyu ru smra ba'i phyogs snga ma bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the former position that seeing is the cause,

original: sems @219b pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems @219b pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “the mind, etc.”

original: sems pa 'byung ba las gyur pa dag ni zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rnams las sems 'byung bar brjod pa de dag ni sems pa 'byung ba las gyur ba dag go //
analyzed: sems pa 'byung ba las gyur pa dag ni zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rnams las sems 'byung bar brjod pa de dag ni sems pa 'byung ba las gyur ba dag go //
translated: “The mind, etc., that arise from the elements” refers to the mind that arises from the elements such as earth.

original: de'i 'dod pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'dod pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach his assertion,

original: rgyu dmigs bzhin pa la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyu dmigs bzhin pa la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “when the cause is seen, etc.”

original: rgyu dmigs bzhin pa la zhes bya ba ni shing thog aa mra dang pa na sa la sogs pa rnams kyi mthong ba'i rgyu ni shing pa na sa dang aa mra la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rgyu dmigs bzhin pa la zhes bya ba ni shing thog aa mra dang pa na sa la sogs pa rnams kyi mthong ba'i rgyu ni shing pa na sa dang aa mra la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: “The cause of what is being seen” means that the cause of seeing such things as mangoes and breadfruit is the breadfruit tree and the mango tree, etc.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin smra ba la brjod pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin smra ba la brjod pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because the previously explained fault would follow” means because the previously explained fault would follow for the proponent of intrinsic nature.

original: mthong ba'i rgyu nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba'i rgyu nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the very cause of seeing,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says “the state of cause and effect,” etc.

original: de rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that extensively,

original: de nyid bzhi kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid bzhi kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “just those four,” etc.

original: yongs su smin pa'i khyad par las zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs khyad par can rnyed pa las so //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i khyad par las zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs khyad par can rnyed pa las so //
translated: “From the special ripening” means from attaining a special state.

original: dngos po'i de kho na nyid sna tshogs yongs su gcod pa por gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin gsal bar byed pa'i de kho na nyid las skye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams kho na🔽las skye ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i de kho na nyid sna tshogs yongs su gcod pa por gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin gsal bar byed pa'i de kho na nyid las skye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams kho na las skye ba yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that it arises from the great elements such as earth alone.

original: 'byung ba rnams las blo skye ba la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams las blo skye ba la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the example of the arising of the mind from the elements,

original: de la ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “In that regard, how is it?” and so on.

original: 'byung ba'i bye brag phrad pa yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par las zhes bya ba ni chang gi rgyur gyur pa'i phabs la sogs pa'i 'byung ba'i khyad par gang yin pa de rnams tshogs pa de'i yongs su 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i bye brag phrad pa yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par las zhes bya ba ni chang gi rgyur gyur pa'i phabs la sogs pa'i 'byung ba'i khyad par gang yin pa de rnams tshogs pa de'i yongs su 'gyur ba ste //
translated: The phrase “from the transformation of the particular conjunction of the elements” means that the transformation of the collection of the particular elements that are the cause of beer, such as yeast,

original: dus kyi khyad par gyi sgo nas gong nas gong du gnas skabs khyad par can thob pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dus kyi khyad par gyi sgo nas gong nas gong du gnas skabs khyad par can thob pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: is the attainment of a special state through the difference in time.

original: myos par 'gyur ba'i nus pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: myos par 'gyur ba'i nus pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The term “intoxicating power” is used.

original: myos pa ni rab tu dga' ba ste sems spro ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: myos pa ni rab tu dga' ba ste sems spro ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: Intoxication is a special kind of mental elation.

original: brgyal ba ni dran pa nyams pa'o //
analyzed: brgyal ba ni dran pa nyams pa'o //
translated: Fainting is a loss of memory.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'thab rtsod la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'thab rtsod la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The term “etc.” includes quarreling and so on.

original: nur nur po la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i khyad par can yongs su smin pa las zhes bya ba ni ma'i mngal du khu ba dang khrag gi thigs pa dang tshogs pa'i gnas skabs ni nur nur po yin la /
analyzed: nur nur po la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i khyad par can yongs su smin pa las zhes bya ba ni ma'i mngal du khu ba dang khrag gi thigs pa dang tshogs pa'i gnas skabs ni nur nur po yin la /
translated: From the maturation of a special kind of great elements that are in the kalala, etc.,

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni mer mer po la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni mer mer po la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The term “etc.” includes the arbuda, etc.

original: de nas sa la sogs pa 'byung ba khyad par can @220a * //
analyzed: de nas sa la sogs pa 'byung ba khyad par can @220a * //
translated: Then, from the maturation of those special elements, earth, etc.,

original: gang yod pa de rnams dus kyi khyad par gyis yongs su smin pa las blo dag skye ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang yod pa de rnams dus kyi khyad par gyis yongs su smin pa las blo dag skye ba yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: which exist in a special way due to time, the consciousnesses are born.

original: 'jig rten pha rol po dag yod pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni kha cig gis gang 'jig rten gzhan nas 'dir 'ongs pa dang / 'di nas pha rol du 'gro ba'i bdag yod do zhes smra ba dang / kha cig gis sems su smra ba dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol po dag yod pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni kha cig gis gang 'jig rten gzhan nas 'dir 'ongs pa dang / 'di nas pha rol du 'gro ba'i bdag yod do zhes smra ba dang / kha cig gis sems su smra ba dang /
translated: “There is no other world” means that some say that there is a self that comes from another world to this one and goes from this one to the other,

original: kha cig gis srog tu smra ba de rnams ni yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig gis srog tu smra ba de rnams ni yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: and some say that it is the mind, and some say that it is the life force.

original: gang du zhes bya ba ni bdag gam /
analyzed: gang du zhes bya ba ni bdag gam /
translated: “Where” means in the self,

original: sems sam / srog la'o //
analyzed: sems sam / srog la'o //
translated: the mind, or the life force.

original: byas pa'i las zhes bya ba ni skye ba gzhan dag la'o //
analyzed: byas pa'i las zhes bya ba ni skye ba gzhan dag la'o //
translated: “The action that is done” means in other lives.

original: 'jig rten gzhan du zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan du zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus su'o //
translated: “In another world” means in the future.

original: de nyid sems la bzhag nas sems pa 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: de nyid sems la bzhag nas sems pa 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams kyis /
translated: Having placed the mind in that, the mind arises from the elements.

original: mdzes ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mdzes ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Beautiful woman” and so on.

original: mdzes ma zhes bya ba ni gzugs khyad par can dang ldan pa'i bu mo la bod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: mdzes ma zhes bya ba ni gzugs khyad par can dang ldan pa'i bu mo la bod pa'i tshig go //
translated: “Beautiful woman” is a Tibetan word for a girl with special beauty.

original: legs par spyod cing zhes bya ba ni bgrod par bya ba dang ; bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa spongs la legs par longs spyod cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: legs par spyod cing zhes bya ba ni bgrod par bya ba dang ; bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa spongs la legs par longs spyod cig ces pa'o //
translated: The phrase enjoy it well means: having abandoned what is to be traversed and what is not to be traversed, enjoy it well.

original: bza' bar gyis zhes bya ba ni bza' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa dag spongs la bza' bar gyis shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: bza' bar gyis zhes bya ba ni bza' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa dag spongs la bza' bar gyis shig ces pa'o //
translated: The phrase eat it means: having abandoned what is to be eaten and what is not to be eaten, eat it.

original: lus mchog ces bya ba ni lus kyi khyad par can no //
analyzed: lus mchog ces bya ba ni lus kyi khyad par can no //
translated: The phrase this supreme body means: a body that is special.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar dpyad par bya zhe na /🔽'das gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar dpyad par bya zhe na / 'das gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Why should one investigate in this way?

original: gang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las 'das pa de dag khyod la mi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las 'das pa de dag khyod la mi 'byung ba ste /
translated: The text states: Whatever wholesome and unwholesome actions you have done in the past will not come to you.

original: khyod dang 'brel bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: khyod dang 'brel bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They will not be related to you.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lus 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lus 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The text states: Because this body is not yours.

original: 'jigs ma zhes bya ba ni bud med yin pas 'jigs ma zhes bod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs ma zhes bya ba ni bud med yin pas 'jigs ma zhes bod pa'o //
translated: A woman is called a fearful one because she is fearful.

original: song ba ldog par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang 'das pa de slar 'ong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: song ba ldog par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang 'das pa de slar 'ong ba ma yin no //
translated: “What has gone does not return” means that what has passed does not come back.

original: des na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las dag gi 'bras bu yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las dag gi 'bras bu yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the effects of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions do not exist.

original: lus 'di tshogs par gyur pa tsam zhig ste zhes bya ba ni lus 'di 'byung ba rnams tshogs pa tsam zhig yin la ;
analyzed: lus 'di tshogs par gyur pa tsam zhig ste zhes bya ba ni lus 'di 'byung ba rnams tshogs pa tsam zhig yin la ;
translated: “This body is a mere collection” means that this body is a mere collection of elements.

original: des na 'jig rten pha rol 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten pha rol 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: Therefore, no other world exists at all. This is the opponent’s position.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the response to that, he says,

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Here, this is the response,” and so on.

original: khyod kyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol med par smra bas so //
analyzed: khyod kyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol med par smra bas so //
translated: “You” refers to the one who advocates that the next world does not exist.

original: gzhan gyis lan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis lan brjod pa ni /
translated: The response of the opponent is stated:

original: @220b mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: @220b mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “Because it is not direct perception.”

original: gang gi phyir kho bo cag la 'jig rten pha rol mngon sum du ma gyur pa de'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol med par nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kho bo cag la 'jig rten pha rol mngon sum du ma gyur pa de'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol med par nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, “We ascertain that there is no other world because it is not manifest to us,”

original: de la slob dpon gyis lan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de la slob dpon gyis lan brjod pa ni /
translated: the master’s response to that is:

original: khyod kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: khyod kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “You say that it is not manifest.”

original: gang khyod kyis mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes gtan tshigs brjod pa de mngon sum gyi yul du gyur pa zhig gam /
analyzed: gang khyod kyis mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes gtan tshigs brjod pa de mngon sum gyi yul du gyur pa zhig gam /
translated: If you say that the reason is “because it is not manifest,” is that the object of manifest knowledge?

original: 'on te mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa zhig grang /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa zhig grang /
translated: Or is it not the object of manifest knowledge?

original: de la gal te mngon sum ma yin pa nyid de mngon sum gyi yul nyid du brjod na de la lan ston pa ni /
analyzed: de la gal te mngon sum ma yin pa nyid de mngon sum gyi yul nyid du brjod na de la lan ston pa ni /
translated: If you say that “it is not manifest” is the object of manifest knowledge, the response to that is:

original: 'jig rten pha rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “If other world is the object of manifest knowledge,” and so on.

original: gal te dngos po med pa mngon sum gyi yul yin na skyon ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa mngon sum gyi yul yin na skyon ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If you say, “What is the error if a non-thing is the object of manifest knowledge?”

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, Nāgārjuna says:

original: dngos po med na skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po med na skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the error if a non-thing is the object of manifest knowledge,🔽he says:🔽“If other world is the object of manifest knowledge,” and so on.

original: de'i phyir dngos po med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Non-thing.”

original: zla bo med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i zla bo ni dngos po med pa yin na de med pa'i phyir dngos po yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zla bo med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i zla bo ni dngos po med pa yin na de med pa'i phyir dngos po yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: “Because there is no counterpart” means that the counterpart of a thing is a non-thing. Because that does not exist, a thing also does not exist,

original: gnyis ka phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are mutually dependent.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag med na zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa ni med na dngos po med de /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag med na zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa ni med na dngos po med de /
translated: “If neither a thing nor a non-thing exists” means that if a non-thing does not exist, a thing does not exist.

original: dngos po med pa mngon sum yin pas dngos po med pa med la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa mngon sum yin pas dngos po med pa med la /
translated: Since a non-thing is directly perceptible, a non-thing does not exist.

original: de'i phyir gnyis ka med pas 'byung ba rnams kyi yod pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten pha rol med pa yang nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis ka med pas 'byung ba rnams kyi yod pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten pha rol med pa yang nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, since neither exists, the existence of the elements is undermined, and the nonexistence of a subsequent world is undermined,

original: dngos po med pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a non-thing does not exist.

original: des na mngon sum ma yin pa nyid ni mngon sum gyi yul nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: des na mngon sum ma yin pa nyid ni mngon sum gyi yul nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, since it is not directly perceptible, it is not the object of direct perception.

original: mngon sum gyi yul nyid ma yin par yang mi 'thad ces bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi yul nyid ma yin par yang mi 'thad ces bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is not tenable that it is not the object of perception,

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “If you say that the reason is not perceived because it is not an object of perception, etc.”

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni gang 'jig rten pha rol med pa bsgrub pa'i don du bkod pa'i gtan tshigs de nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni gang 'jig rten pha rol med pa bsgrub pa'i don du bkod pa'i gtan tshigs de nyid do //
translated: “That very” means that very reason which was stated in order to prove that there is no other world.

original: mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ma bzung bas zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gtan tshigs mngon sum gyis ma bzung bas so //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ma bzung bas zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gtan tshigs mngon sum gyis ma bzung bas so //
translated: “Because it is not an object of perception, it is not apprehended” means that because the reason which has the characteristic of not being an object of perception is not apprehended by perception.

original: ma bzung ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis gtan tshigs ma bzung bas so //🔽'jig rten pha rol med par rjes su dpog par 'gyur //
analyzed: ma bzung ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis gtan tshigs ma bzung bas so // 'jig rten pha rol med par rjes su dpog par 'gyur //
translated: “Because it is not apprehended” means that because the reason which has the characteristic of not being an object of perception is not apprehended.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol med par rjes su dpog par mi rigs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol med par rjes su dpog par mi rigs te /
translated: “One would infer that there is no other world” means that it is not reasonable to infer that there is no other world,

original: @221a * // gtan tshigs khong du ma chud pas so //
analyzed: @221a * // gtan tshigs khong du ma chud pas so //
translated: because the reason is not understood.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan dag gi lan yin te /
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan dag gi lan yin te /
translated: “If” and so on is the response of others.

original: gang gi phyir ma bzung ba gtan tshigs ma yin pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag pas mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi gtan tshigs bzung ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma bzung ba gtan tshigs ma yin pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag pas mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi gtan tshigs bzung ba yin la /
translated: Since what is not apprehended is not a reason, therefore, by inference, what is not apprehended is a reason that has the characteristic of not being a perception.

original: rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyis don bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyis don bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: And by the establishment of what is not a perception by inference, the meaning is established.

original: 'jig rten pha rol med par sgrub par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med par sgrub par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: One establishes that there is no afterlife.”

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the response to that,

original: rjes su dpag pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “from inference” and so on is stated.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas don bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas don bsgrub pa'o //
translated: “This” refers to the establishment of the meaning by inference.

original: khas ma blangs pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khas ma blangs pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is not accepted,

original: ji tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “how much less” and so on is stated.

original: myos par byed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i 'byung ba khyad par can chad yin pa de bzhin du sems pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i 'byung ba'i tshogs dbang po'i spyod yul du gyur pa gang yin pa de nyid skyes bu yin te /
analyzed: myos par byed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i 'byung ba khyad par can chad yin pa de bzhin du sems pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i 'byung ba'i tshogs dbang po'i spyod yul du gyur pa gang yin pa de nyid skyes bu yin te /
translated: Just as the special elements that have the capacity to intoxicate are cut off, so too, the collection of elements that have the capacity to think and that are the domain of the sense faculties is the person.

original: de las gzhan pa'i 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba'i skyes bu ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba'i skyes bu ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because apart from that, no person is seen that goes to another world.

original: 'dis ni sems pa 'byung ba las gyur par smra ba rnams kyis mngon sum kho na tshad ma nyid du khas blangs pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni sems pa 'byung ba las gyur par smra ba rnams kyis mngon sum kho na tshad ma nyid du khas blangs pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that those who say that thinking is derived from the elements accept that perception alone is valid cognition.

original: gzugs phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bzang mo ste bod pa'i tshig go ;
analyzed: gzugs phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bzang mo ste bod pa'i tshig go ;
translated: She is beautiful because she has perfect form.

original: / mang du thos pa 'ga' zhig gis 'jig rten pha rol yod pa yin no zhes gang smras pa de nyid spyang ki'i rjes dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: / mang du thos pa 'ga' zhig gis 'jig rten pha rol yod pa yin no zhes gang smras pa de nyid spyang ki'i rjes dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: Some who have heard many teachings say that the world beyond exists. That is like the footprint of a fox.

original: slu bar byed pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: slu bar byed pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is deceptive.

original: rtsis mkhan 'ga' zhig mi blun po'i yul khams 'ga' zhig tu 'ongs nas skyes bu mang po'i mdun du do nub spyang ki 'ongs nas khyed thams cad za bar 'gyur ro zhes smras so //
analyzed: rtsis mkhan 'ga' zhig mi blun po'i yul khams 'ga' zhig tu 'ongs nas skyes bu mang po'i mdun du do nub spyang ki 'ongs nas khyed thams cad za bar 'gyur ro zhes smras so //
translated: Some astrologers, having come to a certain country of fools, said in the presence of many people, “A wolf will come tonight and eat all of you.”

original: de nas de rnams 'jigs shing skrag nas mtshan mo khyim dor nas ril song ngo //
analyzed: de nas de rnams 'jigs shing skrag nas mtshan mo khyim dor nas ril song ngo //
translated: Then, frightened and terrified, they abandoned their homes at night and fled.

original: rtsis mkhan des lam du spyang ki'i rjes mang po byas nas de rnams kyi khyim du song ste nor rnams blangs nas skye bo mang po de rnams bslus par byas so //
analyzed: rtsis mkhan des lam du spyang ki'i rjes mang po byas nas de rnams kyi khyim du song ste nor rnams blangs nas skye bo mang po de rnams bslus par byas so //
translated: The astrologers, having made many wolf tracks on the road, went to their homes and took their wealth, and thus deceived those many people.

original: de bzhin du mang du thos pa'i tshig kyang slu bar byed pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mang du thos pa'i tshig kyang slu bar byed pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the words of the learned are also deceptive.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa med pa nyid khyod kyis khas blangs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa med pa nyid khyod kyis khas blangs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, you have accepted that there is no inference.

original: des na rjes su dpag pas mngon sum ma yin pa nyid 'grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pas mngon sum ma yin pa nyid 'grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, it is not the case that non-perception is established by inference. This is the meaning.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni /
translated: The word “etc.”🔽refers to

original: bzang mo ma shi'i bar du bde bar 'tshos //
analyzed: bzang mo ma shi'i bar du bde bar 'tshos //
translated: Good woman, you have lived happily until death.

original: @221b shi nas de yi spyod yul min //
analyzed: @221b shi nas de yi spyod yul min //
translated: But after death, that is not your domain.

original: lus ni thal ba bzhin song nas //
analyzed: lus ni thal ba bzhin song nas //
translated: The body has gone like ashes.

original: slar skye bar yang ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: slar skye bar yang ga la 'gyur //
translated: How can it be born again?

original: zhes bya ba bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: This is the summary.

original: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la sogs pa'o //
translated: “All” refers to the Bhagavān Buddha and so on.

original: skur ba 'debs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skur ba 'debs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Denigrating” means saying things like “The Bhagavān Buddha does not exist.”

original: sun 'byin pa bshad zin pa'i lam gyi rjes su 'brangs te zhes bya ba ni sngar ji ltar 'jig rten pha rol skur pa 'debs pa rnams la skyon brjod pa de'i rjes su 'brangs nas te /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa bshad zin pa'i lam gyi rjes su 'brangs te zhes bya ba ni sngar ji ltar 'jig rten pha rol skur pa 'debs pa rnams la skyon brjod pa de'i rjes su 'brangs nas te /
translated: “The refutation should be understood by following the path that has been explained” means that following the previous explanation of the faults of those who deny the existence of other worlds,

original: 'di ltar khyod kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yod pa ma yin no snyam pa'i nges pa ni ga las yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yod pa ma yin no snyam pa'i nges pa ni ga las yin /
translated: “How do you know that the Bhagavān Buddha does not exist?”

original: mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: “Because it is not directly perceived.”

original: mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mngon sum ma yin pa nyid ci mngon sum zhig gam /
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mngon sum ma yin pa nyid ci mngon sum zhig gam /
translated: Because it is not a direct perception, the Buddha Bhagavat is not a direct perception. How could it be a direct perception or not a direct perception?

original: mngon sum ma yin pa zhig yin grang zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar sun 'byin bshad zin pa'i rjes su 'brangs la sun 'byin pa khong du chud par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa zhig yin grang zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar sun 'byin bshad zin pa'i rjes su 'brangs la sun 'byin pa khong du chud par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: One should understand the refutation in accordance with the refutation previously explained.

original: nga ni 'jig rten pha rol la skur pa 'debs pa gang 'jig rten pha rol med do snyam pa'i shes pa yod pa de log pa'i shes pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nga ni 'jig rten pha rol la skur pa 'debs pa gang 'jig rten pha rol med do snyam pa'i shes pa yod pa de log pa'i shes pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: I teach that the denial of the other world, the cognition that thinks “the other world does not exist,” is a wrong cognition.🔽In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Moreover,” and so on.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni skyon gzhan yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni skyon gzhan yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: “Moreover” means that another fault should be stated.

original: yang pa dag ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni rnam pa de lta bu gzhan yang mi bden pa kho na yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang pa dag ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni rnam pa de lta bu gzhan yang mi bden pa kho na yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation of “not true” is that another kind is also only untrue.

original: mthong ba'i dngos po phyin ci log tu rtog pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba rnams rang bzhin med pa la rang bzhin dang bcas par bzung bas so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i dngos po phyin ci log tu rtog pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba rnams rang bzhin med pa la rang bzhin dang bcas par bzung bas so //
translated: “The things that are seen are imagined in a distorted way” means that the elements, which are essenceless, are apprehended as having essences.

original: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa med par shes gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol med par shes pa dang sangs rgyas pa med par 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa med par shes gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol med par shes pa dang sangs rgyas pa med par 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Moreover, those who know that there is no world beyond, etc.” means those who assert that there is no world beyond and that there is no Buddha.

original: 'byung ba de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'byung ba de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Those elements” and so forth.

original: sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rnams bdag nyid gang zhig gis te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rnams bdag nyid gang zhig gis te /
translated: In virtue of what nature do the elements such as earth, etc.

original: rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid kyis khyod kyi blo'i yul du byung ba de rnams de'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang bcas pa nyid kyis khyod kyi blo'i yul du byung ba de rnams de'i bdag nyid de /
translated: become objects of your mind? Those elements, which have that nature, do not exist.

original: rang bzhin dang bcas pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang bcas pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is, they do not exist in virtue of having an essence.

original: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba rnams la'o //
translated: “In that way” means in virtue of the elements.

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni sems pa 'byung ba las gyur par smra ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni sems pa 'byung ba las gyur par smra ba rnams la'o //
translated: “To whom” means to those who say that volition is derived from the elements.

original: yid kyi mun pa mthug po zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa shin tu shas che ba'o //🔽des na 'jig rten pha rol @222a * //
analyzed: yid kyi mun pa mthug po zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa shin tu shas che ba'o // des na 'jig rten pha rol @222a * //
translated: The phrase “thick darkness of the mind” means a very great lack of knowledge.

original: yang dag rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: yang dag rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, one does not understand the world beyond.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol la skur pa 'debs pa des 'jig rten pha rol yang dag par ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur te yid kyi mun pa mthug po yod pas khong du chud par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol la skur pa 'debs pa des 'jig rten pha rol yang dag par ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur te yid kyi mun pa mthug po yod pas khong du chud par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: How could one who denies the world beyond understand the world beyond correctly? The meaning is that one does not comprehend it because of the thick darkness of the mind.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says,

original: sa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “earth” and so on.

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang bcas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang bcas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase “in what way” refers to what is natural.

original: 'dis ni 'jig rten pha rol ma rtogs pa nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'jig rten pha rol ma rtogs pa nyid bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni sems pa 'byung ba las gyur par smra ba'i rang gi bdag nyid do //

translated: When you accept the existence of the nature of the primary elements such as earth, at that time, just like that,

translated: just as at that time the body is the equivalent support for the aspect of that view and the distorted view exists, so too it is here.🔽The meaning of this is that when the nature of the primary elements is understood, the body is the equivalent support for the distorted view, and since the nature of the primary elements is not established, the appearance of their existence is the distorted consciousness that exists.

translated: Likewise, even at the time of understanding that obstructs the other world, the existence of a distorted consciousness would follow, because of possessing a body that is the same support for the aspect of that view.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: lus kyi tshig gi don ston pa ni /
