translated: The meaning of the word “body” is shown:

original: lus ni khog pa'o zhes smos so //
analyzed: lus ni khog pa'o zhes smos so //
translated: “Body” is the torso.

original: de'i lta ba'i rnam pa'i tshig bsdu ba ston pa ni de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i lta ba'i rnam pa'i tshig bsdu ba ston pa ni de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The summary of the words of the aspects of its view is stated in the words “its” and so forth.

original: rten mtshungs lus dang zhes bya ba'i tshig bsdu ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: rten mtshungs lus dang zhes bya ba'i tshig bsdu ba ston pa ni /
translated: The summary of the words “same basis, body” is stated in the words

original: bstan pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bstan pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “taught” and so forth.

original: khyad par gyi tshig bsdu ba'o zhes bya ba ni rten dang mtshungs pa'i tshig dag lus kyi tshig gi khyad par yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi tshig bsdu ba'o zhes bya ba ni rten dang mtshungs pa'i tshig dag lus kyi tshig gi khyad par yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The summary of the words of the distinction is stated in the words “distinction” and so forth.

original: de'i lta ba'i rnam pa dang rten mtshungs lus zhes bya ba'i tshig dag gi bsdu ba ston pa ni rten du mtshungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i lta ba'i rnam pa dang rten mtshungs lus zhes bya ba'i tshig dag gi bsdu ba ston pa ni rten du mtshungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The summary of the words “same basis, body” of the aspects of its view is stated in the words “same basis” and so forth.

original: ldan pa'i tshig gi don ston pa ni /
analyzed: ldan pa'i tshig gi don ston pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the words of possession is stated in the words

original: de 'di la yod pas na ma btub kyi rkyen no zhes bya /
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas na ma btub kyi rkyen no zhes bya /
translated: “because it exists in this, it is a condition.”

original: ma btub ces bya ba ni ldan pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ma btub ces bya ba ni ldan pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “Possession” means “to have.”

original: de'i dngos po ni zhes bya ba ni de'i don te bsdus pa'i don gang yin pa de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni zhes bya ba ni de'i don te bsdus pa'i don gang yin pa de nyid do //
translated: “Its entity” means “its meaning,” that which is the meaning of the summary.

original: sngar mtshungs pa'i sgra'i rnam grangs bstan nas /🔽da ni don bshad par bya @223a * //
analyzed: sngar mtshungs pa'i sgra'i rnam grangs bstan nas / da ni don bshad par bya @223a * //
translated: Having taught the synonyms of the word “similar” above,

original: ba'i phyir / rten de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ba'i phyir / rten de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: now, in order to explain the meaning, he says, “That basis . . .” and so on.

original: rten de ni zhes bya ba ni lus so //
analyzed: rten de ni zhes bya ba ni lus so //
translated: “ That basis” is the body.

original: the tshom gyi zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol yod dam med snyam pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom gyi zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol yod dam med snyam pa'o //
translated: “ Doubt” is the thought, “Does the next world exist or not?”

original: rten nyid du zhes bya ba ni rgyu nyid du'o //
analyzed: rten nyid du zhes bya ba ni rgyu nyid du'o //
translated: “ As a basis” is as a cause.

original: rten du mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni lus mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: rten du mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni lus mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur bas so //
translated: “ Because of becoming similar as a basis” is because of becoming similar as a body.

original: dpe dang don gyi gnas skabs tha dad pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe dang don gyi gnas skabs tha dad pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the difference between the example and the meaning,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Thus . . .” and so on.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni sems pa 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni sems pa 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
translated: “ That” is the arising of the thought.

original: gnas skabs gnyis ston pa ni gcig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gnas skabs gnyis ston pa ni gcig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to teach the two states, he says, “One . . .” and so on.

original: de la gcig ni phyogs su byas pa nyid kyis na zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol la skur pa 'debs pa'i gnas skabs phyogs su byas pa nyid kyis so //🔽de tshe bzhin zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ston pa ni /
analyzed: de la gcig ni phyogs su byas pa nyid kyis na zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol la skur pa 'debs pa'i gnas skabs phyogs su byas pa nyid kyis so // de tshe bzhin zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ston pa ni /
translated: One of them is just by being taken as a position means just by being taken as a position in the context of denying a next world.

original: gnas skabs der yang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gnas skabs der yang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The meaning of the words at that time is shown by at that time too.

original: der yang zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can gyi yod pa nyid du khas len pa'i dus na'o //🔽de la gzhan gyi phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
analyzed: der yang zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can gyi yod pa nyid du khas len pa'i dus na'o // de la gzhan gyi phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
translated: The word too means at the time of accepting existence that has the nature of the elements.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te bdag nyid ces bya ba ni sems pa 'byung ba las gyur pa ni bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te bdag nyid ces bya ba ni sems pa 'byung ba las gyur pa ni bdag nyid can no //
translated: There, setting forth the opponent's former position, he says But if and so on. By itself means that which has the nature of arising.

original: dpe bsgrub byas stong pa yin no //
analyzed: dpe bsgrub byas stong pa yin no //
translated: The example is empty of the probandum.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can gyi yod pa nyid mthong ba'i dus na phyin ci log tu mthong ba med pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can gyi yod pa nyid mthong ba'i dus na phyin ci log tu mthong ba med pas so //
translated: This is because when seeing existence that has the nature of the elements, there is no seeing that is distorted.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: There, in order to show the reply, he says

original: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The statement And that... and so on.

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par mthong ba yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par mthong ba yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: And that does not exist means that the non-erroneous seeing does not exist.

original: yang sems las 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams kyis smra ba ni 'byung bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yang sems las 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams kyis smra ba ni 'byung bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Again, the statement The elements are the self of the mind... and so on refers to the assertions of the Cittamātra.

original: de la lan ston pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la lan ston pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The statement But it is not shown to be a response... and so on.

original: bsgrubs zin pa nyid ston pa ni 'byung ba de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽bshad zin pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgrubs zin pa nyid ston pa ni 'byung ba de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / bshad zin pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The statement Those elements... and so on shows that it is already established.

original: gang gi phyir na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show what has already been explained, the statement Because... and so on.

original: dngos po rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽skyon 'di thams cad la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // skyon 'di thams cad la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, the statement Things... and so on.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to apply all of these faults, the statement In the same way... and so on.🔽The statement The elements... and so on.🔽The statement The elements... and so on.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa la skur pa 'debs pa dang zhes bya ba ni thams @223b cad mkhyen pa nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes skur pa 'debs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa la skur pa 'debs pa dang zhes bya ba ni thams @223b cad mkhyen pa nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes skur pa 'debs par byed pa'o //
translated: Denigrating omniscience means denigrating omniscience by saying, Omniscience does not exist.

original: dngos po yod pa nyid du smra ba dang zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod pa nyid yin zhes smra ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa nyid du smra ba dang zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod pa nyid yin zhes smra ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Proponents of the existence of things are those who say, Things exist.

original: dngos po med pa nyid smra ba dang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dngos po yod pa ma yin no zhes smra ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa nyid smra ba dang zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dngos po yod pa ma yin no zhes smra ba ste /
translated: Proponents of the nonexistence of things are those who say, External things do not exist,

original: sems tsam du smra ba rnams so ;
analyzed: sems tsam du smra ba rnams so ;
translated: such as the Proponents of Mind Only.

original: / dbang phyug dang zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug 'gro ba'i byed pa por smra ba rnams so //
analyzed: / dbang phyug dang zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug 'gro ba'i byed pa por smra ba rnams so //
translated: Ishvara are those who say that Ishvara is the creator of the world.

original: dus dang zhes bya ba ni dus kyi khyad par las dngos po rnams skye ba yin no zhes dus su smra ba'o //
analyzed: dus dang zhes bya ba ni dus kyi khyad par las dngos po rnams skye ba yin no zhes dus su smra ba'o //
translated: Time are those who say that things arise from a particular time.

original: rdul dang zhes bya ba ni rdul gnyis la sogs pa'i rim pas bum pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams skye ba yin no zhes smra ba'o //
analyzed: rdul dang zhes bya ba ni rdul gnyis la sogs pa'i rim pas bum pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams skye ba yin no zhes smra ba'o //
translated: Atoms are those who say that things such as pots arise from the sequence of two atoms and so on.

original: rang bzhin dang zhes bya ba ni snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rang bzhin las 'bras bu rnams skye ba yin no zhes smra ba ni rang bzhin smra ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang zhes bya ba ni snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rang bzhin las 'bras bu rnams skye ba yin no zhes smra ba ni rang bzhin smra ba'o //
translated: “Essentialists” are those who maintain that effects arise from the nature of sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: ngo bo nyid smra ba ni zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid las 'gro ba thams cad skye ba yin no zhes ngo bo nyid smra ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid smra ba ni zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid las 'gro ba thams cad skye ba yin no zhes ngo bo nyid smra ba'o //
translated: “ Essentialists” are those who maintain that all of the world arises from the essence of the elements.

original: de dag las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni bdag la sogs pa smra ba rnams so //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni bdag la sogs pa smra ba rnams so //
translated: “ Others” are those who maintain that the world arises from God and so on.

original: rang gi ji lta ba yin pa smra ba na zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i bdag nyid yod pa nyid du khas len pa'i sgo nas thams cad mkhyen pa la skur pa 'debs pa dang / dngos po yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i shes pa la yang rtogs pa phyin ci log sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi ji lta ba yin pa smra ba na zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i bdag nyid yod pa nyid du khas len pa'i sgo nas thams cad mkhyen pa la skur pa 'debs pa dang / dngos po yod pa nyid la sogs pa'i shes pa la yang rtogs pa phyin ci log sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: “ Those who maintain that things exist as they appear” are those who, by accepting the reality of the elements, deny omniscience and apply their erroneous understanding to the knowledge of the existence of things and so on.

original: rtogs pa phyin ci log tu sbyor ba la phyogs tsam zhig bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtogs pa phyin ci log tu sbyor ba la phyogs tsam zhig bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to indicate just a part of the erroneous understanding, he says:

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: shes bya'i rang bzhin phyin ci log tu lta ba rtogs bya ste zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la skur pa 'debs pa gang yin pa de ni shes bya'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: shes bya'i rang bzhin phyin ci log tu lta ba rtogs bya ste zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la skur pa 'debs pa gang yin pa de ni shes bya'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: The nature of the knowable is the object of realization, i.e., the one who deprecates the Bhagavat Buddha.

original: de log pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid du shes par gyis zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de log pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid du shes par gyis zhes pa'o //
translated: One should know that he is the one who has a self that is endowed with a consciousness that is perverted with regard to that.

original: de'i lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten dang mtshungs pa'i lus dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten dang mtshungs pa'i lus dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'o //🔽de ltar dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten dang mtshungs pa'i lus dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten dang mtshungs pa'i lus dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa'o // de ltar dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Because he is endowed with a body that is the basis of the aspect of that view, i.e., because he is endowed with a body that is the basis of the aspect of the view that deprecates the Bhagavat.

original: gang tshe 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang tshe 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the example in that way, he says, When the elements, etc.

original: de tshe bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'byung ba'i bdag nyid yod pa nyid du khas len pa'i tshe de'i lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten du mtshungs pa'i lus dang ldan pa nyid yod pa'i @224a * //
analyzed: de tshe bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'byung ba'i bdag nyid yod pa nyid du khas len pa'i tshe de'i lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten du mtshungs pa'i lus dang ldan pa nyid yod pa'i @224a * //
translated: “At that time” means that at the time of accepting the existence of the nature of the elements, the body that is the basis of the aspect of that view exists.

original: lus dang ldan pa nyid yod pa dang / phyin ci log gi shes pa'i bdag nyid yod pa de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: lus dang ldan pa nyid yod pa dang / phyin ci log gi shes pa'i bdag nyid yod pa de bzhin du'o //
translated: The existence of the body and the existence of the nature of the erroneous consciousness exist in the same way.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni shes bya'i rang bzhin phyin ci log tu lta bar rtogs bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni shes bya'i rang bzhin phyin ci log tu lta bar rtogs bya ste /
translated: The words “and so on” indicate that the nature of the object of knowledge is understood to be viewed erroneously.

original: dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i dus su bdag nyid ni //
analyzed: dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i dus su bdag nyid ni //
translated: At the time of establishing entities,

original: de yi lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten mtshungs lus dang ldan nyid phyir //
analyzed: de yi lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten mtshungs lus dang ldan nyid phyir //
translated: the body that is the basis of the aspect of that view exists.

original: gang tshe 'byung ba'i bdag nyid khas len de tshe bzhin //
analyzed: gang tshe 'byung ba'i bdag nyid khas len de tshe bzhin //
translated: At the time of accepting the nature of the elements, the body exists in the same way.

original: zhes bya ba dang / pha rol bdag nyid 'gog par byed pa'i dus su bdag nyid ni //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / pha rol bdag nyid 'gog par byed pa'i dus su bdag nyid ni //
translated: And at the time of refuting the nature of the opponent,

original: shes bya'i rang bzhin phyin ci log tu lta bar rtogs bya ste //
analyzed: shes bya'i rang bzhin phyin ci log tu lta bar rtogs bya ste //
translated: the nature of the object of knowledge is understood to be viewed erroneously.

original: de yi lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten mtshungs lus dang ldan nyid phyir //
analyzed: de yi lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten mtshungs lus dang ldan nyid phyir //
translated: Because it has a body that is the support of the aspect of that view,

original: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid yod nyid de tshe khas len bzhin //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid yod nyid de tshe khas len bzhin //
translated: You accept that consciousness exists.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du dbang phyug la sogs pa la yang dbang phyug sgrub par byed pa'i dus su bdag nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du dbang phyug la sogs pa la yang dbang phyug sgrub par byed pa'i dus su bdag nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And similarly, with regard to Īśvara and so on, when you prove that Īśvara exists, you should apply the argument “because it has a body that is the support of the aspect of that view.”

original: gal te khyed cag la yang rtsod pa 'di mtshungs pa yin te /🔽'di ltar gang gi tshe khyod kyis sems tsam 'gog par byed pa de'i tshe na de'i lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten mtshungs lus dang ldan nyid phyir zhes bya ba 'dis khyod la phyin ci log gi shes pa dang ldan par bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te khyed cag la yang rtsod pa 'di mtshungs pa yin te / 'di ltar gang gi tshe khyod kyis sems tsam 'gog par byed pa de'i tshe na de'i lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten mtshungs lus dang ldan nyid phyir zhes bya ba 'dis khyod la phyin ci log gi shes pa dang ldan par bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: If you say that this argument is equally applicable to us,🔽then when you refute the mind only, you should be proven to have a distorted consciousness because of having a body that is the support of the aspect of that view.

original: khyod kyis sems tsam 'gog pa'i dus su sems pa la grub pa'i gzugs med pa khas blangs pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs dper brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: khyod kyis sems tsam 'gog pa'i dus su sems pa la grub pa'i gzugs med pa khas blangs pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs dper brjod pa yin la /
translated: When you refute mind only, you accept that there is a body that is established by thought, and you cite the example of the body’s condition.

original: de'i tshe dbu ma pa khyod la rnam par shes pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i rten du mtshungs pa'i lus dang ldan pa nyid dang phyin ci log gi shes pa yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe dbu ma pa khyod la rnam par shes pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i rten du mtshungs pa'i lus dang ldan pa nyid dang phyin ci log gi shes pa yang yod pa yin te /
translated: At that time, you Followers of the Middle Way would have a body that is the same as the one that supports the denigration of consciousness. You would also have a distorted consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de la ltos pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na de la ltos pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Because if any thing existed, it would be independent of anything else.

original: gang gi tshe yod pa nyid med pas med pa nyid med pa de'i tshe gzugs med par khas len pa'i dus su phyin ci log gi shes pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yod pa nyid med pas med pa nyid med pa de'i tshe gzugs med par khas len pa'i dus su phyin ci log gi shes pa yod pa yin no //
translated: When existence does not exist, nonexistence does not exist. At that time, when you accept that forms do not exist, you would have a distorted consciousness.

original: des na sems tsam pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten du mtshungs pa'i lus dang ldan pa nyid yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na sems tsam pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten du mtshungs pa'i lus dang ldan pa nyid yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since you, the Proponents of Mind Only, have a body that is the same as the one that supports the view that denigrates consciousness,🔽you would also have a distorted consciousness. The absurd consequence of your position being the same as ours is inescapable.”

original: phyin ci log gi shes pa yang yod pas khyod la yang thal bar 'gyur ba 'di mtshungs so snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu nas lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi shes pa yang yod pas khyod la yang thal bar 'gyur ba 'di mtshungs so snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu nas lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: The reply to this qualm is as follows.

original: yod pa dang med pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Existence and nonexistence” and so on.

original: gnas skabs 'gar yang zhes bya ba ni sems tsam 'gog pa'i @224b gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'gar yang zhes bya ba ni sems tsam 'gog pa'i @224b gnas skabs na'o //
translated: “At no time” is the context of the refutation of mind only.

original: mi 'dod pa thob pa yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log gi shes pa thob pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa thob pa yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log gi shes pa thob pa med pa'o //
translated: “There is no obtaining of the undesirable” means that there is no obtaining of a distorted consciousness.

original: 'di'i don ni gal te kho bo cag gis 'ga' zhig med pa nyid du sgrub par byed na ni de'i tshe kho bo cag la phyin ci log gi shes par thal ba'i skyon 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gal te kho bo cag gis 'ga' zhig med pa nyid du sgrub par byed na ni de'i tshe kho bo cag la phyin ci log gi shes par thal ba'i skyon 'byung ba yin la /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If we were to prove that something does not exist, then the error of our having a distorted consciousness would ensue.

original: 'on kyang gdod nas skye ba med pa nyid kyis phyogs gang yang khas mi len pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang gdod nas skye ba med pa nyid kyis phyogs gang yang khas mi len pa'i phyir /
translated: However, since from the beginning we do not accept any position,

original: mi 'dod pa 'thob pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa 'thob pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: we do not obtain the undesirable.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis gzhan gyi phyogs thams cad ma lus par gsal bar nges par bya'o zhes mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis gzhan gyi phyogs thams cad ma lus par gsal bar nges par bya'o zhes mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: This verse is to be understood as a summary that clarifies all the other positions.

original: de'i phyir mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The wise one, etc.”

original: yongs su sgyur la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol 'gog pa'i dus su zhes bya ba la sogs pa ming yongs su bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su sgyur la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol 'gog pa'i dus su zhes bya ba la sogs pa ming yongs su bsgyur ba'o //
translated: “Completely transform” means that the name “time of cessation of the next world” is completely transformed.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs bkag pa'i 'bras bu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs bkag pa'i 'bras bu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the result of refuting the opponent’s position, it is said:

original: rtog pa'i dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rtog pa'i dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “The net of conceptualization, etc.”

original: ji srid du dngos po la mngon par zhen pa yod pa de srid du rtog pa rnams 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: ji srid du dngos po la mngon par zhen pa yod pa de srid du rtog pa rnams 'jug pa yin la /
translated: As long as there is attachment to things, conceptualizations operate.

original: gang gi tshe dngos po rnams ma grub pa de'i tshe na rtog pa rnams log pa las thar pa thob par 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po rnams ma grub pa de'i tshe na rtog pa rnams log pa las thar pa thob par 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: When things are not established, then conceptualizations are reversed, and liberation is attained.

original: de la gzhan dag na re gal te gdod ma nas skye ba med pa yin pas yod pa dang med pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir med pa nyid sgrub par mi byed kyang gdod ma nas skye ba med pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: de la gzhan dag na re gal te gdod ma nas skye ba med pa yin pas yod pa dang med pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir med pa nyid sgrub par mi byed kyang gdod ma nas skye ba med pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
translated: In this regard, others say that if non-arising from the beginning is not established because existence and nonexistence are not established, then nonexistence is not established, but non-arising from the beginning is to be established.

original: gdod ma nas skye ba med par sgrub par byed na ni gang du skye ba med par grub pa'i dpe 'ga' zhig nges par brjod dgos la /🔽dpe de la gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i shes pa ni log pa'i shes pa kho na yin te /🔽skye ba ma grub pa'i phyir skye ba med pa yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdod ma nas skye ba med par sgrub par byed na ni gang du skye ba med par grub pa'i dpe 'ga' zhig nges par brjod dgos la / dpe de la gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i shes pa ni log pa'i shes pa kho na yin te / skye ba ma grub pa'i phyir skye ba med pa yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one were to prove that there is no arising from the beginning, one would definitely have to state some example in which there is no arising.

original: des na de'i khas len pa'i dus su de'i lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten du mtshungs pa'i lus dang ldan pa nyid dang / phyin ci log gi shes pa yang yod pas gang du gdod ma nas skye ba med par sgrub par byed pa der phyin ci log gi shes par thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas /🔽ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: “That” refers to the same consequence.

original: ci'i phyir yod pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yod pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it nonexistent?

original: de la lan ni /🔽kho bo cag ces bya ba la @225a * //
analyzed: de la lan ni / kho bo cag ces bya ba la @225a * //
translated: The response to that is

original: sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “We do not assert” and so on.

original: ci ltar sems pa 'byung ba las gyur par smra ba rnams la phyin ci log par bsgrub pa la dpe yod pa de bzhin du dbu ma pas skye ba dang skye ba med pa dang yod pa dang med pa nyid la sogs pa khas mi len pa'i phyir
analyzed: ci ltar sems pa 'byung ba las gyur par smra ba rnams la phyin ci log par bsgrub pa la dpe yod pa de bzhin du dbu ma pas skye ba dang skye ba med pa dang yod pa dang med pa nyid la sogs pa khas mi len pa'i phyir
translated: Just as for the proponents of origination from existent effects, there is an example of an erroneous proof, in the same way, for the Followers of the Middle Way, who do not assert arising, nonarising, existence, nonexistence, and so on,

original: phyin ci log par bsgrub pa la dpe yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: phyin ci log par bsgrub pa la dpe yod pa ma yin la /
translated: there is no example of an erroneous proof.🔽The example and the probandum are both primordially free from arising.

original: gang dpe dang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dag la gdod ma nas skye ba med par brjod pa de ni gzhan la grags pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can dang dpe'i chos can dang skye ba la brten nas brjod pa yin pas skyon yod pa ma yin no
analyzed: gang dpe dang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dag la gdod ma nas skye ba med par brjod pa de ni gzhan la grags pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can dang dpe'i chos can dang skye ba la brten nas brjod pa yin pas skyon yod pa ma yin no
translated: The Followers of the Middle Way state this in reliance on the subject of the probandum and the subject of the example that are renowned to others.

original: zhes pa'o // kho bo cag la skyon de mi mtshungs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi yon tan yang yod pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // kho bo cag la skyon de mi mtshungs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi yon tan yang yod pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Not only do we not have the fault, but we also have the virtue. In order to demonstrate this, he says,

original: 'jig rten na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In the world, etc.

original: 'jig rten gzhan rtogs yod pa nyid du rtogs pa'i dus su zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol du rtogs pa'i sems can rnams yod pa nyid du khong du chud pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan rtogs yod pa nyid du rtogs pa'i dus su zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol du rtogs pa'i sems can rnams yod pa nyid du khong du chud pa'i dus su'o //
translated: When one realizes the existence of the other world, i.e., when one understands the existence of the sentient beings who are reborn in the other world.

original: bdag ces bya ba ni dbu ma pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni dbu ma pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The self, i.e., the Madhyamika,

original: shes bya'i rang bzhin dam pa'i don ni lta bar rtogs pa ste zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gzhan du rtogs pa'i sems can yod pa nyid ni shes bya yin la /
analyzed: shes bya'i rang bzhin dam pa'i don ni lta bar rtogs pa ste zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gzhan du rtogs pa'i sems can yod pa nyid ni shes bya yin la /
translated: realizes the nature of the knowable, the highest truth, as the view. The existence of the sentient beings who are reborn in the other world is the knowable.

original: de'i rang bzhin ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ngo bo ste /
translated: Its nature is its essence.

original: de'i dam pa'i don du lta ba ni phyin ci ma log par khong du chud pa ste /
analyzed: de'i dam pa'i don du lta ba ni phyin ci ma log par khong du chud pa ste /
translated: The view of that as the highest truth is the nonerroneous understanding.

original: gzhan gyis de ltar shes par gyis shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis de ltar shes par gyis shig ces pa'o //
translated: One should understand it in that way.

original: bdag gi lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten mtshungs lus dang ldan pa nyid phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol yod par lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten du mtshungs pa'i lus dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten mtshungs lus dang ldan pa nyid phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol yod par lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten du mtshungs pa'i lus dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis of the form of the view of self, and because it is endowed with a body that is similar to the basis of the form of the view of self.

original: de la dpe ston pa ni /
analyzed: de la dpe ston pa ni /
translated: The example is given:

original: gang gi tshe ni bdag med par rtogs par khas len de tshe bzhin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ni bdag med par rtogs par khas len de tshe bzhin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: When one accepts the understanding of selflessness, then it is just like that.

original: ci ltar bdag med khong du chud pa'i dus na bdag gi lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten du mtshungs pa'i lus dang ldan pa nyid dang / phyin ci ma log par lta ba yang yod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang bdag gi lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten du mtshungs pa'i lus dang ldan pa nyid dang /
analyzed: ci ltar bdag med khong du chud pa'i dus na bdag gi lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten du mtshungs pa'i lus dang ldan pa nyid dang / phyin ci ma log par lta ba yang yod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang bdag gi lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten du mtshungs pa'i lus dang ldan pa nyid dang /
translated: Just as when one understands selflessness, one is endowed with a body that is similar to the basis of the form of the view of self, and one has an unmistaken view, in the same way, here too, one is endowed with a body that is similar to the basis of the form of the view of self,

original: phyin ci ma log par lta ba nyid kyang yod pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par lta ba nyid kyang yod pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: and one has an unmistaken view.

original: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yod pa la yang sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yod pa la yang sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, it should be applied to the existence of omniscience.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: So too, etc.

original: 'di na thams cad mkhyen pa yod ces rtogs pa'i dus su zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yod pa yin no zhes khong du chud @225b ba'i dus su'o //
analyzed: 'di na thams cad mkhyen pa yod ces rtogs pa'i dus su zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yod pa yin no zhes khong du chud @225b ba'i dus su'o //
translated: Here, when one understands that omniscience exists, etc. means when one comprehends that omniscience exists.

original: shes bya'i rang bzhin dam pa'i don ni lta ba rtogs bya ste //
analyzed: shes bya'i rang bzhin dam pa'i don ni lta ba rtogs bya ste //
translated: The nature of the knowable, the ultimate, is the view that is to be realized.

original: zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yod pa nyid du phyin ci ma log par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yod pa nyid du phyin ci ma log par mthong ba'o //
translated: This means that one sees without error that omniscience exists.

original: gtan tshigs dang dpe dag ni de kho na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang dpe dag ni de kho na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The reason and example are just that.

original: bdag gi lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten mtshungs lus dang ldan nyid phyir //
analyzed: bdag gi lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten mtshungs lus dang ldan nyid phyir //
translated: Because it has a body that is the basis of the aspect of the view.

original: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: This is the reason.

original: gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe /
translated: When one says,

original: bdag med rtogs par khas len de tshe bzhin //
analyzed: bdag med rtogs par khas len de tshe bzhin //
translated: Just as when one accepts the realization of selflessness.

original: zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
translated: This is the example.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yod pa yin no snyam pa'i lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten mtshungs pa'i lus dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yod pa yin no snyam pa'i lta ba'i rnam pa'i rten mtshungs pa'i lus dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: because it is endowed with a body that is the basis of the aspect of the view that thinks, “The state of omniscience exists.”

original: gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.🔽Similarly, one should apply to the ascertainment of all things.

original: de bzhin du dngos po thams cad nges pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug la sogs pa 'gegs pa'i dus su yang de bzhin du gtan tshigs dang dpe la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po thams cad nges pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug la sogs pa 'gegs pa'i dus su yang de bzhin du gtan tshigs dang dpe la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Even when refuting Īśvara and so on, one should apply the reason, the example, and so on in the same way.

original: de'i phyir tshul 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: Therefore, by this method, as was previously explained.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
translated: The opponent’s position is set forth:

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here someone says:

original: 'o na ci ltar skye zhes bya ba ni skye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar skye zhes bya ba ni skye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: How is it that they arise? Because we see that they arise.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reply to that,

original: bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “The reply is as follows.”

original: dmigs par 'gyur ba zhig gam zhes bya ba ni de la skye bar 'gyur ba dmigs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs par 'gyur ba zhig gam zhes bya ba ni de la skye bar 'gyur ba dmigs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “Would be the object” means that would be the object of arising.

original: skye ba'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag dang / gzhan dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dor ba'i skye ba'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan mi srid pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag dang / gzhan dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dor ba'i skye ba'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan mi srid pa'o //
translated: “Because another conception of arising is not possible” means that another conception of arising is not possible, having discarded the conceptions of self, other, both, and neither.

original: gal te dbang phyug la sogs pa la skye'am snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa lnga pa yod pa yin no zhes na /
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug la sogs pa la skye'am snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa lnga pa yod pa yin no zhes na /
translated: If it is asked whether there is a fifth conception that thinks “arising is from Īśvara and so on,”

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the reply to that,

original: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares “those” and so on.

original: de rnams bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis ka'i phyogs kyi khongs su 'dus pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis ka'i phyogs kyi khongs su 'dus pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Those are included in the categories of self, other, and both.

original: bshad zin pa'i skyon las mi 'da' ste zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis ka'i phyogs la brjod pa'i skyon las mi 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: bshad zin pa'i skyon las mi 'da' ste zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis ka'i phyogs la brjod pa'i skyon las mi 'da' ba'o //
translated: “Do not escape the previously mentioned faults” means that they do not escape the faults stated in the context of the positions of self, other, and both.

original: rnam par rtog pa lnga med pas so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa lnga med pas so //
translated: Because the five misconceptions do not exist.

original: rnam par rtog pa bzhis zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis ka'i dang rgyu med pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste bzhis so //🔽gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir dngos @226a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bzhis zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis ka'i dang rgyu med pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste bzhis so // gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir dngos @226a * //
translated: “By the four misconceptions” means by the four misconceptions of self, other, both, and no cause.

original: po rnams bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis ka dang rgyu la ma ltos pa skye ba med pa de'i phyir dngos po rnams rang bzhin dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: po rnams bdag dang gzhan dang gnyis ka dang rgyu la ma ltos pa skye ba med pa de'i phyir dngos po rnams rang bzhin dang bral ba'o //
translated: “Because” and so on means that because things do not arise in dependence on self, other, both, or no cause, therefore things are devoid of essence.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin ni skye ba yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin ni skye ba yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore essence does not exist.

original: de la gzhan dag gi phyogs snga ma snga ma 'god pa ni /🔽'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la gzhan dag gi phyogs snga ma snga ma 'god pa ni /🔽'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, the opponent’s previous position is set forth:🔽Here, someone might say that things exist essentially because the Buddha said that dependent origination exists.

original: ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Unproduced” means that the nature is not produced.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reply to that,

original: bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “explanation,” and so on.

original: khyod kyis gang sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa nyid du bstan pa de ni ma yin te gang gi phyir sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi bcos ma ma yin pa dang / gzhan la mi ltos pa'i rang bzhin de ni sus kyang gzung bar 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyod kyis gang sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa nyid du bstan pa de ni ma yin te gang gi phyir sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi bcos ma ma yin pa dang / gzhan la mi ltos pa'i rang bzhin de ni sus kyang gzung bar 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: That which you taught as the nature of blue, and so on, is not so, because the unfabricated nature of blue, and so on, which does not depend on another, is not suitable to be apprehended by anyone,

original: de ni 'phags pa'i skye bo rnams kyi so sor rang rang gis thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa'i skye bo rnams kyi so sor rang rang gis thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is individually realized by the noble ones.

original: da nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach just that,

original: sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says “blue, and so on,” and so on.

original: 'di'i don ni gal te sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin yul nyid du gyur pa yin na de'i tshe de rnams kyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gal te sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin yul nyid du gyur pa yin na de'i tshe de rnams kyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If the nature of blue, etc., were to become the object, then it would be the apprehension of their nature.

original: ma rig pa'i mun pa yod pa'i phyir rang bzhin yul nyid du mi 'gyur bas gzung ba ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mun pa yod pa'i phyir rang bzhin yul nyid du mi 'gyur bas gzung ba ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: But because of the darkness of ignorance, their nature would not become the object, and so it is not apprehended.

original: de la gzhan gyi phyogs snga ma ston pa ni ;
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi phyogs snga ma ston pa ni ;
translated: In this regard, the teaching of the opponent’s former position is as follows:

original: gal te de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If it is like that, etc.

original: mdun na snang bar mthong ba zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mdun na snang bar mthong ba zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Seen in front” is blue, etc.

original: ci zhig tu 'gyur bar 'os she na zhes bya ba ni gal te rang bzhin ma yin na ci zhig yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ci zhig tu 'gyur bar 'os she na zhes bya ba ni gal te rang bzhin ma yin na ci zhig yin zhes pa'o //
translated: What is appropriate? If it is not the nature, what is it?

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reply to that, he says,

original: bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The explanation, etc.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni mdun na snang ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni mdun na snang ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: “This” is the blue, etc., that appears in front.

original: rang bzhin ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not by nature, because of the absence of unfabricatedness, etc.

original: phyin ci log nyid kyis na zhes bya ba ni sngon po la rang bzhin med pa la rang bzhin yod pa nyid du snang bas so //
analyzed: phyin ci log nyid kyis na zhes bya ba ni sngon po la rang bzhin med pa la rang bzhin yod pa nyid du snang bas so //
translated: By the very fact of error, because of the appearance of the absence of intrinsic reality in the blue, etc. as having intrinsic reality.

original: de la rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason for that, he says:

original: ma rig pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Because of the presence of ignorance, etc.

original: bdag nyid der zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin yod par ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid der zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin yod par ro //
translated: In that way, i.e., as having intrinsic reality.

original: ma rig pa dang bral bas zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang bral bas zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams kyis so //
translated: By the absence of ignorance, i.e., by the Noble Ones.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: By what, etc.

original: sprin tshogs dang mtshungs @226b gti mug stug po zhes bya ba ni dper na sprin gyi tshogs shin tu stug po yod na cung zad kyang mthong ba ma yin pa de bzhin du ma rig pa'i mun pa'i tshogs yod par gyur na byis pa rnams kyis dngos po'i
analyzed: sprin tshogs dang mtshungs @226b gti mug stug po zhes bya ba ni dper na sprin gyi tshogs shin tu stug po yod na cung zad kyang mthong ba ma yin pa de bzhin du ma rig pa'i mun pa'i tshogs yod par gyur na byis pa rnams kyis dngos po'i
translated: Thick ignorance is like a mass of clouds, because, just as when there is a very thick mass of clouds, nothing is seen at all, so also when there is the mass of the darkness of ignorance, the childish do not see the reality of things as it is.

original: rang bzhin mthong ba ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin mthong ba ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: One does not see the nature.

original: log pa dag tu snang bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin yod pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: log pa dag tu snang bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin yod pa nyid du'o //
translated: It appears as a distortion means that it appears as if it had an intrinsic nature.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says:

original: sprin tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sprin tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Like a mass of clouds, etc.

original: mngon par zhen pa'i gnas su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa'i gnas su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
translated: The basis of attachment is the basis of desire.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de la lan ni 'di bden par mngon par zhen pa rnams la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la lan ni 'di bden par mngon par zhen pa rnams la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer is: for those who are attached to the reality of things.

original: gang mdun na snang ba'i sngon po la sogs pa 'di rnams ni bden pa yin no snyam du mngon par zhen pas so //
analyzed: gang mdun na snang ba'i sngon po la sogs pa 'di rnams ni bden pa yin no snyam du mngon par zhen pas so //
translated: They think that these blue things, etc. that appear before them are real.

original: de la gzhan dag gis brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de la gzhan dag gis brjod pa ni /
translated: In response to that, another says:

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, he says, etc.

original: 'di'i don ni mun nag yod par gyur na dngos po rnams mi mthong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni mun nag yod par gyur na dngos po rnams mi mthong bar 'gyur la /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: When there is darkness, things are not seen.

original: rang bzhin phyin ci log tu mthong ba ni ma yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin phyin ci log tu mthong ba ni ma yin la /
translated: But one does not see their intrinsic nature as distorted.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin mi mthong ba ni 'gyur la rag na rang bzhin phyin ci log tu mthong ba ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang sngon po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin mi mthong ba ni 'gyur la rag na rang bzhin phyin ci log tu mthong ba ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: In the same way, here, it is possible that the nature of blue, etc. is not seen, but it is not the case that the nature is seen in a distorted way.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reply to that, he says,

original: de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “In the same way, etc. .”

original: phyi rol gyi dpe'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni skra shad la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dpe'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni skra shad la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: “By way of an external example” means by way of the characteristics of floating hairs, etc.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that, he says,

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Just as, etc. .”

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni rab rib can no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni rab rib can no //
translated: “Someone” means someone with cataracts.

original: log par 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya ba ni phyis kyi dus kyi blo la ltos nas so //
analyzed: log par 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya ba ni phyis kyi dus kyi blo la ltos nas so //
translated: “Grasps wrongly” means in relation to the mind at a later time.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes gadflies, etc.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says,

original: ji ltar rab rib can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar rab rib can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “Just as, etc. .”

original: dpe bstan nas don la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe bstan nas don la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning by way of an example,

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: he says, “Likewise, etc.”

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rab rib can bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rab rib can bzhin du'o //
translated: “ Likewise” means “like the one with cataracts.”

original: 'di'i don ni ci ltar rab rib can la rab rib kyi mthus ma skyes pa'i skra shad la sogs pa mthong ba de bzhin du 'gro ba rnams kyang gti mug gi stobs kyis khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa'i 'dus🔽byas @227a * //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni ci ltar rab rib can la rab rib kyi mthus ma skyes pa'i skra shad la sogs pa mthong ba de bzhin du 'gro ba rnams kyang gti mug gi stobs kyis khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa'i 'dus byas @227a * //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Just as the one with cataracts sees hairs, etc. that are not born by the power of cataracts, likewise, by the power of delusion, beings see compounded phenomena that are different by way of the divisions of realms, migrations, birthplaces, etc.

original: rnams mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnams mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They see them as real.

original: ma rig pa'i stobs kyis phyin ci log tu snang ba la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i stobs kyis phyin ci log tu snang ba la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the source of the sūtra for the appearance of error by the power of ignorance,

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “This, etc.”

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rgyu can dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i las rnams so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rgyu can dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i las rnams so //
translated: “ Conditioned by ignorance, there are actions” means that actions such as virtue and non-virtue are caused by ignorance.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir yang mdo'i khungs gzhan ston pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir yang mdo'i khungs gzhan ston pa ni /
translated: In order to clarify that, another scriptural source is taught:

original: de bzhin du ma rig pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma rig pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Similarly, due to the cessation of ignorance, etc.

original: ma rig pa dang rjes su 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang rjes su 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ Associated with ignorance” means possessing ignorance.

original: mngon par 'du bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du byed pas na 'du ba ste las yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du byed pas na 'du ba ste las yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “ Formation” means that which is formed by formation, i.e., karma.

original: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med par nges pa'i las so //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med par nges pa'i las so //
translated: “ Unmoving” means karma that is certain to be experienced in the form and formless realms.

original: de ltar 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the order of engagement,

original: ldog pa'i rim pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ldog pa'i rim pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the order of cessation,

original: de bzhin du ma rig pa 'gags pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma rig pa 'gags pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Similarly, due to the cessation of ignorance, etc.”

original: des na ma rig pa'i stobs kyis las dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'jug pas de 'gags nas las dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'gag pa yin no zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: des na ma rig pa'i stobs kyis las dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'jug pas de 'gags nas las dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'gag pa yin no zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Therefore, since karma, consciousness, and so on, are set in motion by the power of ignorance, when that is stopped, karma, consciousness, and so on, are stopped.

original: ma rig pa ni las dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa snang ba'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba yin no zhes mdo las gsungs pa yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni las dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa snang ba'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba yin no zhes mdo las gsungs pa yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what the sutra means when it says that ignorance is the cause of the appearance of karma, consciousness, and so on.

original: phyin ci log tu shes pa 'di yang mi mkhas pa rnams kho na la 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu shes pa 'di yang mi mkhas pa rnams kho na la 'byung ba yin te /
translated: This mistaken understanding occurs only among the unwise,🔽not among the wise.

original: mkhas pa rnams la ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de'i phyir tshul 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽tshul 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed yin la /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams la ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de'i phyir tshul 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / tshul 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed yin la /
translated: To demonstrate this, it is said:

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed rnams 'gag go zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed rnams 'gag go zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: “By this method” means by the method of “Conditioned by ignorance, there are karmic predispositions,” and “When ignorance ceases, karmic predispositions cease.”

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “If” and so on.

original: gti mug med par de mi 'byung //
analyzed: gti mug med par de mi 'byung //
translated: It does not occur without ignorance.

original: zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa med na las 'byung ba ma yin no zhes pa'o ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa med na las 'byung ba ma yin no zhes pa'o ;
translated: This means that without ignorance, karma does not occur.

original: / mi mkhas pa kho nas rtogs par gor ma chag ces bya ba ni gnyis ka gdod ma nas skye ba med par ma rtogs par ma rig pa'i dbang gis las 'byung ba dang / de med na de med do zhes rtogs pas so //
analyzed: / mi mkhas pa kho nas rtogs par gor ma chag ces bya ba ni gnyis ka gdod ma nas skye ba med par ma rtogs par ma rig pa'i dbang gis las 'byung ba dang / de med na de med do zhes rtogs pas so //
translated: It is certain that only the unwise understand it thus, because they understand that karma occurs through the power of ignorance and that without it, there is no karma, without understanding that both are primordially non-arisen.🔽The sun of the wise completely dispels the thick darkness of delusion.

original: blo bzang nyi mas mun pa stug po rnam par bsal ba'i zhes bya ba ni dngos @227b po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i blo gros mchog tu gyur pa de nyi ma ste /
analyzed: blo bzang nyi mas mun pa stug po rnam par bsal ba'i zhes bya ba ni dngos @227b po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i blo gros mchog tu gyur pa de nyi ma ste /
translated: The sun is the supreme intelligence free from the conceptualization of things and non-things, etc.

original: gti mug gi mun pa sel bar byed pas so //
analyzed: gti mug gi mun pa sel bar byed pas so //
translated: It dispels the darkness of delusion.

original: des mun pa stug po gang la rnam par gsal ba de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: des mun pa stug po gang la rnam par gsal ba de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which is completely illuminated by it is called “the thick darkness.”

original: 'phags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'phags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that one is an ārya.🔽The wise

original: mkhas pa dag ni zhes bya ba ni blo gros dam pa dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni zhes bya ba ni blo gros dam pa dang ldan pas so //
translated: have the highest intelligence.

original: stong nyid khong du chud cing zhes bya ba ni gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de skye ba med pa yin pas stong pa nyid yin no snyam du khong du chud pa yin gyi skyes pa 'gags pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: stong nyid khong du chud cing zhes bya ba ni gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de skye ba med pa yin pas stong pa nyid yin no snyam du khong du chud pa yin gyi skyes pa 'gags pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “One who has understood emptiness” is one who has understood that whatever is dependently arisen is non-arisen, and therefore empty, but not that what is arisen is ceased.

original: grol bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin khong du chud cing ma rig pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams log pa 'khor ba las grol bar 'gyur ba yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: grol bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin khong du chud cing ma rig pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams log pa 'khor ba las grol bar 'gyur ba yin zhes pa'o //
translated: “One who is liberated” is one who, having understood the nature of emptiness, has reversed the afflictions such as ignorance and is liberated from cyclic existence.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: shes rab can ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shes rab can ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “The wise one,” and so on.

original: 'du byed rnams rang bzhin med par zhes bya ba ni gdong ma nas skye ba med par yongs su rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams rang bzhin med par zhes bya ba ni gdong ma nas skye ba med par yongs su rtogs pa'o //
translated: “One who has fully understood that compounded phenomena are essenceless” is one who has fully understood that they are primordially non-arisen.

original: 'du byed rnams nye bar mi len pa la rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams nye bar mi len pa la rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the reason why one does not grasp compounded phenomena,🔽he says,

original: de nye bar len pa'i rgyu spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nye bar len pa'i rgyu spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Because its substantial cause is abandoned.

original: 'du byed kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma rig pa spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma rig pa spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Because the substantial cause of compositional activity, ignorance, is abandoned.

original: de ltar sngon po la sogs pa rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid du zin kyang snang ba yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar sngon po la sogs pa rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid du zin kyang snang ba yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, although blue and so forth are essenceless, they do appear.

original: da ni gzhan dag na re sngon po la sogs pa rnams snang ba'i phyir na don dam par yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
analyzed: da ni gzhan dag na re sngon po la sogs pa rnams snang ba'i phyir na don dam par yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
translated: Now, others posit the former position that since blue and so forth appear, they ultimately exist.

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In response to this, [Nāgārjuna] states, “Here, some say,” and so on.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: “ Their” refers to form and so on.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: gal te dngos po rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “If things were to arise from things,” and so on.

original: gal te don dam par dngos po rnams yod par mi 'gyur na de'i tshe dngos po de rnams kun rdzob tu yang yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te don dam par dngos po rnams yod par mi 'gyur na de'i tshe dngos po de rnams kun rdzob tu yang yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If ultimately things did not exist, then at that time those things would not exist even conventionally.

original: kun rdzob tu yang de rnams snang bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang de rnams snang bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Even conventionally, they would not appear.

original: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the example for that,

original: mo gsham gyi bu bzhin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu bzhin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, “like the son of a barren woman.”

original: de ltar mo gsham gyi bu don dam par med pas kun rdzob tu yang mi snang ba de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de ltar mo gsham gyi bu don dam par med pas kun rdzob tu yang mi snang ba de bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as the son of a barren woman does not exist ultimately and therefore does not appear even conventionally, so it is.

original: de dag rang bzhin gyis na yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir dngos po rnams kun rdzob tu snang ba @228a * //
analyzed: de dag rang bzhin gyis na yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir dngos po rnams kun rdzob tu snang ba @228a * //
translated: “They exist by their intrinsic reality” means that because things appear conventionally,

original: de'i phyir don dam pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: therefore they are ultimate.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the response to that,

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Here it should be said,” and so on.

original: de yang rab rib can gyi dpe'i sgo nas 'gegs par byed pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang rab rib can gyi dpe'i sgo nas 'gegs par byed pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is a refutation by way of the example of the person with eye disease, he says, “Those who are not born . . .”

original: de dag ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes par khas len pas so //
analyzed: de dag ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes par khas len pas so //
translated: “Not born” means not born by way of their own intrinsic reality.

original: re zhig de dag nyid la brtsad bya ste //
analyzed: re zhig de dag nyid la brtsad bya ste //
translated: “First, they should be questioned about this . . .”

original: zhes bya ba ni gang dag don dam par rang bzhin med pa de kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang dag don dam par rang bzhin med pa de kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Those who are ultimately without intrinsic reality do not exist even conventionally,

original: mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
translated: like the son of a barren woman.

original: des na rab rib can la yang ngo bo nyid kyis med pa'i skra shad la sogs pa ji ltar snang /
analyzed: des na rab rib can la yang ngo bo nyid kyis med pa'i skra shad la sogs pa ji ltar snang /
translated: Therefore, how could the hair and so forth, which are not intrinsically existent, appear even to the person with eye disease?

original: gal te de ltar na mo gsham gyi bu yang snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes rab rib la brtsad pa gyis shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na mo gsham gyi bu yang snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes rab rib la brtsad pa gyis shig ces pa'o //
translated: “If that is so, then it follows that the son of a barren woman would appear,” so you should debate with the person with eye disease.

original: phyi nas ma rig rab rib rjes 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nas ma rig rab rib rjes 'brel pa'o //
translated: “Later, they should be questioned about this . . .”

original: zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa de nyid rab rib yin la de dang rjes su 'brel pa ste de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa de nyid rab rib yin la de dang rjes su 'brel pa ste de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This is saying that ignorance itself is the cataract, and it is connected with that, that is, it is endowed with that.

original: de dang ldan pa la phyis sngar bzhin du rtsod pa gyis shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa la phyis sngar bzhin du rtsod pa gyis shig ces pa'o //
translated: You should argue later, as before, with regard to that endowment.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽go sla'o // dbu ma pa'i phyogs la skyon yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / go sla'o // dbu ma pa'i phyogs la skyon yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that, he says, “The teaching of the non-existence of the object of refutation,” and so on.🔽It is easy to understand.

original: kho bo cag la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: kho bo cag la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach that there is no fault in the Madhyamaka position, he says, “For us,” and so on.

original: 'dir brgal zhing brtags pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin can gzugs la sogs pa dag mthong la /
analyzed: 'dir brgal zhing brtags pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin can gzugs la sogs pa dag mthong la /
translated: Here, he says, “This is not a case of debate,” that is, it is not reasonable for us to debate, “Why do you see forms and so on that are essentially unarisen,

original: mo gsham gyi bu ma yin no zhes pa'i rtsod pa de kho bo cag la ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu ma yin no zhes pa'i rtsod pa de kho bo cag la ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: but not the son of a barren woman?”

original: de rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that extensively, he says,

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Just as,” and so on.

original: lung ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni lung gi rjes su 'brangs nas so //
analyzed: lung ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni lung gi rjes su 'brangs nas so //
translated: “In accordance with the scriptures” means in accordance with the scriptures.

original: rnal 'byor pa ye shes kyis thugs su chud pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med par thugs su chud pa'i sgo nas rnal 'byor pa rnams la ltos nas so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ye shes kyis thugs su chud pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med par thugs su chud pa'i sgo nas rnal 'byor pa rnams la ltos nas so //
translated: “In terms of the yogic intuition” means in terms of the yogic intuition of realitylessness.

original: gzhan dag ces bya ba la ni so so'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ces bya ba la ni so so'i skye bo'o //
translated: “Others” means ordinary beings.

original: rang gi shes pa la ltos nas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag ni so so'i skye bo yin pas dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par khong du ma chud pas so //
analyzed: rang gi shes pa la ltos nas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag ni so so'i skye bo yin pas dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par khong du ma chud pas so //
translated: “Not in terms of their own understanding” means that they are ordinary beings, and they have not understood that things are realityless.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan ston pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan ston pa ni /
translated: The reason for that is stated:

original: kho bo cag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “We do not say that things are not empty of intrinsic reality.”

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i @228b phyir ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i @228b phyir ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to show the scriptural source for that, he says, “As it is said,” and so on.

original: stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni gzung 'dzin dag gis stong pas so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni gzung 'dzin dag gis stong pas so //
translated: “Emptiness” means emptiness of subject and object.

original: gal te gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa'i phyir stong pa nyid yin na sems tsam du smra ba'i 'dod pa bzhin du gzung 'dzin rnam pa gnyis dang bral ba'i shes pa yod pa yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: gal te gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa'i phyir stong pa nyid yin na sems tsam du smra ba'i 'dod pa bzhin du gzung 'dzin rnam pa gnyis dang bral ba'i shes pa yod pa yin no zhe na ;
translated: If it is emptiness because it is empty of object and subject, then, as the Mind-Only proponents assert, there is consciousness that is free from the duality of the two, object and subject.

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The reply to that is:

original: dben zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dben zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “Isolated” is stated.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis kyang dben pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis kyang dben pa'o //
translated: It is also isolated by the nature of consciousness.

original: khams kyi rang bzhin stong zhing zhes bya ba ni khams bco brgyad kyi rang bzhin dang de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: khams kyi rang bzhin stong zhing zhes bya ba ni khams bco brgyad kyi rang bzhin dang de bzhin du'o //
translated: “The nature of the constituents is empty” means the nature of the eighteen constituents is just so.

original: gang chos de yang rang bzhin stong pa ste zhes bya ba ni skye mched rnams kyang de bzhin du'o ;
analyzed: gang chos de yang rang bzhin stong pa ste zhes bya ba ni skye mched rnams kyang de bzhin du'o ;
translated: “That phenomenon is also empty of nature” means the sense spheres are just so.

original: ye shes ldan pas zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams 'phags pa'i lam skyes pa rnams la stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ye shes ldan pas zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams 'phags pa'i lam skyes pa rnams la stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: “Endowed with wisdom” means the aggregates, constituents, and sense spheres are emptiness for those who have given rise to the noble path.

original: des na rang bzhin med pa nyid du thugs su chud pas so //
analyzed: des na rang bzhin med pa nyid du thugs su chud pas so //
translated: Therefore, it is because of comprehending the absence of nature.

original: byis pas min zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ma yin te /
analyzed: byis pas min zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ma yin te /
translated: The childish do not, that is, ordinary beings do not,

original: des de'i rang bzhin long du ma chud pas so //
analyzed: des de'i rang bzhin long du ma chud pas so //
translated: because they have not understood its nature.

original: gang gang la stong pa nyid yongs su shes pa yod pa de ni byang chub kyi lam la spyod pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gang la stong pa nyid yongs su shes pa yod pa de ni byang chub kyi lam la spyod pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that whoever fully understands emptiness is one who practices the path to enlightenment,

original: ye shes rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ye shes rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “The nature of wisdom,” and so on.🔽If one realizes that it is similar to the knower,

original: shes pa po 'dra bar rtogs 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni ci ltar gzhan gyis shes pa po bdag tu khas blangs pa ji ltar stong pa de bzhin du 'gro ba thams cad rtogs par 'gyur na zhes pa'o //🔽byang chub lam la de dag spyod ces bya //
analyzed: shes pa po 'dra bar rtogs 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni ci ltar gzhan gyis shes pa po bdag tu khas blangs pa ji ltar stong pa de bzhin du 'gro ba thams cad rtogs par 'gyur na zhes pa'o // byang chub lam la de dag spyod ces bya //
translated: that is, just as the knower, the self, is accepted by others to be empty, in the same way one realizes that all beings are empty.🔽One should say that they practice the path to enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba ni de lta bu ni byang chub kyi spyod pa spyod pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de lta bu ni byang chub kyi spyod pa spyod pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should say that such a person practices the conduct of enlightenment.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary,

original: de'i phyir 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Therefore, this,” and so on.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin can gzugs la sogs pa dag mthong la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin can gzugs la sogs pa dag mthong la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
