translated: This is so, because, although forms and so forth are by nature unproduced, they are seen, and so forth.

original: de la rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reason for that,

original: de dag gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽'di'i don ni gal te kun rdzob tu rnal 'byor pa rnams la sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin snang bar gyur na de'i tshe mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa yang snang bar 'gyur ba las 'on kyang de rnams las kun rdzob tu yang sngon po la
analyzed: de dag gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // 'di'i don ni gal te kun rdzob tu rnal 'byor pa rnams la sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin snang bar gyur na de'i tshe mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa yang snang bar 'gyur ba las 'on kyang de rnams las kun rdzob tu yang sngon po la
translated: he says, “because of the absence of the perception of the nature of entities.”

original: sogs pa'i rang bzhin snang ba med pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa rnams ci ltar snang bar 'gyur @229a * //
analyzed: sogs pa'i rang bzhin snang ba med pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa rnams ci ltar snang bar 'gyur @229a * //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If the nature of blue and so forth were to appear to yogis in the conventional sense, then the son of a barren woman and so forth would also appear. However, because the nature of blue and so forth does not appear to them even in the conventional sense, how could the son of a barren woman and so forth appear?

original: zhes pa'o // don dam par yang ma yin no zhes bya ba de don dam pa ni mtha' bzhi las grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // don dam par yang ma yin no zhes bya ba de don dam pa ni mtha' bzhi las grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not even in the ultimate sense, because the ultimate is free from the four extremes.

original: rab rib can la brgal zhing brtag pa lta bu 'dug shig ces bya ba ni rab rib can la brgal zhing brtag pa mi bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rab rib can la brgal zhing brtag pa lta bu 'dug shig ces bya ba ni rab rib can la brgal zhing brtag pa mi bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: “Just like the one who is blind” means “just like the one who is blind should not be questioned.”

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “This” refers to what is about to be said.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “If” and so on.

original: dri za'i grong khyer zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig nam mkha' la ltas ngan pa'i dbang gis grong khyer dang 'dra ba gang mthong ba de ni dri za'i grong khyer ro //
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig nam mkha' la ltas ngan pa'i dbang gis grong khyer dang 'dra ba gang mthong ba de ni dri za'i grong khyer ro //
translated: A gandharva-city is what some see in the sky, like a city, due to an inauspicious condition.

original: smig rgyu'i chu dang 'dra zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i gung la nyi ma'i 'od zer dang ldan pa'i bye ma'i thang la chur snang ba'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu'i chu dang 'dra zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i gung la nyi ma'i 'od zer dang ldan pa'i bye ma'i thang la chur snang ba'o //
translated: “Like a mirage” is like the appearance of water in a sandy plain at midday due to the sun’s rays.

original: ci ltar der 'gyur te mi rigs zhes bya ba ni rmi lam la sogs pa ma skyes pa nyid snang ba de bzhin du mo gsham gyi bu yang ji ltar snang bar mi rigs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar der 'gyur te mi rigs zhes bya ba ni rmi lam la sogs pa ma skyes pa nyid snang ba de bzhin du mo gsham gyi bu yang ji ltar snang bar mi rigs zhes pa'o //
translated: “How could that be?” means “it is not reasonable.” Just as the non-arisen appearances in dreams and so on are seen, how could the son of a barren woman be seen in the same way? It is not reasonable.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says:

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: For example, etc.

original: bdag nyid brgal zhing brtag par gyis dang zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir ma skyes pa'i rmi lam la sogs pa mthong la /
analyzed: bdag nyid brgal zhing brtag par gyis dang zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir ma skyes pa'i rmi lam la sogs pa mthong la /
translated: You should investigate and analyze: Why is it that one sees a dream, etc. that is not born,

original: mo gsham gyi bu ma yin par 'gyur zhes de ltar brgal zhing brtag par gyis zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu ma yin par 'gyur zhes de ltar brgal zhing brtag par gyis zhes pa'o //
translated: but not the son of a barren woman? In this way you should investigate and analyze.

original: 'dis ni rang gi 'dod pa dang 'gal ba nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang gi 'dod pa dang 'gal ba nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the contradiction with his own belief.

original: da ni ma nges pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni ma nges pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the indeterminacy, he says, In reality, etc.

original: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni don dam par ro //
analyzed: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni don dam par ro //
translated: In reality means ultimately.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni rmi lam du mthong ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni rmi lam du mthong ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This means the dream, etc. that is seen.

original: ci ltar rkyen med kyang zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa yin yang ngo //
analyzed: ci ltar rkyen med kyang zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa yin yang ngo //
translated: Even though it is without conditions means even though it is without arising.

original: 'di'i don ni gang rmi lam du mthong ba la sogs pa de rnams don dam par skye ba med kyang mo gsham gyi bu ltar mthong ba'i yul du mi 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gang rmi lam du mthong ba la sogs pa de rnams don dam par skye ba med kyang mo gsham gyi bu ltar mthong ba'i yul du mi 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Although those things such as what is seen in a dream and so on are ultimately unarisen, they are not like the son of a barren woman in that they are objects of seeing.

original: 'on kyang mthong ba'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang mthong ba'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: However, they are objects of the domain of seeing.

original: de'i phyir na smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir na smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'di ma nges pa'o zhes bya ba ni gal te de ltar gzugs la sogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de rmi lam la sogs pa'i dpe rnams kyis ma nges pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ma nges pa'o zhes bya ba ni gal te de ltar gzugs la sogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de rmi lam la sogs pa'i dpe rnams kyis ma nges pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: “This is not definite.” This teaches that what was said, “If it is like that for forms and so on,” and so on, is not definite by means of the examples of dreams and so on.

original: de la mdo'i khungs ston pa ni /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs ston pa ni /
translated: Here, the source of the sūtra is taught:

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “As it is said,” and so on.

original: 'khor ba na 'gro ba lnga po rnams gang yod pa de rnams rmi lam dang mtshungs par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba na 'gro ba lnga po rnams gang yod pa de rnams rmi lam dang mtshungs par gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said that whatever exists in the five transmigrations of cyclic existence is similar to a dream.

original: de nyid du ni rnam ma bzhag / ces bya ba ni @229b don dam par de rnams la skye ba la sogs pa'i rnam bzhag byas pa ma yin pa'o //🔽rmi lam gang la'ang dngos po med //
analyzed: de nyid du ni rnam ma bzhag / ces bya ba ni @229b don dam par de rnams la skye ba la sogs pa'i rnam bzhag byas pa ma yin pa'o // rmi lam gang la'ang dngos po med //
translated: “They are not posited in reality” means that the positing of arising, etc. in them is not in the ultimate.

original: ces bya ba ni rmi lam gyi dngos po gang yang yod pa ma yin no //🔽log pa'i blo ldan mngon par zhe na //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rmi lam gyi dngos po gang yang yod pa ma yin no // log pa'i blo ldan mngon par zhe na //
translated: “There is no entity in any dream” means that there is no entity of a dream.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang phyin ci log gi blo dang ldan pa de rnams kyis 'di rnams 'gro ba yin no snyam na mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang phyin ci log gi blo dang ldan pa de rnams kyis 'di rnams 'gro ba yin no snyam na mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: “Those who are deluded by false ideas” means that those who have false ideas think that these are realities and are attached to them.

original: gzhan na zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu las gzhan yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan na zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu las gzhan yang ngo //
translated: “Elsewhere” means in the ten directions.

original: grong khyer ming tsam zhig gis rab tu gzhag / ces bya ba ni ming las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po gzhan med pas so //
analyzed: grong khyer ming tsam zhig gis rab tu gzhag / ces bya ba ni ming las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po gzhan med pas so //
translated: “A city is posited by a mere name” means that there is no entity other than the name.

original: yongs su rtog pas dkrugs zhes bya ba ni yongs su rtog pas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rtog pas dkrugs zhes bya ba ni yongs su rtog pas bskyed pa'o //
translated: “Agitated by imagination” means produced by imagination.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: kho bo cag la ni 'di brtsad du med pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni gal te de ltar gzugs la sogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod pa de kho bo cag la yod par mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: kho bo cag la ni 'di brtsad du med pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni gal te de ltar gzugs la sogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod pa de kho bo cag la yod par mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: For us, this is not a matter of dispute.

original: kun rdzob tu yang rang bzhin yod par khas mi len pas so ;
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang rang bzhin yod par khas mi len pas so ;
translated: This is not a matter of dispute for us, because we do not accept that form and so on exist even conventionally.

original: / de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: How could there be an essence🔽of that which is essentially arisen?

original: rang bzhin ni bcos ma ma yin pa dang gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbang du byas nas rang bzhin skye bar mi rigs pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni bcos ma ma yin pa dang gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbang du byas nas rang bzhin skye bar mi rigs pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa kho na yin no //
translated: Since essence is not fabricated and does not depend on another, it is not tenable that essence arises in either a conventional or an ultimate sense. Therefore, it is just like the son of a barren woman and so on.🔽Since that is the case, he says:🔽When there is no essence,

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam par yang rang bzhin skye ba med pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam par yang rang bzhin skye ba med pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: neither otherness nor sameness🔽can be established.

original: zhi zhing zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi yul yin pas so //
analyzed: zhi zhing zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi yul yin pas so //
translated: The peaceful is the object of non-conceptual intuition.

original: skye bral zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pas so //
analyzed: skye bral zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pas so //
translated: The free from origination is the non-origination.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni gdod ma nas rang bzhin med pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni gdod ma nas rang bzhin med pas so //
translated: The essentially in a state of Nirvāṇa is the primordial absence of intrinsic reality.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i gnas skabs dag tu'o //🔽de la lung gi khungs ston pa ni /
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i gnas skabs dag tu'o // de la lung gi khungs ston pa ni /
translated: The always is in the conventional and ultimate situations.

original: lung brjod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽chos rnams mgon po khyod kyis bstan //
analyzed: lung brjod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / chos rnams mgon po khyod kyis bstan //
translated: The scriptural source for that is shown by The scriptural references are....🔽The scriptural references are the passages from the scriptures.

original: zhes bya ba ni kye mgon po khyod kyis 'khor lo bskor ba'i dus na chos kyi rnam pa 'di lta bu gsungs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kye mgon po khyod kyis 'khor lo bskor ba'i dus na chos kyi rnam pa 'di lta bu gsungs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The teachings of the Dharma by you, the Protector are the teachings of the Dharma by you, the Protector, in the time of the turning of the wheel.

original: phyis byung nas kyang yang 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma brgyud ma'i sgo nas skye ba med pas so //
analyzed: phyis byung nas kyang yang 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma brgyud ma'i sgo nas skye ba med pas so //
translated: The not arisen later is the non-origination by way of a succession of moments.

original: gzhan ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa rnams kun rdzob @230a * //
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa rnams kun rdzob @230a * //
translated: If such things as pots are conventional,🔽

original: tu rang bzhin gyis mi skye na 'o na ci ltar snang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: tu rang bzhin gyis mi skye na 'o na ci ltar snang bar 'gyur /
translated: If such things as pots do not intrinsically arise in the conventional, then how do they appear?

original: snang ba'i phyir na kun rdzob tu rang bzhin skye bas don dam pa yang yod par 'gyur ro snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu nas lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: snang ba'i phyir na kun rdzob tu rang bzhin skye bas don dam pa yang yod par 'gyur ro snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu nas lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: Since they appear, they must intrinsically arise in the conventional, and thus the ultimate would also exist.🔽In response to this objection, Candrakirti says:

original: rang gi sde pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To our own schools and so on.

original: 'di ni brgal ba ma yin pa de nyid de zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i rgol ba de mi rigs pas so //
analyzed: 'di ni brgal ba ma yin pa de nyid de zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i rgol ba de mi rigs pas so //
translated: This is not a proper objection means that the objection just presented is not correct.

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa ste /
translated: They refers to our own schools.

original: dbu ma pa rnams so //🔽'jig rten rab tu grags par yod ji bzhin //
analyzed: dbu ma pa rnams so // 'jig rten rab tu grags par yod ji bzhin //
translated: Madhyamikas refers to the Madhyamikas.

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar bum pa la sogs pa rnams 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa tsam du 'byung bar 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar bum pa la sogs pa rnams 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa tsam du 'byung bar 'gyur pa'o //
translated: Just as they exist in the world's currency means that such things as pots occur merely in the currency of the world.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa tsam gyis thams cad 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa tsam gyis thams cad 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Likewise” means that things arise merely through being well known in the world.

original: mo gsham gyi bu dang mtshungs par thal mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu dang mtshungs par thal mi 'gyur //
translated: It is not the case that it follows that they are like the son of a barren woman.

original: zhes bya ba ni mo gsham gyi bu dang mtshungs par mi snang bar thal bar mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mo gsham gyi bu dang mtshungs par mi snang bar thal bar mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: This means that it is not the case that it follows that they are not seen, like the son of a barren woman.

original: 'di'i don ni kho bo cag gis snang ba tsam gyi sgo nas rang bzhin skye ba ni mi brjod kyi /🔽'on kyang ma brtags na nyams dga' bar 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa'i dbang du byas nas des dngos po rnams don dam par ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni kho bo cag gis snang ba tsam gyi sgo nas rang bzhin skye ba ni mi brjod kyi / 'on kyang ma brtags na nyams dga' bar 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa'i dbang du byas nas des dngos po rnams don dam par ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
translated: The meaning of this is that we do not say that arising from self exists from the perspective of mere appearance.🔽However, in terms of what is well known in the world, which is delightful if not analyzed, how could things ultimately exist?

original: des na don dam par skye ba med du zin kyang ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu skye bas dngos por snang ba la skyon ci yod /
analyzed: des na don dam par skye ba med du zin kyang ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu skye bas dngos por snang ba la skyon ci yod /
translated: Therefore, although ultimately there is no arising, in terms of worldly convention, which is delightful if not analyzed, there is arising. So what is wrong with saying that things appear?

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa rnams ni 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu yang skye bar ma grub pas snang ba med pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa rnams ni 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu yang skye bar ma grub pas snang ba med pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Since the son of a barren woman and so on are not established as produced even in the world's convention, they are said to be non-apparent.

original: gzhan yang gzhan dag gis mo gsham gyi bu dang mtshungs par thal ba'i skyon ston pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan dag gis mo gsham gyi bu dang mtshungs par thal ba'i skyon ston pa ni /
translated: Moreover, others teach the fault of the consequence of similarity to the son of a barren woman.

original: ci ste gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ste gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If you say but if and so on.

original: reg bya la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni rang rig bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: reg bya la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni rang rig bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The words and so on in tactile objects and so on include reflexive awareness.

original: gdags pa'i rten zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang rnam par shes pa gdags pa'i rten du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gdags pa'i rten zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang rnam par shes pa gdags pa'i rten du gyur pa'o //
translated: The basis of designation is that which serves as the basis of designation of a pot and consciousness.

original: rgyu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i rten dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i rten dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The cause is the basis such as earth.

original: thams cad btags pa tsam kho na yin gyi zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i phyir btags pa tsam nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad btags pa tsam kho na yin gyi zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i phyir btags pa tsam nyid do //
translated: All are mere designations alone means that they are mere designations because they are non-entities.

original: brtags pa'i rten zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa'i rten zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The basis of imputation is earth and so on.

original: mo gsham gyi bu dang 'dra bar thal ba zhes bya ba ni ci ste mo gsham gyi @230b bu la 'dogs pa'i rgyu med pas mo gsham gyi bu btags pa med pa de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa rnams su 'dogs pa la yang rgyu med par
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu dang 'dra bar thal ba zhes bya ba ni ci ste mo gsham gyi @230b bu la 'dogs pa'i rgyu med pas mo gsham gyi bu btags pa med pa de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa rnams su 'dogs pa la yang rgyu med par
translated: The consequence that “it would follow that it is like the son of a barren woman” means that just as the son of a barren woman is not imputed because there is no cause for imputing it, in the same way, there would be no cause for imputing it to pots and so on.

original: thal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //🔽de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o // de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The consequence is that it would not be imputed.

original: de yang mi rigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the response to that, he says, “That also is not correct,” and so on.

original: rdzas su sgrub par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di'i dgongs pa ni bum pa la sogs par 'dogs pa'i rgyu rdzas su yod par sgrub par byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: rdzas su sgrub par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di'i dgongs pa ni bum pa la sogs par 'dogs pa'i rgyu rdzas su yod par sgrub par byed pa yin nam /
translated: The intended meaning of “because it cannot be established substantially” is this: Is the cause of imputing a pot and so on established as substantially existent?

original: 'on te btags yod du'o //
analyzed: 'on te btags yod du'o //
translated: Or is it established as imputedly existent?

original: gal te rdzas yod du bsgrub par 'dod na lan ni rdzas su bsgrub par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gal te rdzas yod du bsgrub par 'dod na lan ni rdzas su bsgrub par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If it is asserted that it is established as substantially existent, the response is, “Because it cannot be established substantially.”

original: ji ltar rdzas yod du sgrub par mi nus pa de ltar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar rdzas yod du sgrub par mi nus pa de ltar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how it cannot be established as substantially existent, he says,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: As it is said, etc.

original: bzhi brgya pa las so //
analyzed: bzhi brgya pa las so //
translated: As it is said in the Catuh-śataka.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ma gtogs par //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i bum pa ma grub pa de bzhin du bum par 'dogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang rlung la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi las tha dad du gyur pa'i
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ma gtogs par // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i bum pa ma grub pa de bzhin du bum par 'dogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang rlung la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi las tha dad du gyur pa'i
translated: Apart from form, etc.🔽Apart from form, etc., a pot is not established as different.

original: rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, form, etc., which are the causes of the designation of a pot, are not logically different from the four great elements, wind, etc.

original: rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because it would follow that they would be without cause.

original: ji ltar rlung la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i gzugs dang ro la sogs pa mi srid pa de bzhin du 'byung ba rnams kyang phan tshun du ma ltos par ma grub pa'i phyir rang bzhin ma grub pa yin no zhes rin po che phreng ba'i khungs bstan
analyzed: ji ltar rlung la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i gzugs dang ro la sogs pa mi srid pa de bzhin du 'byung ba rnams kyang phan tshun du ma ltos par ma grub pa'i phyir rang bzhin ma grub pa yin no zhes rin po che phreng ba'i khungs bstan
translated: Just as form, taste, etc., apart from wind, etc., are not possible, so the elements are not established without mutual dependence, and therefore are not established as intrinsically real.

original: par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of the Ratnāvalī,

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, Just so, etc.

original: sa la sogs pa rnams kyi nang nas 'byung ba re re ngo bo nyid du yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rnams kyi nang nas 'byung ba re re ngo bo nyid du yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that any one of the elements, such as earth, exists inherently among the elements.

original: ngo bo nyid du med pa la rgyu mtshan ston pa ni /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du med pa la rgyu mtshan ston pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the reason for the lack of inherent existence is:

original: gang gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Because each of the three

original: gang gi phyir sa la sogs pa re re yang chu la sogs pa gsum gsum med na yang med la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa la sogs pa re re yang chu la sogs pa gsum gsum med na yang med la /
translated: Because each of the elements, such as earth, does not exist without the other three, such as water,

original: sa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'byung ba gcig med par yang gsum med la /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'byung ba gcig med par yang gsum med la /
translated: and because the three do not exist without any one of the characteristics of the elements, such as earth,

original: de nas 'byung ba rnams rang bzhin yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nas 'byung ba rnams rang bzhin yod pa ma yin te /
translated: the elements do not exist inherently.

original: phan tshun ltos nas rang bzhin thob pas ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos nas rang bzhin thob pas ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The point is that they do not exist inherently because they obtain their natures in mutual dependence.

original: rang bzhin med pa la 'dus pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa la 'dus pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is no aggregation of that which lacks inherent existence,🔽it is said:🔽  Individually, they do not exist.

original: so sor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
analyzed: so sor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
translated: It is easy to understand.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas btags pa'i bum pa la rgyu rdzas yod du mi @231a * //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas btags pa'i bum pa la rgyu rdzas yod du mi @231a * //
translated: In another way, the pot that is imputed does not have substantially existent causes.

original: rigs so zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rigs so zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir / ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason, he says:🔽Just as an impermanent effect does not arise from a permanent cause,🔽so an unreal effect does not arise from a real cause.

original: rtag pa las mi rtag pa skye bar mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu la rnam 'gyur med par 'bras bu med pas so //
analyzed: rtag pa las mi rtag pa skye bar mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu la rnam 'gyur med par 'bras bu med pas so //
translated: An impermanent effect does not arise from a permanent cause, because an effect does not exist without a transformation of the cause.

original: de bzhin du rdzas su yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa las rdzas su med pa'i bum pa 'byung bar mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzas su yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa las rdzas su med pa'i bum pa 'byung bar mi rigs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, it is not reasonable for an unreal pot to arise from real form, etc.

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As it is said:

original: dngos po rtag pa las byung ba //
analyzed: dngos po rtag pa las byung ba //
translated: An effect arises from a permanent entity.

original: zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i sa bon las myu gu zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu mi rtag pa skye ba yin no zhes 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i sa bon las myu gu zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu mi rtag pa skye ba yin no zhes 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa yin gyi /
translated: An impermanent effect arises from an impermanent seed, such as a sprout. This is well known in the world.

original: gang du yang rtag pas mi rtag pa skye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang du yang rtag pas mi rtag pa skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Nowhere does an impermanent effect arise from a permanent cause.

original: 'di ltar rgyu 'bras mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nam yang mthong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu 'bras mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nam yang mthong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus, a cause and effect with different characteristics are never seen.

original: rgyu rtag pa yin la 'bras bu mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba nyid 'jig rten na nam yang mthong ba ma yin pas rtag pa rgyu nyid du mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu rtag pa yin la 'bras bu mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba nyid 'jig rten na nam yang mthong ba ma yin pas rtag pa rgyu nyid du mi rigs pa'o //
translated: It is never seen in the world that a cause is permanent and an effect is impermanent. Therefore, it is not reasonable that the permanent is a cause.

original: bsdus pa'i don bstan pa'i sgo nas btags par yod pa ni btags par yod pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don bstan pa'i sgo nas btags par yod pa ni btags par yod pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that the cause of the existence of designations is taught from the perspective of the meaning of the summary,

original: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Therefore, in that way,” and so on.

original: bzhin la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni mgul pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni mgul pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: With regard to “face” and so on, the word “and so on” includes the neck and so on.

original: bzhin la sogs pa la btags su yod pa nyid bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin la sogs pa la btags su yod pa nyid bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The existence of designations in the face and so on should be understood to be like the existence of designations in the pot and so on.

original: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dang 'dra ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dang 'dra ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: “Reflection” is the form that resembles a person.

original: thams cad du btags par yod pa nyid sngar bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du btags par yod pa nyid sngar bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The existence of designations in all cases should be understood as before.

original: de la dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab kyi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab kyi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of the wisdom of the root text of the Middle Way,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “As it is said…” and so forth.

original: 'dir ni rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs sprul zhing //🔽sprul pas sprul pa gzhan sprul byed //
analyzed: 'dir ni rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs sprul zhing // sprul pas sprul pa gzhan sprul byed //
translated: Here, the Buddha emanated a perfect emanation,🔽and that emanation emanated another emanation.

original: des kyang sprul pa gzhan sprul la //🔽de ltar sprul pa dang mtshungs pa'i //
analyzed: des kyang sprul pa gzhan sprul la // de ltar sprul pa dang mtshungs pa'i //
translated: And that one also emanated another emanation.🔽In that way, the agent and the object

original: byed pa po dang des byas las //🔽ci ltar sprul pas sprul pa gzhan //
analyzed: byed pa po dang des byas las // ci ltar sprul pas sprul pa gzhan //
translated: are similar to emanations.🔽Just as an emanation emanates another emanation,

original: sprul pa byed pa de bzhin du //
analyzed: sprul pa byed pa de bzhin du //
translated: in the same way,🔽afflictions, karma,🔽body, agent, and effect

original: nyon mongs dang ni las dag dang ; / lus dang byed po 'bras bu yin //
analyzed: nyon mongs dang ni las dag dang ; / lus dang byed po 'bras bu yin //
translated: are similar to emanations.

original: zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'di sogs pa'i sgra dang bar du zhes bya ba'i tshig gis gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'di sogs pa'i sgra dang bar du zhes bya ba'i tshig gis gzung bar bya'o //
translated: This passage should be understood as connected by the words “and so forth” and “in the same way.”

original: 'di'i don ni ci ltar ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus sprul pa sprul par mdzad la /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni ci ltar ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus sprul pa sprul par mdzad la /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Just as the Teacher, the Bhagavān Buddha, emanates emanations through the power of his miraculous abilities,

original: gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis @231b sprul pa sprul pa des kyang sprul pa gzhan sprul par byed do //
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis @231b sprul pa sprul pa des kyang sprul pa gzhan sprul par byed do //
translated: Whatever emanation is emanated by the Lord Buddha, that emanation emanates another emanation.

original: de la sprul pa gzhan sprul par byed pa'i sprul pa gang yin pa de stong pa nyid rang bzhin med pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la sprul pa gzhan sprul par byed pa'i sprul pa gang yin pa de stong pa nyid rang bzhin med pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The emanation that emanates another emanation is empty, essenceless, and devoid of the essence of the Tathagata.

original: sprul pa sprul pa'i sprul pa gang yin pa de yang stong pa nyid rang bzhin med pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: sprul pa sprul pa'i sprul pa gang yin pa de yang stong pa nyid rang bzhin med pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'o //
translated: The emanation that is emanated by the emanation is also empty, essenceless, and devoid of the essence of the Tathagata.

original: ji ltar 'dir rang bzhin med pa rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa 'bras bus byed pa dang / byed pa po dang las kyi ming 'thob par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dir yang las byed pa po de ni sprul pa'i rnam pa ste ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir rang bzhin med pa rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa 'bras bus byed pa dang / byed pa po dang las kyi ming 'thob par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dir yang las byed pa po de ni sprul pa'i rnam pa ste ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'o //
translated: Just as here, the essencelessness of those that are essenceless is the effect, and the agent and the action are designated, in the same way, here also, the agent of the action is the emanation, which is empty of essence.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i byed pa po des las gang cung zad byed pa de yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i byed pa po des las gang cung zad byed pa de yang rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin te /
translated: The agent who is empty of essential existence performs some action that is also empty of essence.

original: dper na sprul pa pos sprul pa gzhan sprul pa de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na sprul pa pos sprul pa gzhan sprul pa de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood to be like the case of an emanated person creating another emanated person.

original: sprul pa'i dpes rang bzhin med par lta ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: sprul pa'i dpes rang bzhin med par lta ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only does the example of the emanated person show the absence of intrinsic existence,

original: 'on kyang dpe 'di dag gi sgo nas kyang gsal bar dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par khong du chud par gyis shig ces bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang dpe 'di dag gi sgo nas kyang gsal bar dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par khong du chud par gyis shig ces bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: but also through these examples one should understand that things are clearly without intrinsic existence.

original: nyon mongs dang ni las dag dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs dang ni las dag dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach this, he says, “Afflictions, actions, and the world,” and so on.

original: de la nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the afflictions are attachment and so on.

original: sems kyi rgyun nyon mongs shing gnod par byed pas so //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun nyon mongs shing gnod par byed pas so //
translated: The continuum of mind is afflicted and harmed by them.

original: las ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: las ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Actions are virtuous, nonvirtuous, and stable.

original: lus dang byed pa po zhes bya ba ni sems dang lus ni byed pa po'o //
analyzed: lus dang byed pa po zhes bya ba ni sems dang lus ni byed pa po'o //
translated: The body and the agent are the mind and the body, which are the agent.

original: 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa dang / bdag po dang / rgyu mthun gyi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa dang / bdag po dang / rgyu mthun gyi la sogs pa'o //
translated: The result is the ripened, the dominant, and the natural outflow, and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i dngos po'i rnams dri za'i grong khyer gyi rnam pa la sogs pa bzhin du rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i dngos po'i rnams dri za'i grong khyer gyi rnam pa la sogs pa bzhin du rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that things such as the afflictions are essenceless, like a city of gandharvas, and so on.

original: des na rdzas su yod pa rtags kyi rgyu ma yin pa nyid du zin kyang btags yod rgyur ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rdzas su yod pa rtags kyi rgyu ma yin pa nyid du zin kyang btags yod rgyur ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, although it is not the case that substantial existence is the cause of the reason, it is reasonable that imputed existence is the cause.

original: de'i phyir 'di brgal ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di brgal ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, this is not a reductio.

original: btags pa la rgyu med pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni brgal ba de ma yin no //🔽de la gzhan gyi phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
analyzed: btags pa la rgyu med pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni brgal ba de ma yin no // de la gzhan gyi phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
translated: The reductio that “because there is no cause of the imputation, it follows that like the son of a barren woman, it would not arise” is not the reductio that is being presented here.

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, setting forth the opponent’s position, the text says, “Here some say,” and so on.

original: phyogs snga ma gnyis kar yang zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i phyogs dag tu'o //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma gnyis kar yang zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i phyogs dag tu'o //
translated: “In both of the two positions” refers to the positions of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: kun rdzob tu skye ba ci ltar nges par bya ste 'gal ba yin no zhes pa'o //🔽de la lan bstan @232a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu skye ba ci ltar nges par bya ste 'gal ba yin no zhes pa'o // de la lan bstan @232a * //
translated: How can one ascertain that there is arising in the relative? There is a contradiction.

original: par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reply to that,

original: de brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “That should be stated,” and so on.

original: de'i phyir brten nas rab tu skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ma brtags na nyams dga' bar gzhan la brten nas skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir brten nas rab tu skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ma brtags na nyams dga' bar gzhan la brten nas skye ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “arising occurs in dependence,” meaning that arising occurs in dependence on another, which is delightful when not examined.

original: rang bzhin skye ba ni ma yin te phyogs gnyis char yang rang bzhin skye bar 'gegs par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin skye ba ni ma yin te phyogs gnyis char yang rang bzhin skye bar 'gegs par 'dod pas so //
translated: It is not arising by virtue of intrinsic nature, because both positions are asserted to refute arising by virtue of intrinsic nature.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that with an example,

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Because,” and so on.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: “In the manner that has been explained” means in the manner of “not from itself,” and so on.

original: sred med kyi bu zhes bya ba ni khyab 'jug ste /
analyzed: sred med kyi bu zhes bya ba ni khyab 'jug ste /
translated: “Nārāyaṇa” is Viṣṇu.

original: 'ga' zhig gis khyab 'jug 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyur 'dod pas so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis khyab 'jug 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyur 'dod pas so //
translated: Some assert that Viṣṇu is the cause of transmigrating beings.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni bdag la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni bdag la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The words “and so on” include the self and so on.

original: de tsam zhig la zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba tsam la'o //
analyzed: de tsam zhig la zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba tsam la'o //
translated: “ Just that” means just dependent origination.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad mi bcad pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la ma brten na 'jig rten gyi tha snyad rgyun chad par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad mi bcad pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la ma brten na 'jig rten gyi tha snyad rgyun chad par 'gyur bas so //
translated: “ In order not to eliminate worldly convention” means that if one does not rely on dependent origination, worldly convention would be interrupted.

original: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the scriptural source for that, he says

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “As it is said” and so on.

original: chos kyi brda zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi skye ba'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: chos kyi brda zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi skye ba'i tha snyad do //
translated: The “conventional symbol of dharmas” is the convention of the arising of dharmas.

original: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dngos po 'di yod na 'bras bu'i dngos po 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin gyi rang bzhin skye bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dngos po 'di yod na 'bras bu'i dngos po 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin gyi rang bzhin skye bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: “ When this exists, that arises” means that when the cause exists, the effect arises, but it does not mean that an essence arises.

original: 'o na rtag pa yang rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na rtag pa yang rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: Well, then, even a permanent thing would be a cause,

original: dbang phyug yod na 'bras bu yod par 'gyur bas so zhe na /
analyzed: dbang phyug yod na 'bras bu yod par 'gyur bas so zhe na /
translated: because when Īśvara exists, the effect exists.

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The answer to that is:

original: 'di skyes pas 'di skye ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di skyes pas 'di skye ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “Because this arises, that arises.”

original: mi rtag pa kho na rgyu yin gyi rtag pa ni rgyu ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa kho na rgyu yin gyi rtag pa ni rgyu ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Only the impermanent is a cause; the permanent is not a cause.

original: de la dpes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dpes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to illustrate that with an example,

original: gang 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says “Whatever . . . ” and so on.

original: de la don 'di nyid rin po che'i phreng ba'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la don 'di nyid rin po che'i phreng ba'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of the Ratnāvalī, he says:

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Just as . . . ” and so on.

original: de yod pas na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ni rgyu yod na 'bras bu 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de yod pas na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ni rgyu yod na 'bras bu 'byung ba'o //
translated: “Because that exists, this arises” means that when the cause exists, the effect arises.

original: de dag rang bzhin gyis grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag rang bzhin gyis grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not exist essentially,

original: phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are mutually dependent.

original: de la dpe ston pa ni /🔽dpe / ring po yod na thung du bzhin //
analyzed: de la dpe ston pa ni / dpe / ring po yod na thung du bzhin //
translated: In order to illustrate that, he says:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Like long and short . . . ” and so on.

original: ci ltar 'dir phan tshun ltos nas 'grub pa de bzhin du yang ngo //
analyzed: ci ltar 'dir phan tshun ltos nas 'grub pa de bzhin du yang ngo //
translated: Just as they are established in mutual dependence, so it is in this case.

original: rtag pa rgyur 'dod pa 'gegs pa ni /
analyzed: rtag pa rgyur 'dod pa 'gegs pa ni /
translated: In order to refute the assertion that the permanent is a cause, he says:

original: 'di skyes pas na 'di skyes dper //
analyzed: 'di skyes pas na 'di skyes dper //
translated: Because this arises, that arises, as in the case of

original: zhes bya ba @232b gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba @232b gsungs so //
translated: the example.

original: bstan bcos las zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
analyzed: bstan bcos las zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
translated: From the treatise means from the Root Knowledge.

original: 'di tsam zhig kho na la zhes bya ba ni phan tshun ltos nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po tsam mo //
analyzed: 'di tsam zhig kho na la zhes bya ba ni phan tshun ltos nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po tsam mo //
translated: Just this much means just the mutual dependence of cause and effect.

original: byed po las la brten byas shing //
analyzed: byed po las la brten byas shing //
translated: The agent is dependent on the action.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dir las la ma ltos pa'i cung zad kyang mi byed pa ni byed pa po nyid ma yin pas las la ltos pa'i byed pa po ni byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dir las la ma ltos pa'i cung zad kyang mi byed pa ni byed pa po nyid ma yin pas las la ltos pa'i byed pa po ni byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: Here, that which does not do anything without depending on the action is not the agent. Therefore, the agent who depends on the action is the agent.

original: las kyang byed pa po la ma ltos par las su bya ba mi rigs pas byed pa po kho na la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: las kyang byed pa po la ma ltos par las su bya ba mi rigs pas byed pa po kho na la ltos pa yin no //
translated: Also, the action is not tenable as the object of action without depending on the agent. Therefore, it depends on the agent alone.

original: des na byed pa po de la brten nas las 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: des na byed pa po de la brten nas las 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Thus the action arises in dependence on that agent.

original: de ltar las dang byed pa po dag phan tshun ltos te grub pa ma gtogs pa grub pa'i rgyu gzhan ni ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar las dang byed pa po dag phan tshun ltos te grub pa ma gtogs pa grub pa'i rgyu gzhan ni ma mthong ba'o //
translated: Thus, apart from the establishment of action and agent through mutual dependence, no other cause of establishment is seen.

original: ci ltar las dang byed pa po dag phan tshun ltos nas grub pa de bzhin du dngos po gzhan la yang yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ltar las dang byed pa po dag phan tshun ltos nas grub pa de bzhin du dngos po gzhan la yang yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that just as action and agent are established in mutual dependence, so too are other things,

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Likewise, appropriation and the appropriator,” and so on.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba 'dis ni bstan ma thag pa'i las dang byed pa po dag btags pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba 'dis ni bstan ma thag pa'i las dang byed pa po dag btags pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The word “likewise” indicates that action and agent are merely imputed, as was just explained.

original: nyer len zhes bya ba 'dis ni nye bar len pas na nye bar len pa ste zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyer len zhes bya ba 'dis ni nye bar len pas na nye bar len pa ste zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: The word “appropriation” indicates that it is appropriation because it appropriates.

original: de yang rang gi sgrub par byed pa byed pa po dang len pa po dang / nye bar blang bar bya ba la ma ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang rang gi sgrub par byed pa byed pa po dang len pa po dang / nye bar blang bar bya ba la ma ltos pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not independent of its own instrument, the agent, and the object of appropriation.

original: nye bar blang bar bya ba dang nye bar len pa po dag las dang byed pa po bzhin du phan tshun ltos nas grub pa yin gyi rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar blang bar bya ba dang nye bar len pa po dag las dang byed pa po bzhin du phan tshun ltos nas grub pa yin gyi rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Just as action and agent are established in mutual dependence, so too appropriation and the appropriator are not established intrinsically.

original: ci'i phyir rang bzhin gyis ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rang bzhin gyis ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they not established intrinsically?

original: las dang byed po bsal phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang byed po bsal phyir ro //
translated: Because the agent and action are refuted.

original: zhes bya ba bsal ba ni spangs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bsal ba ni spangs pa'o //
translated: The word “refuted” means “excluded.”

original: des na 'di'i don ni rgyu mtshan gang gis byed pa po dang las dag la kho bo lan brjod pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyis nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang bar bya ba dag kyang bkag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des na 'di'i don ni rgyu mtshan gang gis byed pa po dang las dag la kho bo lan brjod pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyis nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang bar bya ba dag kyang bkag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of this passage is as follows: Since the agent and action are refuted by the reasonings stated by us, the appropriator and the appropriated should be understood to be refuted by the same reasonings.

original: phan tshun ltos nas grub pa'i phyir byed pa dang las dag bkag pa yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma bas kyi gzhan yang yod do zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: phan tshun ltos nas grub pa'i phyir byed pa dang las dag bkag pa yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma bas kyi gzhan yang yod do zhes ston pa ni /
translated: The point of the following passage is to show that not only are the agent and action refuted because they exist in mutual dependence, but also that other things exist in mutual dependence.

original: byed pa po dang las dag gis //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las dag gis //
translated: By the refutation of the agent and action,

original: dngos po lhag ma shes par bya //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dngos po lhag ma shes par bya // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The rest should be understood.🔽The rest should be understood as being like the agent and action.

original: shes rab can gyis zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: shes rab can gyis zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The word “wisely” is an ellipsis.

original: las dang byed pa po dang nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang bar bya ba las ma gtogs pa'i gang dngos po gzhan skyed par byed pa dang / bskyed par bya ba dang / 'gro ba po dang / 'gro ba dang / mthong bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: las dang byed pa po dang nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang bar bya ba las ma gtogs pa'i gang dngos po gzhan skyed par byed pa dang / bskyed par bya ba dang / 'gro ba po dang / 'gro ba dang / mthong bar bya ba dang /
translated: Apart from action, agent, appropriator, and that appropriated, there is no other thing that is a producer, that which is produced, a goer, going, that which is seen,

original: mthong ba dang / mtshan nyid dang / @233a * //
analyzed: mthong ba dang / mtshan nyid dang / @233a * //
translated: a seer, a characteristic,🔽that which is characterized, and likewise, a part, a quality, that which possesses a quality, a valid cognition, an object of comprehension, and so on.

original: mtshan bya dang / de bzhin du cha shas dang / yon tan dang / yon tan can dang / tshad ma dang / gzhal bya la sogs pa dngos po ma lus pa de rnams las dang byed pa po dag dpyad pa'i sgo nas rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid bkag nas phan tshun ltos nas grub par shes rab can gyis rtogs par bya'o snyam pa de lta bu'i rten cing 'brel
analyzed: mtshan bya dang / de bzhin du cha shas dang / yon tan dang / yon tan can dang / tshad ma dang / gzhal bya la sogs pa dngos po ma lus pa de rnams las dang byed pa po dag dpyad pa'i sgo nas rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid bkag nas phan tshun ltos nas grub par shes rab can gyis rtogs par bya'o snyam pa de lta bu'i rten cing 'brel
translated: All of these things are to be understood by the wise as being established in mutual dependence, having refuted their intrinsic existence by means of the analysis of action and agent.

original: par 'byung ba khas blangs pa la yon tan bstan par bya ba'i phyir de ltar rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: par 'byung ba khas blangs pa la yon tan bstan par bya ba'i phyir de ltar rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to show the good qualities of accepting the arising of things, he says, “In this way, it is merely due to the conditionality of this,” and so on.

original: rkyen 'di nyid 'di pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni 'di yod pas na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di tsam gyis so //
analyzed: rkyen 'di nyid 'di pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni 'di yod pas na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di tsam gyis so //
translated: “ Merely due to the conditionality of this” means merely due to the statement, “Because this exists, this occurs.”

original: skye ba la sogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni bdag las skye ba la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni bdag las skye ba la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: “ Arising, and so on” and so on refers to arising from self and so on.

original: rtag pa dang zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad pas so //
analyzed: rtag pa dang zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad pas so //
translated: “ Permanent” means uninterrupted.

original: ther zug pa dang zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa med pas so //
analyzed: ther zug pa dang zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa med pas so //
translated: “ Immutable” means without arising and disintegration.

original: gnyis pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: “ Dualistic” and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The word “and so on” includes such things as having a self and being selfless.

original: gang phyir dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang phyir dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “ Because things do not exist” and so on.

original: rtog pa 'di dag brtag par mi nus pas //
analyzed: rtog pa 'di dag brtag par mi nus pas //
translated: These conceptions cannot be conceived.

original: zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa rnams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa rnams te /
translated: This refers to the conceptual thoughts of permanence, etc.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin yod par gyur na rtog pa rnams 'jug par 'gyur ba las rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyis dngos po'i rang bzhin med pas rtag pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa rnams gang du 'jug par 'gyur zhes pa'o //🔽rten 'byung rigs pa 'di yis ni //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin yod par gyur na rtog pa rnams 'jug par 'gyur ba las rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyis dngos po'i rang bzhin med pas rtag pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa rnams gang du 'jug par 'gyur zhes pa'o // rten 'byung rigs pa 'di yis ni //
translated: If the intrinsic reality of things existed, the conceptual thoughts would engage. But, since the intrinsic reality of things does not exist due to dependent origination itself, where would the conceptual thoughts of permanence, etc. engage?🔽By this very reasoning of dependent origination,

original: zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de nyid rigs pa yin pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de nyid rigs pa yin pas so //
translated: This refers to the very dependent origination being the reasoning.

original: lta ngan dra ba zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i lta ba'i dra ba rnams so //
analyzed: lta ngan dra ba zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i lta ba'i dra ba rnams so //
translated: The “net of bad views” are the nets of views such as permanence, etc.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “because of which, etc. ”

original: gzhan du ma yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin pa dang / gzhan la mi ltos pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin pa dang / gzhan la mi ltos pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Not elsewhere” means not fabricated and not dependent on another.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rigs pa 'dis ci ltar lta ba ngan pa'i dra ba gcod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rigs pa 'dis ci ltar lta ba ngan pa'i dra ba gcod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does this reasoning of dependent arising cut the net of bad views?

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The answer to that is:

original: 'di ltar rkyen nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rkyen nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni gsungs te /
translated: Thus, it is said, “Conditioned by this and that…”

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon klu sgrub zhabs kyis so //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon klu sgrub zhabs kyis so //
translated: “As it is said” and so on is stated by the master Nāgārjuna.

original: de dang de rten gang 'byung bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyu dang rkyen gyi dngos po de dang de la brten @233b nas myu gu la sogs pa gang skyes pa de dag rang gi ngo bor skyes pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de dang de rten gang 'byung bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyu dang rkyen gyi dngos po de dang de la brten @233b nas myu gu la sogs pa gang skyes pa de dag rang gi ngo bor skyes pa ma yin zhing /
translated: “Whatever arises in dependence on this and that…” and so on means that whatever arises, such as a sprout, in dependence on this and that causal and conditional thing, that does not arise by its own intrinsic reality.

original: de la rang bzhin yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It does not exist by its own intrinsic reality.

original: rang bzhin ni bcos ma ma yin pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni bcos ma ma yin pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas so //
translated: This is because intrinsic reality is endowed with being unfabricated and so on.

original: gang ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa de ni skyes pa zhes ji ltar brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa de ni skyes pa zhes ji ltar brjod par bya ste /
translated: How can that which does not arise by its own intrinsic reality be said to arise?

original: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is without intrinsic reality.

original: / des na rang bzhin skye ba med pas lta ba ngan pa'i dra ba mtha' dag 'gag par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: / des na rang bzhin skye ba med pas lta ba ngan pa'i dra ba mtha' dag 'gag par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, since the nature of things is non-arising, the entire net of bad views is stopped.🔽In order to show the source of the Wisdom

original: dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab kyi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab kyi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Chapter of the Mulamadhyamaka,

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “In the same way,” and so forth.

original: gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste rgyu dang rkyen la ltos pa'i myu gu dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyi rab tu skye ba de ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste rgyu dang rkyen la ltos pa'i myu gu dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyi rab tu skye ba de ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The full arising of things such as sprouts and consciousness, which are dependent originations, that is, which depend on causes and conditions, is not arising by virtue of intrinsic nature.

original: gang ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa de stong pa nyid de rkyen gyis bskyed pa la rang bzhin med pas so //
analyzed: gang ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa de stong pa nyid de rkyen gyis bskyed pa la rang bzhin med pas so //
translated: That which does not arise by virtue of intrinsic nature is emptiness, because that which is produced by conditions has no intrinsic nature.

original: gal te stong pa nyid yin pa de la rgyur byas nas btags pa yin no zhes rnam par bzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te stong pa nyid yin pa de la rgyur byas nas btags pa yin no zhes rnam par bzhag par bya ste /
translated: If it is asked, “Is it posited that it is imputed in dependence on emptiness?”

original: 'khor lo la sogs pa shing rta'i yan lag la brten nas shing rta zhes 'dogs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'khor lo la sogs pa shing rta'i yan lag la brten nas shing rta zhes 'dogs pa yin la /
translated: The answer is that just as a chariot is imputed in dependence on the parts of the chariot, such as the wheels,

original: de la rang gi yan lag la brten nas btags pa gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: de la rang gi yan lag la brten nas btags pa gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa yin la /
translated: That which is imputed in dependence on its parts is not intrinsically produced.

original: gang rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa de ni stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa de ni stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: That which is not intrinsically produced is emptiness.

original: gang rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid can stong pa nyid de nyid la dbu ma'i lam zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid can stong pa nyid de nyid la dbu ma'i lam zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: That emptiness which has the characteristic of not being intrinsically produced should be called the middle path.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa de la yod pa nyid med pa dang / ngo bo nyid ma skyes pa la 'jig pa med pas med pa nyid la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa de la yod pa nyid med pa dang / ngo bo nyid ma skyes pa la 'jig pa med pas med pa nyid la /
translated: Since that which is not intrinsically produced does not exist, and that which is not intrinsically produced does not cease, it is not nonexistent.

original: des na dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it is free from the two extremes of existence and nonexistence,

original: rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid can stong pa nyid de nyid la dbu ma'i lam yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid can stong pa nyid de nyid la dbu ma'i lam yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: that emptiness which has the characteristic of not being intrinsically produced should be called the middle path.

original: des na stong pa nyid kho na la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / stong pa nyid dang rgyur byas rdas brtags pa dang / dbu ma'i lam zhes bya ba ni ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: des na stong pa nyid kho na la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / stong pa nyid dang rgyur byas rdas brtags pa dang / dbu ma'i lam zhes bya ba ni ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: Therefore, emptiness alone is the dependent origination, emptiness alone is the imputation based on causes, and emptiness alone is the middle path.

original: don 'di la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don 'di la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the scriptural source for this meaning,🔽it says in a sutra,

original: mdo sde las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo sde las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: gang zhig rkyen las skye ba de ni ma skyes pa yin te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig rkyen las skye ba de ni ma skyes pa yin te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Whatever is born from conditions is not born. Why is that?🔽Because its nature is not to be born.

original: de la skye ba'i rang bzhin yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de la skye ba'i rang bzhin yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said:

original: rang bzhin bcos ma ma yin zhing //
analyzed: rang bzhin bcos ma ma yin zhing //
translated: Nature is not fabricated

original: gzhan la ltos pa yod ma yin //🔽zhes gsungs pas so //🔽des na gang rkyen @234a * //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa yod ma yin // zhes gsungs pas so // des na gang rkyen @234a * //
translated: and does not depend on another.

original: gyi dbang du gyur pa de ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gyi dbang du gyur pa de ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, whatever is under the power of conditions is emptiness.

original: bag yod yin zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bag med par ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bag yod yin zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bag med par ma gyur pa'o //
translated: Being heedful means not being heedless due to afflictions such as attachment.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar /
translated: When it is like that,

original: rang bzhin khas ma blangs pa de yi tshe //
analyzed: rang bzhin khas ma blangs pa de yi tshe //
translated: When you do not accept intrinsic reality,

original: zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid yin pas rang bzhin khas ma blangs pa de'i tshe ci ltar bstan pa'i 'du byed la sogs pa rnams la rang bzhin med pas rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams gang du 'jug par 'gyur
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid yin pas rang bzhin khas ma blangs pa de'i tshe ci ltar bstan pa'i 'du byed la sogs pa rnams la rang bzhin med pas rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams gang du 'jug par 'gyur
translated: Since they are dependently arisen, when you do not accept intrinsic reality, then how could the conceptualizations of permanence and so on operate in regard to the dependently originated things such as compositional activity?

original: zhes pa'o // de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that extensively, he says:

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If you think that conceptualizations arise without an object,🔽No, because they would arise always and everywhere.

original: rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med na'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med na'o //
translated: In another way, not so, because they would arise without an object.

original: rtog rnams dngos po yod na 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: rtog rnams dngos po yod na 'gyur ba ste //
translated: Conceptualizations arise when there is an existent thing.

original: zhes bya ba ni de rnams dngos po'i yul can yin pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de rnams dngos po'i yul can yin pas so //
translated: Since they have existent things as their objects.🔽How could a nonexistent thing be an object?

original: dngos po ci ltar med pa yongs dpyad zin //
analyzed: dngos po ci ltar med pa yongs dpyad zin //
translated: We have already analyzed this thoroughly.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po med pa nyid du bsgrub pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po med pa nyid du bsgrub pas so //
translated: Since we have established that things do not exist through such arguments as “not from themselves,” they do not exist.

original: 'di rnams zhes bya ba ni rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams zhes bya ba ni rtog pa'o //
translated: These refers to the conceptualizations.

original: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that by means of an example,🔽he says,

original: dper na bud shing med par me yod min de bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: dper na bud shing med par me yod min de bzhin // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Just as fire is not without fuel,🔽so there is no cognition without an object.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says,

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Because, etc.

original: ma gzigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang ma gzigs pa de nyid gzigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma gzigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang ma gzigs pa de nyid gzigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of in a manner of not seeing is that he sees just that which is not seen, i.e., any dharma.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says,

original: chos gang la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: chos gang la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Any dharma, etc.

original: de kho na nyid mthong ba'i 'bras bu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong ba'i 'bras bu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the result of seeing reality, he says,

original: thog ma med pas goms pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: thog ma med pas goms pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Habituation from beginningless time, etc.

original: rnam par rtog pa log pa tsam gyi 'bras bu de rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa log pa tsam gyi 'bras bu de rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate extensively the result which is the mere cessation of conceptualization, he says,

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: For example, etc.

original: rang bzhin gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “By nature” means that it is not by the nature of the thing itself.

original: yod pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: yod pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: “By another nature” means by an existent nature.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa log pa de'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa log pa de'i phyir ro ;
translated: “Therefore” means because of the cessation of conceptualization.

original: / rtog pas bcings zhes bya ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i sgo nas 'khor bar ltung bar byed pas so //
analyzed: / rtog pas bcings zhes bya ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i sgo nas 'khor bar ltung bar byed pas so //
translated: “Bound by conceptualization” means that by the adherence to entities, one falls into cyclic existence through the door of conceptualization such as attachment.

original: mi rtog rnal 'byor pas ni grol 'gyur bas //
analyzed: mi rtog rnal 'byor pas ni grol 'gyur bas //
translated: “The non-conceptualizing yogi is liberated.”

original: zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor pas dngos por mi rtog cing 'dod chags la sogs @234b pa'i rnam par rtog pa log pas 'khor ba las grol bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor pas dngos por mi rtog cing 'dod chags la sogs @234b pa'i rnam par rtog pa log pas 'khor ba las grol bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that the yogi, not conceptualizing entities, is liberated from cyclic existence by the cessation of conceptualization such as attachment.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that, he says,

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Because of this, etc.”

original: chos nyid 'di zhes bya ba ni dngos po rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa ldog pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can no ;
analyzed: chos nyid 'di zhes bya ba ni dngos po rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa ldog pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can no ;
translated: “This reality” is the characteristic of the cessation of conceptualization by virtue of the essencelessness of entities.

original: / ji skad du zhes bya ba ni bzhi brgya pa las so //
analyzed: / ji skad du zhes bya ba ni bzhi brgya pa las so //
translated: “As it is said” is from the Catuh-śataka.

original: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de kho na nyid mthong ba'i don du stong pa nyid gsungs na de kho na nyid ni rang bzhin te /
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de kho na nyid mthong ba'i don du stong pa nyid gsungs na de kho na nyid ni rang bzhin te /
translated: “Entity” and so on. If emptiness is taught for the purpose of seeing reality, then reality is the nature,

original: ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: the essence.

original: rang bzhin de dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rang bzhin de dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur na /
translated: If that nature were to become some existent entity,

original: de'i tshe de nyid don dam pa yin pa'i phyir de mthong ba kho na grol bar 'dod pa rnams la bde legs su 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe de nyid don dam pa yin pa'i phyir de mthong ba kho na grol bar 'dod pa rnams la bde legs su 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: then at that time, since that is the ultimate, it would be good fortune for those who assert that liberation is only the seeing of that.

original: stong pa nyid mthong bas ni grol ba ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid mthong bas ni grol ba ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that liberation is due to seeing emptiness.

original: de'i tshe yon tan gyi don du ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi skur ba 'debs pa la zhugs pa'i phyir skyon 'di kho na'i don du 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i tshe yon tan gyi don du ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi skur ba 'debs pa la zhugs pa'i phyir skyon 'di kho na'i don du 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: At that time, not only would it not be for the sake of a good quality, but also because one would be engaged in deprecation, this fault alone would be the point.

original: gang gi tshe dngos po rang bzhin med pa rnams phyin ci log gi dbang gis rang bzhin dang bcas par snang ba ni 'jig rten pa'i mngon par zhen pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin no //
