analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po rang bzhin med pa rnams phyin ci log gi dbang gis rang bzhin dang bcas par snang ba ni 'jig rten pa'i mngon par zhen pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: When things that are essenceless appear to be endowed with essence due to error, they become the cause of worldly beings’ misconceptions.

original: des na 'khor ba'i rgyun 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'khor ba'i rgyun 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the continuum of cyclic existence occurs.

original: dngos por zhen pa'i rgyun can gyi las dang nyon mongs pa dag las skye ba'i rgyun 'byung ba yin pas so /
analyzed: dngos por zhen pa'i rgyun can gyi las dang nyon mongs pa dag las skye ba'i rgyun 'byung ba yin pas so /
translated: The continuum of birth occurs from the continuum of karma and afflictions that are based on the attachment to things.

original: des na rang bzhin med pa gsal bar byed pa'i bstan bcos ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa dag gsal ba'i sgo nas rang bzhin med pa'i dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rang bzhin med pa gsal bar byed pa'i bstan bcos ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa dag gsal ba'i sgo nas rang bzhin med pa'i dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the treatise that elucidates essencelessness, by elucidating superimposition and denial, teaches that things that are essenceless are indeed essenceless.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi dngos po'i rang bzhin med pa rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid du rtogs nas gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po rnams la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu can las dang nyon mongs pa dag zad pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa'i
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi dngos po'i rang bzhin med pa rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid du rtogs nas gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po rnams la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu can las dang nyon mongs pa dag zad pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa'i
translated: Having realized that the nature of things as perceived by worldly people does not exist, they exhaust karma and afflictions, which are the causes of clinging to things as real, as in the case of reflections and so on.

original: 'ching ba mtha' dag rgyun chad pa'i sgo nas nges par grol bar 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' dag rgyun chad pa'i sgo nas nges par grol bar 'gyur ba'i //
translated: Through this, they are definitely liberated by severing the continuum of all bonds of attachment and so on.

original: des na bstan bcos 'dir dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na bstan bcos 'dir dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this treatise, things are shown to be essenceless.🔽In order to show that this does not amount to denying dependent origination,🔽it is said:

original: 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la skur ba 'debs pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la skur ba 'debs pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: One is bound by the view of the transitory collection.🔽One is liberated by the wisdom of no-self.

original: rtog pa mthong bas 'ching ba ste //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rtog pa mthong bas 'ching ba ste // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: One is bound by the view of the transitory collection.🔽One is liberated by the wisdom of no-self.🔽One is bound by the view of the transitory collection.🔽One is liberated by the wisdom of no-self.🔽One is bound by the view of the transitory collection.🔽One is liberated by the wisdom of no-self.🔽One is bound by the view of the transitory collection.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dngos po la @235a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dngos po la @235a * //
translated: One is liberated by the wisdom of no-self.

original: sgro 'dogs pa la rtog pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa la rtog pa zhes bya la /
translated: One is bound by the view of the transitory collection.🔽One is liberated by the wisdom of no-self.

original: de'i sgo nas sems can rnams bcings pa rtogs nas rtog pa de ldog pa'i ched du sems can rnams sdug bsngal pas sdug bsngal ba thugs rje chen po mnga' ba de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la
analyzed: de'i sgo nas sems can rnams bcings pa rtogs nas rtog pa de ldog pa'i ched du sems can rnams sdug bsngal pas sdug bsngal ba thugs rje chen po mnga' ba de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la
translated: Having realized that sentient beings are bound by that, in order to reverse that conception, the Tathāgatas and Bodhisattvas, who possess great compassion for the suffering of sentient beings, teach dependent origination

original: mi gnod par dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid du sems can rnams la 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rgyun bcad par bya ba'i don du gsung bar mdzad pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnod par dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid du sems can rnams la 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rgyun bcad par bya ba'i don du gsung bar mdzad pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: to sentient beings, so that they may sever the continuum of the suffering of cyclic existence, without harming things, which are devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: des gsungs pa'i mdor bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin no zhes slob dpon gyis bstan bcos 'di 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: des gsungs pa'i mdor bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin no zhes slob dpon gyis bstan bcos 'di 'chad pa yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the brief statement. The master teaches this treatise.

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir bstan bcos ni rnam par rtog pa ldog pa'i ched du yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: “For that very reason” means that because the treatise is for the purpose of reversing conception, therefore…

original: dpyad ces bya ba ni chos kyi rang bzhin gyi yul can gyi yongs su dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: dpyad ces bya ba ni chos kyi rang bzhin gyi yul can gyi yongs su dpyod pa'o //
translated: The word investigate means to investigate the object which is the nature of phenomena.

original: rtsod la chags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang gi phyogs rnam par gzhag pa dang / gzhan gyi phyogs bzlog pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rtsod pa la chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsod la chags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang gi phyogs rnam par gzhag pa dang / gzhan gyi phyogs bzlog pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rtsod pa la chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of attachment to dispute means because of attachment to dispute which has the nature of establishing one's own position and refuting the position of others.

analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can no // de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The word reality has the characteristic of emptiness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach that, he says, Therefore, etc.

original: rnam par dpyod pa shin tu cher mdzad pa ;
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa shin tu cher mdzad pa ;

analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni bdag las ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

original: de ni rtsod la chags pa ste //
analyzed: de ni rtsod la chags pa ste //

analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni gzhan zil gyis gnon par 'dod pas ma mdzad do zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: bkod cing bkod cing zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma bkod cing bkod cing ste 'di ltar bdag las skyo ba 'gog pa'i gnas skabs na gal te 'di snyam du myu gu skye ba las phan 'dogs pa'i chu la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams zhes bya ba la sogs
translated: of water, etc., which benefit the arising of the sprout . . . ,” etc., you have

analyzed: pas phyogs snga mar bkod par mdzad pa dang / de bzhin du gzhan las skye ba 'gog pa'i gnas skabs na gang /

analyzed: gzhan dag las ni ga la zhig / ces bya ba la sogs pa gang brjod pa de ni mi rigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs snga ma 'god pa @235b yin no ;

analyzed: / des na bstan bcos rtsod pa'i don du ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na'o //

analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the answer to that, he says:

analyzed: brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The text continues: I will explain.🔽🔽

translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Having taught the meaning characterized by emptiness by way of the negation of the production of things by not from self and so on,

analyzed: dngos po rang bzhin gyis zhig par 'gyur bas kho bo cag la nyes pa ci zhig yod ces pa'o //

analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: gal te de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: If it is that very thing . . . and so on.

analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba ni bzhi brgya pa las so //

analyzed: chos 'di de bzhin gshegs rnams kyis //

analyzed: rtsod pa mdzad phyir gsungs ma yin //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te chos 'di rtsod pa bya ba'i ched du gsungs par gyur na de'i tshe lta ba ngan pa thams cad rab tu gzhom pa'i phyir chos bstan pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ba yin pa las rtsod pa'i ched du gsungs pa ni
translated: If this doctrine were taught for the sake of debate, then it would be a teaching of the Dharma in order to completely conquer all bad views.

analyzed: ma yin te /

analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo nyid du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is taught as the very door of liberation.

original: de ltar yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: de ltar yin du zin kyang /

analyzed: 'on kyang me yis bud shing ltar // 'di yis phas kyi rgol ba sreg / ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: like fire burns fuel.

original: chos 'di rtsod pa mdzad pa'i ched du ma gsungs kyang phas kyi rgol ba thams cad tshar gcod pa yin te /
analyzed: chos 'di rtsod pa mdzad pa'i ched du ma gsungs kyang phas kyi rgol ba thams cad tshar gcod pa yin te /
translated: Even though this doctrine is not taught for the sake of debate, it completely destroys all opponents,

original: dper na me don du gnyer ba ni 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i don du yin gyi bud shing bsreg pa'i don du ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na me don du gnyer ba ni 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i don du yin gyi bud shing bsreg pa'i don du ma yin no //
translated: just as fire, which is sought for the sake of cooking and so on, not for the sake of burning fuel, burns fuel.

original: de ltar na yang rang gi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu sgrub par byed cing sreg par byed pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas bud shing yang sreg par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang rang gi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu sgrub par byed cing sreg par byed pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas bud shing yang sreg par byed pa yin no //
translated: In this way, it is the fuel that is the nature of the agent of the accomplishment and burning of the desired result.

original: me ci lta ba de bzhin du chos thams cad bdag med par shes pa yang dad pa can gyi rgyud la skye zhing shes par bya'o //
analyzed: me ci lta ba de bzhin du chos thams cad bdag med par shes pa yang dad pa can gyi rgyud la skye zhing shes par bya'o //
translated: Just as with fire, so it is with the knowledge of the selflessness of all phenomena, which arises in the mindstream of the faithful.

original: de ltar ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid kyi don du ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid kyi don du ma yin no //
translated: Not so, means not for the sake of reality.

analyzed: rtog pa ldog pa nyid mi srid do zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi rnam par rtog pa 'jug pas so //
translated: The impossibility of the cessation of conceptualization itself is due to the engagement of the conceptualization of attachment and aversion.

original: de nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni /
translated: That itself is shown by🔽Why is it so?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: gzhan gyi lta ba la 'khrug gang //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lta ba la 'khrug gang //
translated: The agitation of another's view
