analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtog pa nyid yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: should be connected with is conceptualization itself.

original: rtsod pa'i ched du ma mdzad la phan yon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i ched du ma mdzad la phan yon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the benefit of not engaging in debate,

original: gang gi tshe chos 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: When it is said, “This dharma,” and so on.

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la @236a * //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la @236a * //
translated: “When it is said ‘this phenomenon’ and so on.

original: sogs pa ni 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis so //🔽rtsod med che ba'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: sogs pa ni 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis so // rtsod med che ba'i bdag nyid can //
translated: As it is said, and so on, by the noble lord.🔽The great ones are free from dispute.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid chen po 'phags pa rnams la ni rtsod pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid chen po 'phags pa rnams la ni rtsod pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The great beings, the noble ones, are free from dispute,

original: gang gi phyir 'phags pa rnams la yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i phyogs 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'phags pa rnams la yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i phyogs 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas so //
translated: because the noble ones have no position at all, such as existence or nonexistence.

original: gang la phyogs yod pa ma yin pa de la gzhan gyi phyogs lta ga la yod de /
analyzed: gang la phyogs yod pa ma yin pa de la gzhan gyi phyogs lta ga la yod de /
translated: How can there be an opponent’s position for one who has no position of his or her own?

original: gzhan gyi phyogs ni rang gi phyogs la ltos nas 'jog pa yin pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs ni rang gi phyogs la ltos nas 'jog pa yin pas so //
translated: An opponent’s position is posited in dependence on one’s own position.

original: des na rang gi phyogs dang gzhan gyi phyogs dag med pas rtsod pa med pa'i ched du bya ba'i bdag nyid can rnams so ;
analyzed: des na rang gi phyogs dang gzhan gyi phyogs dag med pas rtsod pa med pa'i ched du bya ba'i bdag nyid can rnams so ;
translated: Therefore, because there is no position of one’s own and no opponent’s position, the noble ones are free from dispute.

original: / de'i phyir chos 'di ni rtsod pa mdzad pa'i phyir gsungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / de'i phyir chos 'di ni rtsod pa mdzad pa'i phyir gsungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this teaching was not given for the sake of dispute.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mdor bsdu na phyogs ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mdor bsdu na phyogs ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Likewise, etc. In brief, there are two sides:

original: rang gi phyogs dang / gzhan gyi phyogs so //
analyzed: rang gi phyogs dang / gzhan gyi phyogs so //
translated: one’s own side and the other side.

original: de la gal te stong pa nyid kyi phyogs dag legs pa yin no zhes rang gi phyogs la chags pa yod na gzhan gyi phyogs phyin ci log yin pas khyod mi dga' ba de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de la gal te stong pa nyid kyi phyogs dag legs pa yin no zhes rang gi phyogs la chags pa yod na gzhan gyi phyogs phyin ci log yin pas khyod mi dga' ba de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: If one’s own side, i.e., the side of emptiness, is good, and one is attached to one’s own side, then the other side is wrong, and one does not go to nirvana because of one’s dislike of it.

original: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro bdag gis nye bar bcom pa'i gnyis la dpyod pa la mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro bdag gis nye bar bcom pa'i gnyis la dpyod pa la mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa ma yin pas so //
translated: Nirvana is not in the analysis of the two, i.e., in the analysis of one’s own side and the other side, because of the destruction of attachment and aversion.

original: thams cad la btang snyoms pas chags pa dang sdang ba dag bcad nas ldog pa med pa bde ba dang ro gcig pa zhi ba nyid thob pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad la btang snyoms pas chags pa dang sdang ba dag bcad nas ldog pa med pa bde ba dang ro gcig pa zhi ba nyid thob pa yin no //
translated: Having cut off attachment and aversion, one attains peace, which is the same taste as bliss, because of indifference to everything.

original: gang la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag yod pa des mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ma yin no zhes mdo'i khungs kyi sgo nas ston pa ni /
analyzed: gang la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag yod pa des mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ma yin no zhes mdo'i khungs kyi sgo nas ston pa ni /
translated: The following verse is stated to show, by means of a sutra citation, that those who have attachment and aversion do not attain nirvana.

original: mdo sde las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo sde las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The sutra also says...

original: gang lung 'dir chos 'di thos nas rjes su chags shing 'dod chags skyed pa dang / mu stegs pa'i bstan bcos las bstan pa'i chos ma yin pa thos nas khong khro skyed par byed pa'i rnam pa de lta bu'i nga rgyal dang rgyags pas bcom pa de ni ngan song du sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o ;
analyzed: gang lung 'dir chos 'di thos nas rjes su chags shing 'dod chags skyed pa dang / mu stegs pa'i bstan bcos las bstan pa'i chos ma yin pa thos nas khong khro skyed par byed pa'i rnam pa de lta bu'i nga rgyal dang rgyags pas bcom pa de ni ngan song du sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o ;
translated: Those who, having heard this teaching in this scripture, generate attachment and aversion by giving rise to attachment and anger upon hearing the teachings of the tirthikas' treatises, are destroyed by such pride and conceit and will experience suffering in the lower realms.

original: / de ltar chos kyi bdag med pa bstan nas /
analyzed: / de ltar chos kyi bdag med pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the selflessness of phenomena,

original: da ni gang zag gi bdag med pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gang zag gi bdag med pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the selflessness of persons,

original: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the following verse is stated.

original: lung dang rigs pa dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pa ni bdag las ma yin gzhan las min zhes bya ba la sogs @236b pas so ;
analyzed: lung dang rigs pa dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pa ni bdag las ma yin gzhan las min zhes bya ba la sogs @236b pas so ;
translated: The reasoning of “neither from itself, nor from another” and so on is the reasoning of “through scripture and reasoning.”🔽

original: / lung ni ji skad du 'phags pas bcu pa'i mdo las zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: / lung ni ji skad du 'phags pas bcu pa'i mdo las zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: The reasoning is stated in the passage beginning “By scripture and reasoning,” and so on, and the scripture is stated in the passage beginning “As it is said in the noble Dashabhumika-sutra,” and so on.

original: de la gang zag gi bdag med pa ston pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la gang zag gi bdag med pa ston pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the reason for teaching the selflessness of persons,

original: nyon mongs skyon rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs skyon rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “The afflictions and faults,” and so on.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta bas 'byung bar zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi bar lta ba las skyes par ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta bas 'byung bar zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi bar lta ba las skyes par ro //
translated: “ Arising from the view of the transitory collection” means arising from the view of “I” and “mine.”

original: nyon mongs skyon rnams ma lus zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams dang / skye ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs skyon rnams ma lus zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams dang / skye ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: “ The afflictions and faults in their entirety” refers to the attachments and so on of the three realms, and to birth and so on.

original: 'di'i yul du zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i yul du'o //
analyzed: 'di'i yul du zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i yul du'o //
translated: “ As their object” means as the object of the view of the transitory collection.

original: rnal 'byor pa yis bdag ni 'gog par byed //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yis bdag ni 'gog par byed //
translated: The yogi/nī refutes the self.

original: ces bya ba ni bdag bkag pa'i sgo nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba 'gog par byed pas so //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bdag bkag pa'i sgo nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba 'gog par byed pas so //
translated: This is because the view of the transitory collection is refuted by way of the refutation of a self.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to explain that, he says:🔽In that regard, the view of the transitory collection is the ignorance that is the root of cyclic existence.

original: nga dang nga'i snyam pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes rab nyan thos la sogs pa la yod pas ;
analyzed: nga dang nga'i snyam pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes rab nyan thos la sogs pa la yod pas ;
translated: Since the wisdom that has the aspect of “I” and “mine” exists for śrāvakas and so on,

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: therefore he says, “it is afflicted.”

original: nyan thos la sogs pa la 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab med pas de rnams kyi 'jig tshogs la lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa la 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab med pas de rnams kyi 'jig tshogs la lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Since the wisdom that is concomitant with attachment and so on does not exist for śrāvakas and so on, it is not the case that their view of the transitory collection would follow.

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rnams 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yin pa la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rnams 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yin pa la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the scriptural source for the fact that the afflictions and so on are the causes of the view of the transitory collection, he says:

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: All afflictions are the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'dir ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Here, in the passage that begins “The root of cyclic existence is the view of the transitory collection,”

original: phyi ma phyi ma snga ma snga ma'i bshad pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma snga ma snga ma'i bshad pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the latter is the explanation of the former.

original: 'du byed mngon par grub pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed mngon par grub pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because of the establishment of the formative forces” means because of the establishment of attachment and so on.

original: ma lus pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang skyon no //
analyzed: ma lus pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang skyon no //
translated: “In its entirety” refers to the defilements and faults.

original: bdag gi bdag med pa nyid khong du chud pa la zhes bya ba ni bdag gi stong pa nyid khog du chud pas so //🔽bdag ces bya ba ni ci zhig ces bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: bdag gi bdag med pa nyid khong du chud pa la zhes bya ba ni bdag gi stong pa nyid khog du chud pas so // bdag ces bya ba ni ci zhig ces bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
translated: “In the realization of the selflessness of the self” means in the realization of the emptiness of the self.🔽What is this self?

original: bdag de ci zhig ces pa de nyid mi shes so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag de ci zhig ces pa de nyid mi shes so zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation of “what is this?” is: “one does not know what it is.”

original: de la gzhan gyi kun brtags pa'i bdag gi rang bzhin bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de la re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi kun brtags pa'i bdag gi rang bzhin bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de la re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of the self imagined by others, he says:🔽“In this regard, first of all...

original: rtag dngos zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du 'gyur ba med pas so //
analyzed: rtag dngos zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du 'gyur ba med pas so //
translated: “Permanent entity” means that it is unchanging at all times.

original: byed pa po min @237a * //
analyzed: byed pa po min @237a * //
translated: It is not the agent of the body.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam pas /
translated: This is the manner of explanation that will be given.

original: rang bzhin la sogs pa rnams byed pa po 'di nyid du khas len pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin la sogs pa rnams byed pa po 'di nyid du khas len pas so //
translated: This is because, as will be explained, this is accepted as the agent of nature, etc.

original: zab po zhes bya ba ni yul la nye bar longs spyod pas so //
analyzed: zab po zhes bya ba ni yul la nye bar longs spyod pas so //
translated: It is profound because it experiences objects.

original: yon tan med ces bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug gi rang bzhin can gyi yon tan med pas so //
analyzed: yon tan med ces bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gti mug gi rang bzhin can gyi yon tan med pas so //
translated: It is without qualities because it lacks the qualities of pleasure, pain, and delusion.

original: bya med ces bya ba ni thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir yul gzhan du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi bya ba med pas so //
analyzed: bya med ces bya ba ni thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir yul gzhan du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi bya ba med pas so //
translated: It is without action because it lacks action characterized by going to another place, since it pervades everything.

original: de dbye cung zad cung zad la brten nas //
analyzed: de dbye cung zad cung zad la brten nas //
translated: Based on slight distinctions,

original: zhes bya ba ni yon tan dang bcas pa nyid dang bya ba dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yon tan dang bcas pa nyid dang bya ba dang bcas pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: this is said to have qualities, action, etc.

original: 'di ni 'grel pas gsal bar 'chad do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'grel pas gsal bar 'chad do //
translated: This is clearly explained in the commentary.

original: lugs ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: lugs ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The system is the presentation.

original: de la grangs can pa rnams kyis bdag gi rnam gzhag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la grangs can pa rnams kyis bdag gi rnam gzhag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the presentation of the self by the Sāṃkhyas, it is said:

original: de la grangs can pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la grangs can pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The Samkhyas say, The manifest is the twenty-three principles.

original: rtsa ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Sāṃkhyas say, “The root nature . . .”🔽The root nature is the cause of all.

original: rtsa ba smos pa ni de la rgyu gzhan med pas 'di nyid thams cad kyi rgyu yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rtsa ba smos pa ni de la rgyu gzhan med pas 'di nyid thams cad kyi rgyu yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The word “root” is used because there is no other cause.

original: rnam par 'gyur min la zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'gyur ba la mi brten pas rtag pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur min la zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'gyur ba la mi brten pas rtag pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It is permanent because it does not rely on transformation.

original: chen po sogs bdun rang bzhin rnam 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: chen po sogs bdun rang bzhin rnam 'gyur zhing //
translated: The seven, such as Mahat, are both nature and transformation.

original: zhes bya ba la de la chen po'i sgra ni blo brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de la chen po'i sgra ni blo brjod pa yin la /
translated: The word “Mahat” expresses intellect.

original: des na blo dang nga rgyal dang sgra dang reg bya dang ro dang gzugs dang dri zhes bya ba ste bdun ni 'bras bu gzhan byed pa'i phyir rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: des na blo dang nga rgyal dang sgra dang reg bya dang ro dang gzugs dang dri zhes bya ba ste bdun ni 'bras bu gzhan byed pa'i phyir rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Therefore, intellect, egoity, sound, touch, taste, form, and smell—these seven are nature because they produce other effects.

original: rang bzhin gyis de rnams byed pa yin pas rnam 'gyur zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis de rnams byed pa yin pas rnam 'gyur zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since they are produced by nature, they are also called transformation.

original: bcu drug po ni rnam par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: bcu drug po ni rnam par 'gyur ba ste //
translated: The sixteen are transformation.

original: zhes bya ba ni ngag dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / rkub dang / mdoms te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngag dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / rkub dang / mdoms te /
translated: Speech, hands, feet, anus, and genitals are the five action faculties.

original: las kyi dbang po lnga dang / rna ba dang / pags pa dang / mig dang / lce dang / sna ste blo'i dbang po lnga dang / nam mkha' dang / rlung dang / me dang / chu dang / sa zhes bya ba ste 'byung ba chen po dang /
analyzed: las kyi dbang po lnga dang / rna ba dang / pags pa dang / mig dang / lce dang / sna ste blo'i dbang po lnga dang / nam mkha' dang / rlung dang / me dang / chu dang / sa zhes bya ba ste 'byung ba chen po dang /
translated: The five intellectual faculties are the ear, skin, eye, tongue, and nose. The great elements are space, air, fire, water, and earth.

original: yid de bcu drug po ni rnam par 'gyur ba kho na yin gyi rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: yid de bcu drug po ni rnam par 'gyur ba kho na yin gyi rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: The mind is the sixteenth. These are only transformations, not the nature.

original: gzhan gyi 'bras bu yin pa dang 'di gzhan gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'bras bu yin pa dang 'di gzhan gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the effects of others and because they are the causes of others.

original: skyes bu rang bzhin ma yin rnam 'gyur min //
analyzed: skyes bu rang bzhin ma yin rnam 'gyur min //
translated: The person is neither the nature nor the transformations.

original: zhes bya ba ni byed pa po ma yin pa dang rtag pa'i phyir gzhan gyis rnam 'gyur byar med pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byed pa po ma yin pa dang rtag pa'i phyir gzhan gyis rnam 'gyur byar med pas so //
translated: Because he is not an agent and because he is permanent, he is not a transformation of something else.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan @237b par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan @237b par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that, he says:

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In that regard, etc.

original: rab tu byed pas na rang bzhin no zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pas na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu byed pas na rang bzhin no zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pas na zhes bya'o //
translated: The suffix tva is used to indicate the nature of something, and it is used to indicate the cause of something.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa mthong ba'i dus su'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa mthong ba'i dus su'o //
translated: The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe skyes bu la yul la 'dod pa skyes pa mthong ba de'i tshe de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe skyes bu la yul la 'dod pa skyes pa mthong ba de'i tshe de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir / gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana means seeing.

original: sgra la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni reg bya la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //🔽rang bzhin dang skyes bu sbyor zhing zhes bya ba ni theng po dang long pa bzhin du bsdebs nas te /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni reg bya la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //🔽rang bzhin dang skyes bu sbyor zhing zhes bya ba ni theng po dang long pa bzhin du bsdebs nas te /
translated: The word darśana means seeing.🔽 The word darśana

original: ji ltar theng po rang nyid kyis 'gro mi nus la long bas kyang mi mthong ba'i phyir gcig pus bya ba byed mi nus pas gnyis bsdebs nas 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa de bzhin du skyes bus rang bzhin la bskul nas rang bzhin gyis
analyzed: ji ltar theng po rang nyid kyis 'gro mi nus la long bas kyang mi mthong ba'i phyir gcig pus bya ba byed mi nus pas gnyis bsdebs nas 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa de bzhin du skyes bus rang bzhin la bskul nas rang bzhin gyis
translated: Just as a lame man cannot go by himself and a blind man cannot see by himself, and so they cannot perform an action by themselves, but when they are joined together, they can perform an action such as going, in the same way, when a person impels intrinsic nature, intrinsic nature

original: sgra la sogs pa'i yul rnams 'byin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i yul rnams 'byin par byed pa'o //
translated: produces objects such as sound.

original: de la tshul ni 'di yin te //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la tshul ni 'di yin te // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The method is as follows.

original: de la 'byin par byed pa'i rim pa ni 'di yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'byin par byed pa'i rim pa ni 'di yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: This is the sequence of production.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: rang bzhin las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽chen po zhes bya ba ni blo yin te 'di ni bum pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / chen po zhes bya ba ni blo yin te 'di ni bum pa'o //
translated: from intrinsic nature, etc.

original: 'di ni snam bu'o zhes bya bar yul nges pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: 'di ni snam bu'o zhes bya bar yul nges pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The great one is the intellect, which has the characteristic of ascertaining objects such as “this is a pot” and “this is a cloth.”🔽From that, the I-maker arises.

original: de las nga rgyal lo zhes bya ba ni chen po las nga rgyal skye ba yin la /
analyzed: de las nga rgyal lo zhes bya ba ni chen po las nga rgyal skye ba yin la /
translated: The I-maker arises from the great one.

original: de yang bdag skal pa dang ldan par blta bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: de yang bdag skal pa dang ldan par blta bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: and it is the self that is to be regarded as fortunate, etc.

original: de las bcu drug po'i tshogs so zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal de las kyi dbang po lnga dang / blo'i dbang po lnga dang / de tsam lnga dang / yid de bcu drug po'i tshogs skye ba'o ;
analyzed: de las bcu drug po'i tshogs so zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal de las kyi dbang po lnga dang / blo'i dbang po lnga dang / de tsam lnga dang / yid de bcu drug po'i tshogs skye ba'o ;
translated: From that, the group of sixteen arises. From that pride, the group of sixteen arises: the five faculties of action, the five intellectual faculties, the five subtle elements, and the mind.

original: / de la yid ni kun tu rtog pa'i mtshan nyid can yin te /
analyzed: / de la yid ni kun tu rtog pa'i mtshan nyid can yin te /
translated: Among them, the mind has the characteristic of imagination.

original: dper na bram ze phru gus grong gzhan ston mo yod do zhes thos pa yin la der nga 'gro'o snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: dper na bram ze phru gus grong gzhan ston mo yod do zhes thos pa yin la der nga 'gro'o snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin la /
translated: For example, a child brahman hears that there is a feast in another village and thinks, “I will go there.”

original: ci de na bu ram dang zho yod dam 'on te zho yod snyam pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yid do //
analyzed: ci de na bu ram dang zho yod dam 'on te zho yod snyam pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yid do //
translated: The mind has the characteristic of imagination, wondering whether there is molasses or curd there, or whether there is curd.

original: lnga las ni 'byung ba lnga ste zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lnga las ni 'byung ba lnga ste zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: From the five, the five elements arise. This is the brief teaching.

original: de nyid rgyas par ston pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par ston pa ni /
translated: The same is taught in detail:

original: sgra la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Sound and so on.

original: sgra las nam mkha' dang / reg bya las rlung dang / gzugs las me dang / ro las chu dang / dri las sa'o zhes de tsam lnga las 'byung ba rnam pa lnga @238a * //
analyzed: sgra las nam mkha' dang / reg bya las rlung dang / gzugs las me dang / ro las chu dang / dri las sa'o zhes de tsam lnga las 'byung ba rnam pa lnga @238a * //
translated: From the five elemental evolutes such as sound, the five elements are born: space from sound, wind from touch, fire from form, water from taste, and earth from smell.

original: skye ba'o ; / rang bzhin gyi don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba'o ; / rang bzhin gyi don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the intrinsic nature, he says,

original: rnam par 'gyur min la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur min la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Not an evolute.🔽It is a creator, not an evolute.

original: rab tu byed pa kho na yin gyi zhes bya ba ni chen po la sogs pa'i 'bras bu byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa kho na yin gyi zhes bya ba ni chen po la sogs pa'i 'bras bu byed pa kho na'o //
translated: It is a creator, not an evolute, of the great one and so on.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rtag pa yin pas rnam 'gyur la brten pa ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rtag pa yin pas rnam 'gyur la brten pa ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not an evolute, because it is permanent and does not depend on an evolute.

original: rang gi rnam par 'gyur ba la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal la sogs pa'i rnam 'gyur la ltos nas so //
analyzed: rang gi rnam par 'gyur ba la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal la sogs pa'i rnam 'gyur la ltos nas so //
translated: In relation to its own evolutes.

original: rang bzhin la ltos nas rnam par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni des rnam par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni des rnam par bsgyur bar bya ba yin pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin la ltos nas rnam par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni des rnam par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni des rnam par bsgyur bar bya ba yin pas so //
translated: In relation to the nature, it is modification. It is modified by that, because it is to be transformed by that.

original: blo'i dbang po la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni las kyi dbang po lnga dang 'byung ba chen po lnga dang yid bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: blo'i dbang po la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni las kyi dbang po lnga dang 'byung ba chen po lnga dang yid bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The sense faculties of cognition, etc. The word “etc.” includes the five faculties of action, the five great elements, and mind.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba kho na ste //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba kho na ste //
translated: It is only modification.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyu ma yin pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyu ma yin pas so //
translated: Because it is not the cause of another.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na'i sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na'i sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: For that very reason, the word “na” is stated.

original: skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi rgyu ma yin pa dang / rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi rgyu ma yin pa dang / rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the cause of another and is permanent.

original: rim pa 'dis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rim pa 'dis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By this sequence.

original: rang bzhin las ni chen po'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin las ni chen po'o //
translated: From the nature, the great one.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: And so on.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshogs zhes bya ba ni chen po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshogs zhes bya ba ni chen po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The collection of modifications is the great one, etc.

original: skyes bu ci ltar longs spyod pa po yin snyam nas dri ba ni /
analyzed: skyes bu ci ltar longs spyod pa po yin snyam nas dri ba ni /
translated: How is a person an experiencer?

original: 'dod pa skyes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa skyes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: To answer this, he says, “When a desire arises…”

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir na /
translated: To explain the answer, he says,

original: rna ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “The ear and so on…”

original: yid kyis byin gyis brlabs pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni sgra la sogs pa rtogs par gyur cig ces yid kyis byin gyis rlob pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyis byin gyis brlabs pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni sgra la sogs pa rtogs par gyur cig ces yid kyis byin gyis rlob pa'o //
translated: “Influenced by the mind” means that the mind influences sound and so on, thinking, “May it be understood!”

original: yongs su gzung ba'i zhes bya ba ni rna ba la sogs pa 'jug pa tsam gyi sgo nas dmigs pa'o //🔽blos zhen par byed la zhes bya ba ni sgra la sogs pa 'di'o zhes mngon par zhen par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba'i zhes bya ba ni rna ba la sogs pa 'jug pa tsam gyi sgo nas dmigs pa'o // blos zhen par byed la zhes bya ba ni sgra la sogs pa 'di'o zhes mngon par zhen par byed pa'o //
translated: “Apprehended” means that the ear and so on are the observed objects by way of mere engagement.🔽“The mind conceives of it” means that the mind conceives of sound and so on, thinking, “This is sound and so on.”

original: skyes bu sems par byed de zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen par byed pa'i sgra la sogs pa'i rang bzhin shes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu sems par byed de zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen par byed pa'i sgra la sogs pa'i rang bzhin shes par byed pa'o //
translated: “The person thinks” means that the person knows the nature of sound and so on that is conceived of.

original: 'di'i don ni yid kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rna ba la sogs pas 'jug pas gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa de'i tshe mngon par zhen pa'i rang bzhin can me long ngos gnyis pa dang 'dra ba'i blo 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni yid kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rna ba la sogs pas 'jug pas gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa de'i tshe mngon par zhen pa'i rang bzhin can me long ngos gnyis pa dang 'dra ba'i blo 'jug pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of this is that when the ear and so on are engaged by the mind, the mind is engaged with the nature of attachment to form and so on, like a mirror with two sides.

original: gang la yul gyi grib ma 'char ba dang / skyes bu'i grib ma 'char ba'o //
analyzed: gang la yul gyi grib ma 'char ba dang / skyes bu'i grib ma 'char ba'o //
translated: The shadow of the object arises on one side, and the shadow of the person arises on the other.

original: des na @238b gzugs brnyan gnyis phrad pa ni gnas skabs na yul nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid can longs spyod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des na @238b gzugs brnyan gnyis phrad pa ni gnas skabs na yul nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid can longs spyod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus, the two reflections meet, and the experience of the object is the characteristic of enjoyment.

original: des na skyes bu ni sems pa yod pa'i rang bzhin yin pas yul nye bar longs spyod pa'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na skyes bu ni sems pa yod pa'i rang bzhin yin pas yul nye bar longs spyod pa'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the person is said to be the nature of consciousness and to enjoy the object.

original: de ltar 'khor bar skye ba'i rim pa bstan nas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rim pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar 'khor bar skye ba'i rim pa bstan nas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rim pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the process of birth in cyclic existence, in order to teach the process of freedom from attachment, he says:

original: de ltar 'dod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, one who is attached to desire...

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rna ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rna ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas brjod pa'i rim pas so //
translated: Thus means in the order expressed by the words of the ear and so on.

original: bsam gtan bsgoms shing lha'i shes pa yang dag par blangs pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis yang dag par blangs pa ste bskyed pa lha'i mig gi shes pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bsgoms shing lha'i shes pa yang dag par blangs pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis yang dag par blangs pa ste bskyed pa lha'i mig gi shes pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Cultivating meditative concentration and taking up divine knowledge refers to the knowledge of divine eye that is taken up by the power of meditative concentration, that is, generated.

original: des bltas pa dang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin la bltas pa na'o //
analyzed: des bltas pa dang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin la bltas pa na'o //
translated: When he looks with that, means when he looks with the natural eye.

original: rang nyid phyir nur byed cing zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin de rang gi bdag nyid phyir nur ba'o //
analyzed: rang nyid phyir nur byed cing zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin de rang gi bdag nyid phyir nur ba'o //
translated: He himself recoils means that nature recoils from itself.

original: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin la'o //
analyzed: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin la'o //
translated: Right there means right there in the natural eye.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshogs zhes bya ba ni chen po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshogs zhes bya ba ni chen po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The collection of modifications means the great elements and so on.

original: skye ba'i rim pa las bzlog pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba lnga po rnams de tsam lnga la tham par 'gyur ba dang / tshogs bcu drug po rnams ni nga rgyal la thim par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: skye ba'i rim pa las bzlog pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba lnga po rnams de tsam lnga la tham par 'gyur ba dang / tshogs bcu drug po rnams ni nga rgyal la thim par 'gyur zhing /
translated: “In the reverse order of the process of birth” means that the five elements dissolve into the five subtle objects, and the sixteen collections dissolve into pride.

original: nga rgyal ni blo dang / blo ni rang bzhin la thim par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rim pa 'dis so //
analyzed: nga rgyal ni blo dang / blo ni rang bzhin la thim par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rim pa 'dis so //
translated: Pride dissolves into mind, and mind dissolves into the nature.

original: mi gsal ba'i ngo bor 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshogs rnams mi snang bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i ngo bor 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshogs rnams mi snang bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “In an unclear form” means that the collection of transformations disappears.

original: de'i tshe skyes bu nyag gcig gnas te zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang bral bas sngon po la sogs par snang ba dang bral ba'i skyes bu gcig pu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe skyes bu nyag gcig gnas te zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang bral bas sngon po la sogs par snang ba dang bral ba'i skyes bu gcig pu gnas pa'o //
translated: “At that time, the solitary person remains” means that the person remains alone, free from the nature and free from the appearance of blue and so on.

original: des na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba rnams med pas rnam par grol ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba rnams med pas rnam par grol ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there are no afflictions such as attachment, it is said to be liberation.

original: de yang rtag pa yin no zhes ston pa ni de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang rtag pa yin no zhes ston pa ni de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To show that it is also permanent, he says, “It is not destroyed by the destruction of the body.”

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'o //
translated: “ It” refers to the person.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba zhar zin kyang //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba zhar zin kyang //
translated: “ Even though it undergoes transformation”

original: zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin la thim nas kyang ngo //🔽zha bar yang mi 'gyur ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin la thim nas kyang ngo // zha bar yang mi 'gyur ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: means even though it dissolves into the natural.🔽“ It does not become destroyed” means it does not become an unclear entity.

original: yan gar ba'i ngo bor zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang bral ba'i ngo bor ro //
analyzed: yan gar ba'i ngo bor zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang bral ba'i ngo bor ro //
translated: “ It does not become a separate entity” means it does not become an entity devoid of the natural.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin ni blo bur ba yin pas so //🔽de ltar @239a * //🔽rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid du bstan nas byed pa po ma yin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin ni blo bur ba yin pas so // de ltar @239a * // rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid du bstan nas byed pa po ma yin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: “ It is permanent” means the natural is adventitious.

original: rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having thus taught its permanent nature, in order to teach its distinction of being a non-agent, etc., he says, “The natural is not an agent,” etc.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba rnams las kyang kha cig ces bya ba ni blo dang nga rgyal dang / de tsam gyi mtshan nyid can no //🔽snyom las can nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba rnams las kyang kha cig ces bya ba ni blo dang nga rgyal dang / de tsam gyi mtshan nyid can no // snyom las can nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: And from among the transformations, some are of the nature of intellect and egoism, and are characterized by that much.

original: 'bras bus byed pa'i bya ba med pas so //
analyzed: 'bras bus byed pa'i bya ba med pas so //
translated: Laziness is the absence of activity due to the result.

original: rdul dang / mun pa dang / snying stobs kyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir na zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi rang bzhin med pas so //
analyzed: rdul dang / mun pa dang / snying stobs kyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir na zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi rang bzhin med pas so //
translated: The absence of activity is due to the absence of the nature of rajas, tamas, and sattva, i.e., the absence of the nature of pleasure, pain, and delusion.

original: khyad par byed pa nyid yod pa'i phyir na bya ba med pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni ma khyab pa'i yul du 'gro ba'i phyir bya ba dang bcas par rigs kyi /
analyzed: khyad par byed pa nyid yod pa'i phyir na bya ba med pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni ma khyab pa'i yul du 'gro ba'i phyir bya ba dang bcas par rigs kyi /
translated: Since the quality of activity exists, the absence of activity is not tenable, because it is proper that there be activity when there is movement to a place that is not yet occupied.

original: khyab pa la ni ma khyab pa'i yul med pas bya ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab pa la ni ma khyab pa'i yul med pas bya ba med pa yin no //
translated: But when there is universal pervasion, there is no place that is not yet occupied, so there is no activity.

original: rdul dang / mun pa dang / snying stobs rnams ni yon tan gsum mo zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang / gti mug dang / bde ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi yon tan gsum mo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rdul dang / mun pa dang / snying stobs rnams ni yon tan gsum mo zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang / gti mug dang / bde ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi yon tan gsum mo zhes pa'o //
translated: The three qualities are characterized by pain, delusion, and pleasure.

original: de la rdul ni g-yo ba dang / 'jug pa'i bdag nyid can zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la rdul ni g-yo ba dang / 'jug pa'i bdag nyid can zhes pa'o //
translated: Passion is the nature of movement and activity.

original: rdul gyi stobs kyis blo la sogs pa rnams bstan par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir na g-yo ba dang / de nyid kyi phyir 'jug pa'i bdag nyid can yin te gnas gcig tu dga' ba med pas so ;
analyzed: rdul gyi stobs kyis blo la sogs pa rnams bstan par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir na g-yo ba dang / de nyid kyi phyir 'jug pa'i bdag nyid can yin te gnas gcig tu dga' ba med pas so ;
translated: Because of the power of passion, the intellect and so on are not revealed. Therefore, it is movement and activity, because it is not satisfied with one place.

original: /'bras bu rnams rgyu la yod pas rdul la g-yo ba dang 'jug pa'i bdag nyid can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: /'bras bu rnams rgyu la yod pas rdul la g-yo ba dang 'jug pa'i bdag nyid can zhes bya'o //
translated: The effect is in the cause, so passion is said to have the nature of movement and activity.🔽Darkness is the nature of heaviness and immobility.

original: mun pa ni lci ba dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can no zhes bya ba ni mun pa'i stobs kyis lus la sogs pa rnams lci ba nyid du 'gyur ba dang / dngos po'i rang bzhin yongs su mi shes pas so //
analyzed: mun pa ni lci ba dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can no zhes bya ba ni mun pa'i stobs kyis lus la sogs pa rnams lci ba nyid du 'gyur ba dang / dngos po'i rang bzhin yongs su mi shes pas so //
translated: Because of the power of darkness, the body and so on become heavy and the nature of things is not fully understood.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa ni sngar bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa ni sngar bzhin du'o //
translated: The effect is present in the cause, as before.🔽Sattva is the essence of lightness and clarity.

original: snying stobs ni yang ba dang rab tu gsal ba'i bdag nyid can no zhes bya ba ni snying stobs kyi 'bras bu ni lus la sogs pa rnams yang ba nyid dang rab tu dang ba'o //
analyzed: snying stobs ni yang ba dang rab tu gsal ba'i bdag nyid can no zhes bya ba ni snying stobs kyi 'bras bu ni lus la sogs pa rnams yang ba nyid dang rab tu dang ba'o //
translated: The effect of sattva is lightness and clarity of the body, etc.

original: 'dir yang rgyu la 'bras bu yod par ni sngar bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang rgyu la 'bras bu yod par ni sngar bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, too, the effect is present in the cause, as before.🔽These are synonyms for those.

original: 'di dag kho na'i rnam grangs so zhes bya ba ni rdul dang / mun pa dang / snying stobs rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'di dag kho na'i rnam grangs so zhes bya ba ni rdul dang / mun pa dang / snying stobs rnams kyi'o //
translated: These are the synonyms for rajas, tamas, and sattva.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: These means suffering, etc.

original: cha mnyam pa'i gnas skabs ni zhes bya ba ni rdul la sogs pa'i nang nas gang la yang shas che bar gyur pa med pa'o //
analyzed: cha mnyam pa'i gnas skabs ni zhes bya ba ni rdul la sogs pa'i nang nas gang la yang shas che bar gyur pa med pa'o //
translated: The state of equilibrium is when none of the three, rajas, etc., predominate.

original: gnas skabs de la gtso bo zhes @239b brjod par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi sgras ni brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs de la gtso bo zhes @239b brjod par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi sgras ni brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: In that state, the pradhāna should not be expressed by the word pradhāna, which is by nature the principal one.

original: de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason for that, he says:

original: 'dir yon tan dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir yon tan dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, it is said, “The qualities, etc.”

original: gtso bor 'gyur ba ste rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ba ste shas che bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bor 'gyur ba ste rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ba ste shas che bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: They do not become predominant, i.e., they do not become pacified, i.e., they do not become strong.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni /
translated: “Those” refers to

original: sdug bsngal dang ; gti mug dang / bde ba rnams so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ; gti mug dang / bde ba rnams so //
translated: pain, delusion, and pleasure.🔽The state of their transformation is their nature.

original: de dag rnam par 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs ni rang bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung ba shas che ba'i gnas skabs ni rang bzhin yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag rnam par 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs ni rang bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung ba shas che ba'i gnas skabs ni rang bzhin yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The state in which any one of them is predominant is their nature.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba can dang zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi cha dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba can dang zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi cha dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “The one that is transformed” is the one that possesses the aspect of pain.

original: snying stobs can dang zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i cha dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: snying stobs can dang zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i cha dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “The one that is full of courage” is the one that possesses the aspect of pleasure.

original: gnyis ka'i bdag nyid can gyi yid de zhes bya ba ni las kyi dbang po dang / blo'i dbang po dag gis byin gyis rlob pa po yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bdag nyid can gyi yid de zhes bya ba ni las kyi dbang po dang / blo'i dbang po dag gis byin gyis rlob pa po yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The mind that is of the nature of both is the one that is the consecrator by means of the faculties of action and the faculties of cognition.

original: nga rgyal gnyis ka'i 'jug par byed pa po zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'gyur bas dang snying stobs can gyi nga rgyal dag gi'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal gnyis ka'i 'jug par byed pa po zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'gyur bas dang snying stobs can gyi nga rgyal dag gi'o //
translated: The agent of both kinds of pride is called the “instigator” because it is the instigator of the pride of rajas and sattva.

original: rang bzhin dang rnam par 'gyur ba nyid yin zhing zhes bya ba ni blo la sogs pa gzhan dag gi byed pa po yin pa dang rang bzhin la sogs pa gzhan gyis bskyed par bya ba yin pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang rnam par 'gyur ba nyid yin zhing zhes bya ba ni blo la sogs pa gzhan dag gi byed pa po yin pa dang rang bzhin la sogs pa gzhan gyis bskyed par bya ba yin pas so //
translated: It is both the nature and modification of prakriti because it is the agent of other things such as the intellect and is itself produced by other things such as nature.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba nyid kho na yin la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis skyed par byed pa ma yin pas so ;
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba nyid kho na yin la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis skyed par byed pa ma yin pas so ;
translated: It is only a modification because it is not a producer of other things.

original: / de'i dbye ba cung zad cung zad la brten nas zhes bya ba ni bdag gi khyad par la brten nas so //
analyzed: / de'i dbye ba cung zad cung zad la brten nas zhes bya ba ni bdag gi khyad par la brten nas so //
translated: It is based on the slight differences in the self.

original: de la bye brag pas 'dod pa'i bdag gi rnam gzhag bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la bye brag pas 'dod pa'i bdag gi rnam gzhag bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the presentation of the self that is asserted by the Vaiśeṣikas, he says, for example, etc.

original: sdug bsngal ni de las bzlog pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ni mi 'dod pa'i yul nyams su myong ba'o //🔽de'i mthar thug pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba la nan tan byed pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni de las bzlog pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ni mi 'dod pa'i yul nyams su myong ba'o // de'i mthar thug pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba la nan tan byed pa'o //
translated: Suffering is the opposite of that.🔽The opposite of that is non-Dharma.

original: de las bzlog pa ni chos ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang las ngan song dang 'khor ba 'grub pa de ni chos ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni chos ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang las ngan song dang 'khor ba 'grub pa de ni chos ma yin pa'o //
translated: That which is the cause of the production of bad rebirths and cyclic existence is non-Dharma.🔽That which is born from consciousness and is the cause of consciousness is the impetus of the formative forces, which is the cause of consciousness.

original: shes pa las skyes shing shes pa'i rgyur gyur ba zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen 'chad pa po'i sgra la sogs pa dang / nye bar len pa'i rgyu yid kyi rnam par shes pa las skyes pa sngar dang 'dra ba'i shes pa rgyu gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas pa'i shugs te /
analyzed: shes pa las skyes shing shes pa'i rgyur gyur ba zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen 'chad pa po'i sgra la sogs pa dang / nye bar len pa'i rgyu yid kyi rnam par shes pa las skyes pa sngar dang 'dra ba'i shes pa rgyu gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas pa'i shugs te /
translated: The impetus of the formative forces is that which is born from the appropriating cause, i.e. the mental consciousness, and is similar to the consciousness that is the cause, i.e. the consciousness that is the co-operating condition, such as the sound of the speaker, etc.

original: dper na mda'i 'phong gi 'du byed yul gzhan 'thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba de bzhin du shes pa khyad par can @240a * //
analyzed: dper na mda'i 'phong gi 'du byed yul gzhan 'thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba de bzhin du shes pa khyad par can @240a * //
translated: For example, the impetus of the bow is the cause for the attainment of another place by the arrow.

original: skye ba'i rgyu 'du byed kyi shugs yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu 'du byed kyi shugs yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The cause of birth is the force of compositional activity.

original: ci ltar 'khor ba dang thar pa thob par gyur ba dag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ltar 'khor ba dang thar pa thob par gyur ba dag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how one cycles in samsara and attains liberation,

original: bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “I am,” and so on.

original: bdag la 'du shing yod pa zhes bya ba ni bdag la 'du ba'i 'brel ba'i sgo nas 'du ba'o //
analyzed: bdag la 'du shing yod pa zhes bya ba ni bdag la 'du ba'i 'brel ba'i sgo nas 'du ba'o //
translated: “I am” is a connection by way of the connection of aggregation to “I.”

original: de dag gis sbyar ba'i zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang sdang ba la sogs pas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis sbyar ba'i zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang sdang ba la sogs pas 'jug pa'o //
translated: “They are applied” means that desire, hatred, and so on are engaged.

original: yang dag par rtogs pa'i shes pas zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa thob pas so //
analyzed: yang dag par rtogs pa'i shes pas zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa thob pas so //
translated: “By the knowledge of perfect realization” means by attaining non-conceptual knowledge.

original: rtsa ba dang bcas par gcod par zhes bya ba ni 'di ji ltar yang skye bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar gcod pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba dang bcas par gcod par zhes bya ba ni 'di ji ltar yang skye bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar gcod pa'o //
translated: “Cutting them off together with their roots” means cutting them off in such a way that they will not arise again.

original: rang gi bdag nyid la gnas shing thar par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas 'ching ba med pas so //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la gnas shing thar par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas 'ching ba med pas so //
translated: “Abiding in one’s own nature, one is liberated” means that one is liberated because one is not bound by the afflictions such as desire.

original: de ltar khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that distinction, he says:🔽And that self is permanent,

original: bdag de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: etc.

original: rtag pa dang zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa med pas so //
analyzed: rtag pa dang zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa med pas so //
translated: Permanent means not subject to origination and destruction.

original: byed pa po dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i las kyi byed pa po yin pas so //
analyzed: byed pa po dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i las kyi byed pa po yin pas so //
translated: Agent means it is the agent of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: zab po dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: zab po dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: Profound means the result of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: yon tan dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang sdang ba la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: yon tan dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang sdang ba la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams dang ldan pas so //
translated: Endowed with qualities means it is endowed with the qualities of desire, hatred, etc.

original: khyab pa ni sngar bzhin shes par bya'o //
analyzed: khyab pa ni sngar bzhin shes par bya'o //
translated: Pervasive should be understood as before.

original: bskum pa dang brkyang ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gang lus 'dor bar byed pa de las bskum pa dang / gang lus len pa de la brkyang ba'o //
analyzed: bskum pa dang brkyang ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gang lus 'dor bar byed pa de las bskum pa dang / gang lus len pa de la brkyang ba'o //
translated: By contraction and expansion means that which abandons the body is contraction, and that which takes up the body is expansion.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i nam mkha' lta bur lus tha dad pas gcig sna tshogs pa nyid ces bya ba ni ci ltar nam mkha' gcig nyid yin du zin kyang bum pa la sogs pa tha dad pas nam mkha' tha dad pa yin no zhes bstan pa de
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i nam mkha' lta bur lus tha dad pas gcig sna tshogs pa nyid ces bya ba ni ci ltar nam mkha' gcig nyid yin du zin kyang bum pa la sogs pa tha dad pas nam mkha' tha dad pa yin no zhes bstan pa de
translated: “Like space in a pot, etc.,” means that just as space is different in a pot, etc., because of the difference in the pots, etc.,

original: bzhin du 'dir yang bdag gcig yin du zin kyang lus tha dad pas de yang tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhin du 'dir yang bdag gcig yin du zin kyang lus tha dad pas de yang tha dad pa yin no //
translated: so here also, although the self is one, it is different because of the difference in the bodies.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ma khyab pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ma khyab pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes non-pervasiveness, etc.

original: de ltar phyogs snga ma bkod nas lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar phyogs snga ma bkod nas lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus set forth the opponent’s position, in order to teach the reply, he says,

original: mu stegs can rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “The tīrthikas, etc.”

original: gzhung lugs re re las zhes bya ba ni grub mtha' so so las so //
analyzed: gzhung lugs re re las zhes bya ba ni grub mtha' so so las so //
translated: “In each system” means in each philosophical school.

original: de ltar gyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i'o //
translated: “Such” refers to the qualities taught above.

original: yod min zhing zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dang po'o //
analyzed: yod min zhing zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dang po'o //
translated: “Do not exist” is the first probandum.

original: 'di ni ngar 'dzin @240b rten du'ang mi rigs la //
analyzed: 'di ni ngar 'dzin @240b rten du'ang mi rigs la //
translated: It is not reasonable as the basis of the conception of “I.”

original: zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second probandum.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
translated: “This” refers to the self.

original: ngar 'dzin gyi rten du zhes bya ba ni ngar 'dzin gyi yul lo //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin gyi rten du zhes bya ba ni ngar 'dzin gyi yul lo //
translated: “Basis of the conception of ‘I’” refers to the object of the conception of “I.”

original: skye ba dang bral phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: skye ba dang bral phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: “Because it is devoid of arising” is the reason.

original: mo gsham bu ltar zhes bya ba ni dpe ste ji ltar mo gsham gyi bu skye ba dang bral ba'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa dang / ngar 'dzin gyi rten du ma gyur pa de bzhin du bdag kyang yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mo gsham bu ltar zhes bya ba ni dpe ste ji ltar mo gsham gyi bu skye ba dang bral ba'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa dang / ngar 'dzin gyi rten du ma gyur pa de bzhin du bdag kyang yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “Like the son of a barren woman” is the example. Just as the son of a barren woman does not exist because he is devoid of arising and does not serve as the basis of the conception of “I,” so it is with the self.

original: gal te don dam par de yod pa ma yin zhing ngar 'dzin gyi yul du gyur pa ma yin kyang 'on kyang kun rdzob tu de gnyis yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par de yod pa ma yin zhing ngar 'dzin gyi yul du gyur pa ma yin kyang 'on kyang kun rdzob tu de gnyis yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say, “Although it does not exist ultimately and does not serve as the object of the conception of ‘I,’ still, conventionally, both of these are the case,”

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: the response to that is

original: 'di ni kun rdzob tu yang yod mi 'dod //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni kun rdzob tu yang yod mi 'dod //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: We do not assert that it exists even conventionally.

original: skye ba dang bral phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi bdag 'di ni kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin pa dang / ngar 'dzin gyi rten du ma gyur par bstan pas kun rdzob tu yang 'di gnyis char yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang bral phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi bdag 'di ni kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin pa dang / ngar 'dzin gyi rten du ma gyur par bstan pas kun rdzob tu yang 'di gnyis char yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “Because of being devoid of arising” is the reason. This self does not exist even conventionally, and it is shown that it does not serve as the basis of the conception of “I.” Thus, these two do not exist even conventionally.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that,

original: rang nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rang nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “because of contradicting our own inferences,” and so on.

original: rang nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ci ltar khyod kyis mo gsham gyi bu la skye ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ci ltar khyod kyis mo gsham gyi bu la skye ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because of contradicting our own inferences” means that just as you do not assert that the son of a barren woman exists and is the object of the conception of “I” because he is devoid of arising,

original: yod pa nyid dang ngar 'dzin gyi yul du mi 'dod pa de bzhin du bdag la yang ma skyes pa'i phyir gnyis po 'di dag med par thal bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang ngar 'dzin gyi yul du mi 'dod pa de bzhin du bdag la yang ma skyes pa'i phyir gnyis po 'di dag med par thal bar 'gyur bas /
translated: in the same way, since the self also is not arisen, these two would not exist.

original: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal bas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal bas so //
translated: Because of contradicting our own inferences about reality.

original: ji skad smras pa'i zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i chos kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa'i zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i chos kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “As stated” refers to the previously mentioned specific qualities of phenomena.

original: da ni bdag la mu stegs pa rnams kyis chos gang kun du brtags pa de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bdag la mu stegs pa rnams kyis chos gang kun du brtags pa de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the phenomena imputed by the tīrthikas are also unreasonable, he says:

original: 'di yang yod pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di yang yod pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “This is also existence,” and so on.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
translated: “This” refers to the self.

original: bstan bcos las zhes bya ba ni grangs can dang bye brag pa'i bstan bcos las so //
analyzed: bstan bcos las zhes bya ba ni grangs can dang bye brag pa'i bstan bcos las so //
translated: “In the treatises” refers to the treatises of the Sāṃkhya and Vaiśeṣika.

original: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //🔽rang grags ma skyes gtan tshigs kyis //
analyzed: de'i khyad par zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o // rang grags ma skyes gtan tshigs kyis //
translated: “Its specific qualities” refers to permanence and so on.🔽“By the reason of nonarising, which is renowned to them,”

original: zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang bral ba'i gtan tshigs te mu stegs pa nyid la grags pa yin te des de ltar khas blangs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang bral ba'i gtan tshigs te mu stegs pa nyid la grags pa yin te des de ltar khas blangs pas so //
translated: refers to the reason of being devoid of arising, which is renowned to the tīrthikas themselves, because they accept it.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says:

original: de la grangs can pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la grangs can pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Regarding that, the Sāṃkhya,” and so on.

original: rang nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni phung po rang nyid la grags pas so //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni phung po rang nyid la grags pas so //
translated: “By itself” means that the self is renowned as the aggregates.

original: bdag tu smra ba thams cad ces bya ba ni @241a * //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba thams cad ces bya ba ni @241a * //
translated: “All proponents of a self” means

original: rig byed du smra ba la sogs pas kun du brtags pa rnams so //
analyzed: rig byed du smra ba la sogs pas kun du brtags pa rnams so //
translated: those who propound the Vedas and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phung po las tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phung po las tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that a self that is different from the aggregates does not exist,

original: de'i phyir de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Therefore, in that case . . .”

original: gang gi phyir skye ba dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi bdag med pa de'i phyir phung po las tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi bdag med pa de'i phyir phung po las tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The reason is “because it is devoid of arising.” Since there is no self, a self that is different from the aggregates does not exist.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni phung po rnams las so //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni phung po rnams las so //
translated: “Those” refers to the aggregates.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very point,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “If . . . ” and so on.

original: phung po ma gtogs de 'dzin ma grub phyir //
analyzed: phung po ma gtogs de 'dzin ma grub phyir //
translated: Because a self that is different from the aggregates is not established,🔽a self that is not different from the aggregates is not established.

original: zhes bya ba ni phung po ma gtogs pa'i bdag gi yul can gyi ngar 'dzin pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phung po ma gtogs pa'i bdag gi yul can gyi ngar 'dzin pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the self that is the object of the apprehension of “I” that is not included in the aggregates is not established.

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
translated: “As it is said” means in Fundamental Wisdom.

original: gal te nye bar len pa las gzhan du ste tha dad pa'i bdag nyid yod par gyur na de nye bar len pa las tha dad du 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te nye bar len pa las gzhan du ste tha dad pa'i bdag nyid yod par gyur na de nye bar len pa las tha dad du 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: If the self were to exist as different from the appropriated aggregates, it would be apprehended as different from the appropriated aggregates.

original: bum pa las snam bu bzhin du'o //
analyzed: bum pa las snam bu bzhin du'o //
translated: It would be like a cloth being different from a pot.

original: 'dzin pa nyid kyang ma yin pa de'i phyir nye bar len pa las tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa nyid kyang ma yin pa de'i phyir nye bar len pa las tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: But it is not apprehended as such. Therefore the self does not exist as different from the appropriated aggregates.

original: de yang nye bar len pa med pa'i nye bar len pa po nye bar len pa las gzhan du nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang nye bar len pa med pa'i nye bar len pa po nye bar len pa las gzhan du nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, without the appropriated aggregates, the appropriator would be like a sky flower.

original: gal te phung po la sogs pa ni gal te phung po rnams las bdag gzhan du 'gyur na ni phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te phung po la sogs pa ni gal te phung po rnams las bdag gzhan du 'gyur na ni phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the self were different from the aggregates, it would not have the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: de la phung po ni 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir skye ba dang gnas pa 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pas phung po ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can bdag yod par gyur na skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro
analyzed: de la phung po ni 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir skye ba dang gnas pa 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pas phung po ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can bdag yod par gyur na skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro
translated: Since the aggregates have the characteristics of arising, enduring, and disintegrating because they are conditioned, if the self existed, it would not have the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: // gang de lta bu de med pa'i phyir ram 'dus byas ma yin pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du 'am mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin du bdag ces bya ba'i ming mi thob pa dang / ngar 'dzin gyi yul nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir phung po las tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag ni mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: // gang de lta bu de med pa'i phyir ram 'dus byas ma yin pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du 'am mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin du bdag ces bya ba'i ming mi thob pa dang / ngar 'dzin gyi yul nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir phung po las tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag ni mi rigs pa'o //
translated: Since it does not exist in that way, or because it is not conditioned, like a sky flower or nirvana, it would not obtain the name self, and it would be illogical for it to be the object of the conception of “I.” Therefore it is illogical for the self to be different from the aggregates.

original: yang na don 'di yin te gal te bdag phung po las tha dad du gyur pa yin na de phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na don 'di yin te gal te bdag phung po las tha dad du gyur pa yin na de phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur te /
translated: Or this is the meaning: If the self were different from the aggregates, it would not have the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: gzugs su rung ba dang nyams su myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / yul so sor rig pa'i mtshan @241b nyid can gyi phung po lnga yin la /
analyzed: gzugs su rung ba dang nyams su myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / yul so sor rig pa'i mtshan @241b nyid can gyi phung po lnga yin la /
translated: The five aggregates have the characteristics of being suitable as form, being experienced, apprehending signs, being compositional activity, and cognizing objects individually.

original: bdag ni gzugs nas rnam par shes pa'i bar las tha dad du 'dod par 'gyur na mtshan nyid tha dad du grub par 'gyur ba dang / mtshan nyid tha dad du grub par 'dzin pa nyid du 'gyur te gzugs las sems bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag ni gzugs nas rnam par shes pa'i bar las tha dad du 'dod par 'gyur na mtshan nyid tha dad du grub par 'gyur ba dang / mtshan nyid tha dad du grub par 'dzin pa nyid du 'gyur te gzugs las sems bzhin no //
translated: If the self were asserted to be different from form up to consciousness, it would be established as having a different characteristic, and it would be the apprehension of being established as having a different characteristic, like the mind from form.

original: de ltar 'dzin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not apprehended in that way.

original: des na phung po las gzhan du gyur pa'i bdag ni yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na phung po las gzhan du gyur pa'i bdag ni yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the self that is different from the aggregates does not exist.

original: de ltar phung po las gzhan pa'i bdag yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan nas 'jig rten pa'i ngar 'dzin gyi yul du yang 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar phung po las gzhan pa'i bdag yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan nas 'jig rten pa'i ngar 'dzin gyi yul du yang 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

original: phung po las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phung po las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: blo'i rten du yang zhes bya ba ni blo'i yul du yang ngo //

analyzed: de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ston pa ni /

analyzed: gang bdag rtag pa la sogs pa'i khyad par can du mi shes pa de rnams la yang bdag tu lta ba yod pa'i phyir ro // gal te tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag gi yul can ngar 'dzin gyi blo yin par gyur na de'i tshe bdag gi rang bzhin mi shes pa rnams la ngar 'dzin gyi blo mi skye bar 'gyur ba las skye ba yang yin no //
translated: Because of the view of self even in the absence of knowledge of it.🔽Because of the view of self even in the absence of knowledge of it.🔽Because of the view of self even in the absence of knowledge of it.🔽Because of the view of self even in the absence of knowledge of it.

original: des na ngar 'dzin gyi blo'i yul ni bdag ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na ngar 'dzin gyi blo'i yul ni bdag ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Because of the view of self even in the absence of knowledge of it.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽gang dag bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽gang dag bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Because of the view of self

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “In that way” means having the attributes of permanence, non-arising, and so on.

original: mngon par zhen pa'i khyad las zhes bya ba ni skye ba thog ma med pa nas goms pa'i bdag dang bdag gi snyam pa'i mngon par zhen pa las so //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa'i khyad las zhes bya ba ni skye ba thog ma med pa nas goms pa'i bdag dang bdag gi snyam pa'i mngon par zhen pa las so //
translated: “Due to the difference in adherence” means due to the adherence to “I” and “mine,” which is habituated from beginningless lifetimes.

original: de la gzhan gyi phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
translated: Here, the opponent’s former position is set forth:🔽If you say, “Those who are not liberated in this life,🔽due to the power of habituation from before,🔽adhere to a self that is the object of that,

original: ci ste gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ste gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: then how could that self exist?”

original: da ltar zhes bya ba ni skye ba 'di la'o //
analyzed: da ltar zhes bya ba ni skye ba 'di la'o //
translated: “In this life” means in this lifetime.

original: sngar goms pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni skye ba snga ma la rtag pa dang ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i bdag tu 'dzin pa la goms pas so //
analyzed: sngar goms pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni skye ba snga ma la rtag pa dang ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i bdag tu 'dzin pa la goms pas so //
translated: “Due to the power of habituation from before” means due to the habituation to apprehending a self that has the attributes of permanence, non-arising, and so on in previous lifetimes.

original: de'i yul can zhes bya ba ni bdag gi yul can no //
analyzed: de'i yul can zhes bya ba ni bdag gi yul can no //
translated: “Having that as its object” means having a self as its object.

original: 'di'i don ni gal te tshe 'di la rtag pa dang ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i bdag yongs su ma shes kyang skye ba gzhan du bdag khyad par can de des gzung ba'i phyir de'i 'du byed kyi stobs kyis skye ba 'di la
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gal te tshe 'di la rtag pa dang ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i bdag yongs su ma shes kyang skye ba gzhan du bdag khyad par can de des gzung ba'i phyir de'i 'du byed kyi stobs kyis skye ba 'di la
