translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If in this life one does not fully understand a self that has the attributes of permanence, non-arising, and so on, then in another birth, because that self with special attributes is grasped by that, the power of its formative forces

original: bdag gi yul can gyi ngar 'dzin gyi blo 'jug @242a * //
analyzed: bdag gi yul can gyi ngar 'dzin gyi blo 'jug @242a * //
translated: causes the mind that apprehends the self to engage its object in this life.

original: pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: This is what is said.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reply to that, he says,

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: That also does not exist, and so on.

original: kha cig dag kho na la zhes bya ba ni gang skye ba snga ma la grangs can pa dang bye brag pa la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha cig dag kho na la zhes bya ba ni gang skye ba snga ma la grangs can pa dang bye brag pa la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Only some, he says, means those who in a previous birth became Sāṃkhyas, Vaiśeṣikas, and so on.

original: de dag gis bstan bcos la goms par byas pa las zhes bya ba ni ser skya dang 'ug pa pas byas pa'i bstan bcos la goms par byas pa las so //
analyzed: de dag gis bstan bcos la goms par byas pa las zhes bya ba ni ser skya dang 'ug pa pas byas pa'i bstan bcos la goms par byas pa las so //
translated: Because they are familiar with the treatises, he says, means because they are familiar with the treatises composed by Kapila and Uluka.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni skye ba 'di las so //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni skye ba 'di las so //
translated: Here, he says, means in this birth.

original: sngar goms pa med du zin kyang ngar 'dzin gyi blo 'jug pa de nyid dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar goms pa med du zin kyang ngar 'dzin gyi blo 'jug pa de nyid dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Even though one has no prior habituation, the mind that grasps an “I” is taught by way of an example.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, it is said, “For example…”

original: bskal mang zhes bya ba ni bskal pa du mar ro //
analyzed: bskal mang zhes bya ba ni bskal pa du mar ro //
translated: Many eons means many eons.

original: des kyang zhes bya ba ni dud 'gro'o //
analyzed: des kyang zhes bya ba ni dud 'gro'o //
translated: That means animals.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni bdag go //
translated: This means self.

original: de dag la yang zhes bya ba ni dud 'gro rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: de dag la yang zhes bya ba ni dud 'gro rnams la yang ngo //
translated: Also means also for animals.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni dud 'gro rnams la ngar 'dzin mthong bas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni dud 'gro rnams la ngar 'dzin mthong bas so //
translated: Therefore means because the perception of “I” is seen in animals.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Such a kind means permanent and unarisen.

original: kyang gi sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The word also is in “also” and so forth.

original: des kyang zhes bya ba ni kyang gi sgra gang yin pa des dmyal ba la sogs pa rnams su skye ba bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: des kyang zhes bya ba ni kyang gi sgra gang yin pa des dmyal ba la sogs pa rnams su skye ba bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: That also means that also includes birth in the hells and so forth.

original: 'di'i don ni gal te skye ba gzhan du bdag tu 'dzin pa la goms pa'i dbang gis da ltar bdag la dmigs pa'i ngar 'dzin pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur na de'i tshe bskal pa du mar dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skye ba'i dud 'gro rnams la ngar 'dzin🔽med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gal te skye ba gzhan du bdag tu 'dzin pa la goms pa'i dbang gis da ltar bdag la dmigs pa'i ngar 'dzin pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur na de'i tshe bskal pa du mar dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skye ba'i dud 'gro rnams la ngar 'dzin med par 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If the mind that apprehends the “I” in terms of the present “I” arises due to the force of habituation to the apprehension of a self in other lives, then the animals that are born in the animal birth-state for many eons would not have the apprehension of an “I.”

original: sngar bdag tu 'dzin pa la goms pa med pas so //
analyzed: sngar bdag tu 'dzin pa la goms pa med pas so //
translated: This is because they would not have been habituated to the apprehension of a self in previous lives.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary, he says:

original: de'i phyir phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag med do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag med do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, there is no self that is different from the aggregates.

original: de ltar phung po las tha dad du gyur ba'i bdag bkag nas phung po las tha mi dad pa'i bdag dgag par bya ba'i phyir phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar phung po las tha dad du gyur ba'i bdag bkag nas phung po las tha mi dad pa'i bdag dgag par bya ba'i phyir phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
translated: Having thus refuted the self that is different from the aggregates, in order to refute the self that is not different from the aggregates, he presents the opponent’s position, saying:

original: 'dir rang gi sde pa dag na re zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir rang gi sde pa dag na re zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here the Buddhist essentialists say.

original: rang gi sde pa zhes bya ba ni mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa rnams so //
analyzed: rang gi sde pa zhes bya ba ni mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa rnams so //
translated: “ Buddhist essentialists” refers to the Saṃmitīyas.

original: phung po las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag tu lta ba'i dmigs pa ni phung po kho na yin te /
analyzed: phung po las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag tu lta ba'i dmigs pa ni phung po kho na yin te /
translated: The passage beginning “Because the self is not apprehended apart from the aggregates” shows that the aggregates alone are the object of the view of the self.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽He says, “Because the self is not established as being different from the aggregates.”🔽The reason is stated in the line “Because the self is not apprehended apart from the aggregates.”

original: phung po las gzhan bdag grub pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: phung po las gzhan bdag grub pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The self is not established as being different from the aggregates.🔽In order to explain that, he says, “Because the self is not apprehended apart from the aggregates.”

original: phung po ma gtogs de 'dzin ma grub phyir //
analyzed: phung po ma gtogs de 'dzin ma grub phyir //
translated: The passage beginning “Because the self is not apprehended apart from the aggregates” shows that the aggregates alone are the object of the view of the self.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: Why is that?🔽He says, “Because the self is not established as being different from the aggregates.”🔽The reason is stated in the line “Because the self is not apprehended apart from the aggregates.”

original: phung @242b po las tha dad pa'i bdag ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung @242b po las tha dad pa'i bdag ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The self is not established as being different from the aggregates.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says, “Because the self is not apprehended apart from the aggregates.”🔽The passage beginning “Because the self is not apprehended apart from the aggregates” shows that the aggregates alone are the object of the view of the self.🔽Why is that?🔽He says, “Because the self is not established as being different from the aggregates.”

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The reason is stated in the line “Because the self is not apprehended apart from the aggregates.”🔽The self is not established as being different from the aggregates.🔽In order to explain that, he says, “Because the self is not apprehended apart from the aggregates.”

original: ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i rigs pas so //
translated: The passage beginning “Because the self is not apprehended apart from the aggregates” shows that the aggregates alone are the object of the view of the self.🔽Why is that?🔽He says, “Because the self is not established as being different from the aggregates.”🔽The reason is stated in the line “Because the self is not apprehended apart from the aggregates.”

original: rang gi sde pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa'o //🔽de las kyang zhes bya ba ni mang pos bkur ba'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: rang gi sde pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa'o //🔽de las kyang zhes bya ba ni mang pos bkur ba'i phyogs la'o //
translated: The self is not established as

original: kha cag ces bya ba la sogs pa nas mang pos bkur ba kha cig ni bdag tu lta ba ste 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dmigs par gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga char yang 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cag ces bya ba la sogs pa nas mang pos bkur ba kha cig ni bdag tu lta ba ste 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dmigs par gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga char yang 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Some say that the self is the view of the transitory collection, and that the five aggregates of form and so on are the objects of observation of the view of the transitory collection.

original: phung po lnga la dmigs nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba skye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phung po lnga la dmigs nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba skye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the view of the transitory collection arises in dependence on the five aggregates.

original: kha cig ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dmigs pas sems gcig pu yin par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dmigs pas sems gcig pu yin par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Some say that the view of the transitory collection is a single mind that is the object of observation of the view of the transitory collection.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: kha cig dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: kha cig dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Some say that the self is the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga rnams la'o //
translated: This also refers to the five aggregates.

original: phung po lnga la bdag tu mngon par zhen pa la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po lnga la bdag tu mngon par zhen pa la mdo'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the scriptural source for the assertion that the five aggregates are the self, he says:

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: As it is said.

original: 'dir gang gi phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag kho na la yang dag par rjes su lta'o zhes gsungs pa de'i phyir bdag tu lta ba'i dmigs pa ni phung po lnga kho na yin par grub pa yin no ;
analyzed: 'dir gang gi phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag kho na la yang dag par rjes su lta'o zhes gsungs pa de'i phyir bdag tu lta ba'i dmigs pa ni phung po lnga kho na yin par grub pa yin no ;
translated: Here, since it is said, “One should correctly view just these five aggregates as a self,” it is established that the five aggregates alone are the focal object of the view of the self.

original: / de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, the five aggregates are the focal object of the view of the transitory collection.

original: lta ba 'di ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can gyi tshogs pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir phung po lnga la dmigs pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ming thob pa yin te /
analyzed: lta ba 'di ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can gyi tshogs pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir phung po lnga la dmigs pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ming thob pa yin te /
translated: This view is called the view of the transitory collection because it focuses on the five aggregates.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig par 'gyur bas ni 'jig pa dang / tshogs pa'i phyir na tshogs pa yin pas 'jig pa yang yin la tshogs kyang yin pas 'jig pa'i tshogs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig par 'gyur bas ni 'jig pa dang / tshogs pa'i phyir na tshogs pa yin pas 'jig pa yang yin la tshogs kyang yin pas 'jig pa'i tshogs te /
translated: It is called the view of the transitory collection because it is a collection that is transitory, since it is destroyed, and it is a collection because it is a collection.

original: 'jig bzhin pa'i phung po rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: 'jig bzhin pa'i phung po rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: It is a collection that is transitory because it is a collection of the five aggregates that are in the process of being destroyed.

original: de la bdag dang bdag gir rnam pas 'jug pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la bdag dang bdag gir rnam pas 'jug pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: That wisdom which operates in terms of “I” and “mine” should be called the view of the transitory collection.

original: des na phung po lnga la dmigs pa yin na 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob pa yin no //
analyzed: des na phung po lnga la dmigs pa yin na 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when it has the five aggregates as its object, it obtains the name “view of the transitory collection.”

original: de'i phyir / bdag gam bdag gi ba la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / bdag gam bdag gi ba la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “not with regard to ‘I’ or ‘mine.’”

original: gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba ni mang pos bkur ba gzhan dag go //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba ni mang pos bkur ba gzhan dag go //
translated: “Others” refers to other Saṃmitīyas.

original: sems la bdag @243a * //
analyzed: sems la bdag @243a * //
translated: They assert that the mind is the self.

original: go zhes 'dod de zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga char 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dmigs pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sems kho na yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: go zhes 'dod de zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga char 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dmigs pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sems kho na yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not the case that all five aggregates are the object of the view of the transitory collection, but rather the mind alone is.

original: de la mdo'i khungs ston pa ni /🔽bdag nyid bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽bdag nyid bdag gi mgon yin gyi//
analyzed: de la mdo'i khungs ston pa ni / bdag nyid bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / bdag nyid bdag gi mgon yin gyi//
translated: To show the scriptural source for that,🔽he says, “‘The self is the protector of the self’ and so on.”

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sems kyi mgon ni bdag gi sems kho na yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sems kyi mgon ni bdag gi sems kho na yin te /
translated: “The self is the protector of the self” means that the protector of the self is the mind alone.

original: rang gi sems kho nas rang gi sems 'dul bar nus kyi dbang phyug la sogs pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sems kho nas rang gi sems 'dul bar nus kyi dbang phyug la sogs pas ni ma yin no //
translated: One’s own mind alone is able to subdue one’s own mind, not Īśvara, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: gzhan ni su zhig mgon du 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan ni su zhig mgon du 'gyur //
translated: who else will be a protector?

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said that

original: rang gi sems las gzhan pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa rnams mgon nyid du ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sems las gzhan pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa rnams mgon nyid du ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: apart from one’s own mind, no Īśvara, etc., is observed to be a protector.

original: bdag nyid legs par thul bas ni //
analyzed: bdag nyid legs par thul bas ni //
translated: One who is well-subdued by oneself

original: zhes bya ba ni sems dul ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems dul ba nyid kyis so //
translated: means one who is well-subdued by the mind itself.

original: mkhas pas mtho ris thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: mkhas pas mtho ris thob par 'gyur //
translated: The wise one attains heaven

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe sems legs par dul ba de'i tshe mi dge ba ma byas pa las blo dang ldan pas mtho ris thob pa yin no zhes pa'o //🔽sems las bdag gi sgrar gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe sems legs par dul ba de'i tshe mi dge ba ma byas pa las blo dang ldan pas mtho ris thob pa yin no zhes pa'o // sems las bdag gi sgrar gsungs so //
translated: means that when the mind is well-subdued, the wise one attains heaven by not committing non-virtue.🔽The word “self” is said to refer to the mind

original: zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcas pa 'di las sems bdag gi sgras gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcas pa 'di las sems bdag gi sgras gsungs pa yin no //
translated: means that in this verse, the word “self” refers to the mind.

original: 'di ga las she na zhes bya ba ni 'dir gsal ba bdag gi sgra dmigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na zhes bya ba ni 'dir gsal ba bdag gi sgra dmigs pa yin gyi /
translated: Here, one might ask, How is it known that the word 'self' is the referent here, and not the word 'mind'?

original: sems kyi sgra ni ma gsungs pas bdag ma yin par ci ltar khong du chud ce na'o //
analyzed: sems kyi sgra ni ma gsungs pas bdag ma yin par ci ltar khong du chud ce na'o //
translated: Since the word 'mind' is not mentioned, how is it understood that it is not the self?

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the answer to that,

original: phung po las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: phung po las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, from the aggregates, and so on.

original: mdo gzhan las kyang sems la bdag gi sgras gsungs pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mdo gzhan las kyang sems la bdag gi sgras gsungs pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that in another sūtra the word 'self' is also used to refer to the mind,

original: mdo gzhan las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo gzhan las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, In another sūtra, and so on.

original: sems 'dul bar gsungs pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mdo gzhan las sems 'dul bar gsungs pa de bzhin du mdo 'dir yang bdag nyid legs par thub pa ni zhes bya bas 'dul bar gsungs pas bdag gi sgras sems kho na brjod pa yin🔽no zhes pa'o ;
analyzed: sems 'dul bar gsungs pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mdo gzhan las sems 'dul bar gsungs pa de bzhin du mdo 'dir yang bdag nyid legs par thub pa ni zhes bya bas 'dul bar gsungs pas bdag gi sgras sems kho na brjod pa yin🔽no zhes pa'o ;
translated: Because it is said that the mind is to be disciplined means that because in another sūtra it is said that the mind is to be disciplined, in this sūtra it is also said that the self is to be disciplined by the phrase the self should be well-tamed. Therefore, the word 'self' refers only to the mind.

original: / sems dul ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gang sems dul ba de ni bde ba 'dren zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: / sems dul ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gang sems dul ba de ni bde ba 'dren zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The verse beginning with “The mind that is tamed” explains that the mind that is tamed is the one that leads to happiness.

original: gang gi phyir sems dul bas mtho ris dang byang grol gyi bde ba thob pa de'i phyir sems dul ba ni legs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems dul bas mtho ris dang byang grol gyi bde ba thob pa de'i phyir sems dul ba ni legs pa'o //
translated: Because one who has a tamed mind attains the happiness of the higher realms and liberation, therefore, a tamed mind is excellent.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mdo gzhan las sems dul bar gsungs @243b ba de'i phyir /🔽bdag nyid bdag gi mgon yin gyi //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mdo gzhan las sems dul bar gsungs @243b ba de'i phyir / bdag nyid bdag gi mgon yin gyi //
translated: “Therefore” means because the tamed mind is mentioned in another sūtra.

original: zhes bya ba der sems kho na la bdag gi sgrar gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba der sems kho na la bdag gi sgrar gsungs pas so //
translated: “One’s own self is one’s own protector” means that in that statement, the mind alone is referred to by the word “self.”

original: des na 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dmigs pa ni sems kho na yin no zhes pa'o //🔽de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dmigs pa ni sems kho na yin no zhes pa'o // de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the object of the view of the transitory collection is the mind alone.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the response to that, [the root text] states, “Here . . .” and so on.

original: gal te phung po bdag na zhes bya ba ni gal te phung po rnams bdag kho na yin na'o //
analyzed: gal te phung po bdag na zhes bya ba ni gal te phung po rnams bdag kho na yin na'o //
translated: “If the aggregates were the self” means if the aggregates were the self.

original: de mang bas zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams mang pas so //
analyzed: de mang bas zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams mang pas so //
translated: “Because they are many” means because the aggregates are many.

original: bdag de dag kyang mang por 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag de dag kyang mang por 'gyur //
translated: And those selves would be many.

original: zhes bya ba ni phung po dang bdag tha mi dad pa'i phyir bdag kyang mang por 'gyur ba las khyod kyis de ltar yang 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phung po dang bdag tha mi dad pa'i phyir bdag kyang mang por 'gyur ba las khyod kyis de ltar yang 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the aggregates and the self are not different, the self would be many. But you do not accept that.🔽The self would be substantial.

original: bdag ni rdzas su 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni bdag phung po las tha mi dad pa'i phyir phung po rnams rdzas su yod pa'i phyir bdag kyang rdzas su yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag ni rdzas su 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni bdag phung po las tha mi dad pa'i phyir phung po rnams rdzas su yod pa'i phyir bdag kyang rdzas su yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the aggregates are substantial, the self would be substantial, because the self is not different from the aggregates.

original: der lta ba zhes bya ba ni phung po las tha mi dad par ro //
analyzed: der lta ba zhes bya ba ni phung po las tha mi dad par ro //
translated: The view of the self would not be a mistake.🔽The view of the self would not be a mistake, because the view of the perishable collection focuses on the self, which has the characteristic of the five aggregates, and focuses on a substantial entity.

original: bdag ni rdzas su yod par 'dod pa yang ma yin no ;
analyzed: bdag ni rdzas su yod par 'dod pa yang ma yin no ;
translated: We do not accept that the self is a substantial entity.

original: / rdzas la 'jug pas phyin ci log mi 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can gyi bdag la dmigs nas rdzas la dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / rdzas la 'jug pas phyin ci log mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can gyi bdag la dmigs nas rdzas la dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: The view of the perishable collection would not be a mistake.

original: phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The view of the perishable collection would not be a mistake, because it focuses on a substantial entity, the self.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The Commentary explains this:

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The root text declares, “If it is one with them, it would be many.”

original: bdag kyang mang por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams dang tha mi dad pas so //
analyzed: bdag kyang mang por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams dang tha mi dad pas so //
translated: “ It would be many” means that it would be many because it would not be different from the aggregates.

original: de'i ltar na yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa rdzas su smra ba rnams kyi ltar na yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i ltar na yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa rdzas su smra ba rnams kyi ltar na yang ngo //
translated: “ Even so” means that even according to those who maintain that consciousness is a substance.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dbye bas sam //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dbye bas sam //
translated: “ Because of the differentiation of the eye consciousness, etc.”

original: zhes bya ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang ; lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams mang ba'i phyir de rnams dang tha mi dad pa'i bdag kyang mang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang ; lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams mang ba'i phyir de rnams dang tha mi dad pa'i bdag kyang mang po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: means that because the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousnesses are many, it follows that the self, which is not different from them, would also be many.

original: skad cig re re la rnam par shes pa skye ba dang 'gag pa mang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yang na mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa re re yang skad cig re re la skye ba dang 'gag pa mang ba'i phyir de rnams dang
analyzed: skad cig re re la rnam par shes pa skye ba dang 'gag pa mang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yang na mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa re re yang skad cig re re la skye ba dang 'gag pa mang ba'i phyir de rnams dang
translated: “ Because the arising and cessation of consciousness is frequent” means that, in each moment, the eye consciousness, etc., are many because they arise and cease.

original: tha mi dad pa'i bdag kyang mang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i bdag kyang mang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And the self would be multiple because of being undifferentiated.🔽Or else, the fault should be stated in whatever way is appropriate.

original: yang na ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du nyes pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te phung po bdag na de'i phyir te mang bas bdag de dag kyang mang por 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'di phung po @244a * //
analyzed: yang na ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du nyes pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te phung po bdag na de'i phyir te mang bas bdag de dag kyang mang por 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'di phung po @244a * //
translated: This is saying that if the aggregates were the self, then because of their multiplicity, those selves would also be multiple.

original: rnams bdag yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs rjod par byed pa yin gyi rnam par shes pa bdag yin pa'i phyogs la ni rjod par byed pa ma yin pas phung po rnams bdag yin pa'i phyogs kho na la brjod par bya la /
analyzed: rnams bdag yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs rjod par byed pa yin gyi rnam par shes pa bdag yin pa'i phyogs la ni rjod par byed pa ma yin pas phung po rnams bdag yin pa'i phyogs kho na la brjod par bya la /
translated: This passage is stating the position that the aggregates are the self, but it is not stating the position that consciousness is the self. Therefore, the fault should be stated only in the position that the aggregates are the self.

original: bdag ni rdzas su 'gyur zhing der lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyogs gnyis ka la yod pa yin pas gnyis ka la brjod par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni rdzas su 'gyur zhing der lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyogs gnyis ka la yod pa yin pas gnyis ka la brjod par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The statement “the self would be substantial and the view of that would be the view of the self” and so on is common to both positions and should be stated in both.

original: bshad pa snga ma'i mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bshad pa snga ma'i mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary of the previous explanation, it says:

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, the self is not the aggregates.

original: de la phung po rnams bdag yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gang gi ltar na sems bdag yin pa de'i ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes pa brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la phung po rnams bdag yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gang gi ltar na sems bdag yin pa de'i ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes pa brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The faults that are stated, such as the aggregates are the self, and so on, and according to those who say that mind is the self, and so on.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The other faults that will be explained, and so on, are as follows.

original: bdag ni rdzas su 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni rdzas su 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement, the self would be a substance, and so on.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa bdag tu smra ba dag la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa bdag tu smra ba dag la'o //
translated: Here, refers to those who advocate that consciousness is the self.

original: phyogs gnyis ka la yang zhes bya ba ni phung po bdag tu smra ba dang rnam par shes pa bdag tu smra ba'i phyogs dag la'o //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis ka la yang zhes bya ba ni phung po bdag tu smra ba dang rnam par shes pa bdag tu smra ba'i phyogs dag la'o //
translated: Both positions, refers to the positions that advocate that the aggregates are the self and that consciousness is the self.

original: bdag mang por gyur na nyes pa ci zhig yod snyam na /
analyzed: bdag mang por gyur na nyes pa ci zhig yod snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, What is the fault if the self is manifold?

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The answer is as follows.

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The statement, the world, and so on, is as follows.

original: lung las gang zag nyag gcig yin no zhes 'byung pas na bdag mang po 'dod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lung las gang zag nyag gcig yin no zhes 'byung pas na bdag mang po 'dod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Since it is said in the scriptures that the person is singular, it is not advocated that the self is manifold.

original: skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach another fault, he says:

original: bdag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “I am” and so on.

original: de la rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reason, he says:

original: gzugs la sogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “in form and so on” and so on.

original: gzhan gyi rdzas su yod pa'i phung po lnga brjod pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rdzas su yod pa'i phung po lnga brjod pas so //
translated: Because the five aggregates that exist as the possessions of another are expressed.

original: dge slong dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: dge slong dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: “Monks” and so on.

original: ming tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phyi ma phyi ma ni snga ma snga ma'i bshad pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ming tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phyi ma phyi ma ni snga ma snga ma'i bshad pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: In “mere name” and so on, the latter should be understood as the explanation of the former.

original: 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgras ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa brjod pa yin te ;
analyzed: 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgras ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa brjod pa yin te ;
translated: Thus, by the word “nirvāṇa” cessation through analysis is expressed.

original: de yang sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la so sor 'jal zhing dpyod pa'i sgo nas 'gog pa thob pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la so sor 'jal zhing dpyod pa'i sgo nas 'gog pa thob pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: And that is the cessation that is attained through the analysis and examination of the noble truths of suffering and so on.

original: de la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That is called “nirvāṇa.”

original: de yod na nyon mongs pa rnams ldog par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de yod na nyon mongs pa rnams ldog par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because when that exists, the afflictions are stopped.

original: 'di ni gang zag ming tsam yin no zhes @244b gsungs pas gang zag rdzas su yod pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gang zag ming tsam yin no zhes @244b gsungs pas gang zag rdzas su yod pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since it is said that this is merely a nominal person, it is said that the person does not substantially exist.

original: gang zag rdzas su med pa la mdo'i khungs gzhan yang bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag rdzas su med pa la mdo'i khungs gzhan yang bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate another scriptural source for the non-substantial existence of the person,

original: de bzhin du ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he states, “Similarly, etc.”

original: yan lag tshogs rnams la zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo la sogs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: yan lag tshogs rnams la zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo la sogs pa rnams la'o //
translated: The “collection of parts” refers to the wheels, etc.

original: kun rdzob sems can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob sems can zhes bya'o //
translated: The conventional is called a “sentient being.”

original: zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams la brten nas sems can zhes btags pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams la brten nas sems can zhes btags pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that the designation “sentient being” is made in dependence upon the aggregates.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: de ltar lung gi sgo nas bdag rdzas su med par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar lung gi sgo nas bdag rdzas su med par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having demonstrated through scripture that the self does not substantially exist,

original: rdzas su yod pa la yang skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa la yang skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
translated: in order to demonstrate the error in its substantial existence,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he states, “Moreover, etc.”

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba rdzas kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir na zhes bya ba ni gal te bdag phung po dang rnam par shes pa las tha mi dad par khas len na de'i tshe bdag rdzas su yod pa'i phyir na de yul can 'jig tshogs la lta
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba rdzas kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir na zhes bya ba ni gal te bdag phung po dang rnam par shes pa las tha mi dad par khas len na de'i tshe bdag rdzas su yod pa'i phyir na de yul can 'jig tshogs la lta
translated: The view of the perishing aggregates is a substantial object.🔽If you accept that the self is not different from the aggregates or consciousness, then the view of the perishing aggregates that takes it as an object would be a substantial object.🔽

original: ba phyin ci log nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ba phyin ci log nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because the view of the transitory collection has a substantial object, if one accepts that the self is not different from the aggregates or consciousness, then at that time, because the self would be substantially existent, the view of the transitory collection that has it as its object would not be erroneous.

original: rdzas su yod pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would have as its object a substantially existent self.

original: ji ltar sngon po dang ser po la dmigs pa'i shes pa rnams rdzas su yod pa'i sngon po la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir phyin ci log gi shes pa ma yin pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sngon po dang ser po la dmigs pa'i shes pa rnams rdzas su yod pa'i sngon po la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir phyin ci log gi shes pa ma yin pa bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as consciousnesses that observe blue and yellow are not erroneous consciousnesses because they observe substantially existent blue and so on.

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa ma yin na skyon ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa ma yin na skyon ci yod snyam na /
translated: If it is not erroneous, what is the problem?

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the response to that,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the root text says, “Therefore . . .” and so forth.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba phyin ci log ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba phyin ci log ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Therefore” means because the view of the transitory collection is not erroneous.

original: kun tu 'byung ba yang spang bar mi 'gyur ba'am zhes bya ba ni 'dir spang ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: kun tu 'byung ba yang spang bar mi 'gyur ba'am zhes bya ba ni 'dir spang ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: “Nor would the occurrence of the latter be abandoned” means that here abandonment is twofold:

original: ngo bo spang ba dang / de la dmigs pa'i 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spang ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo spang ba dang / de la dmigs pa'i 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spang ba'o //
translated: abandonment of the nature and abandonment of the desire realm that focuses on that.

original: de la dmigs pa la phyin ci log tu zhugs pa rnams kyis ni ngo bo spang ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi kun du 'byung ba spangs pa'i spang ba ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa la phyin ci log tu zhugs pa rnams kyis ni ngo bo spang ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi kun du 'byung ba spangs pa'i spang ba ste /
translated: Those who engage in error with regard to the object of that desire realm that focuses on that abandon the abandonment that has the characteristic of abandoning the nature.

original: ci ltar rtag pa dang gtsang ba la sogs pa'i phyin ci log gi sgo nas 'jug pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: ci ltar rtag pa dang gtsang ba la sogs pa'i phyin ci log gi sgo nas 'jug pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: For example, desire realm that engages in terms of the errors of permanence, purity, and so on.

original: de la dmigs pa'i 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spong ba ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyi yin te /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spong ba ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyi yin te /
translated: Abandonment of the desire realm that focuses on that is the desire realm of consciousnesses such as blue and yellow.

original: de rnams dmigs pa la phyin ci ma log par 'jug pa'i phyir de rnams 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin du ngo bo spong ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rnam par @245a * //
analyzed: de rnams dmigs pa la phyin ci ma log par 'jug pa'i phyir de rnams 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin du ngo bo spong ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rnam par @245a * //
translated: Because those engage without error with regard to their object, they do not abandon the nature like desire realm and so on.

original: shes pa la dmigs pa'i 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spong bas rnam par shes pa de rnams spang ba yin no zhes brjod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang gal te 'jig tshogs la lta ba rdzas su yod pa'i bdag la dmigs pa yin na de'i sngon po dang ser
analyzed: shes pa la dmigs pa'i 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spong bas rnam par shes pa de rnams spang ba yin no zhes brjod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang gal te 'jig tshogs la lta ba rdzas su yod pa'i bdag la dmigs pa yin na de'i sngon po dang ser
translated: Just as it is said that consciousness is abandoned by abandoning the desire realm that focuses on consciousness, so too here, if the afflicted view of the self focuses on a substantially existent self, then it would be abandoned by abandoning the self.🔽

original: po la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du de phyin ci log nyid ma yin pa'i phyir de la dmigs pa'i 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kho na spong bar 'gyur ba las de ltar yang ma yin te ngo bor spong bar 'dod pas so //
analyzed: po la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du de phyin ci log nyid ma yin pa'i phyir de la dmigs pa'i 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kho na spong bar 'gyur ba las de ltar yang ma yin te ngo bor spong bar 'dod pas so //
translated: Just as it is said that consciousness is abandoned by abandoning the desire realm attachment that focuses on consciousness, in the same way, if the view of the perishing aggregates focuses on a substantially existent self, then just as consciousness of blue, yellow, and so on, it would not be a misconception. Therefore, it would be the desire realm attachment that focuses on it that would be abandoned, but this is not the case.

original: des na bdag rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na bdag rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the self does not substantially exist.

original: yang phung po dang rnam par shes pa bdag tu smra ba'i phyogs la skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang phung po dang rnam par shes pa bdag tu smra ba'i phyogs la skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the faults of the positions that assert the aggregates or consciousness to be the self, the root text says:

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, if the self were the aggregates,

original: mya ngan 'das tshe nges par bdag chad 'gyur //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das tshe nges par bdag chad 'gyur //
translated: then at death, when the aggregates perish, the self would definitely be annihilated.

original: zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus su phung po lnga chad pas bdag kyang chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus su phung po lnga chad pas bdag kyang chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is because at the time of nirvana without remainder, the five aggregates are severed, and so the self would be severed.

original: des na mthar 'dzin pa'i lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na mthar 'dzin pa'i lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would follow that it would be a view grasping an extreme.

original: mya ngan 'das sngon skad cig dag la ni //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das sngon skad cig dag la ni //
translated: Before nirvana, in every moment,🔽there would be arising and disintegration.

original: skye 'jig ces bya ba ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sngon rol du phung po rnams skad cig so so la skye ba dang 'jig pa yod pas bdag la skye ba dang 'jig pa yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye 'jig ces bya ba ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sngon rol du phung po rnams skad cig so so la skye ba dang 'jig pa yod pas bdag la skye ba dang 'jig pa yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is because before nirvana without remainder, since the aggregates arise and disintegrate in every moment, the self would arise and disintegrate.

original: de'i phyir de'i dus na nga 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa de mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i dus na nga 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa de mi 'thad de /
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say, “I will exist at that time.”

original: bdag zhig pa yin pa'i phyir skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag zhig pa yin pa'i phyir skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate another error, it is said:

original: byed po med pas de 'bras med //🔽ces gsungs te /
analyzed: byed po med pas de 'bras med //🔽ces gsungs te /
translated: Since there is no agent, there is no effect.

original: gal te bdag phung po las tha mi dad pa'i phyir skad cig ma yin na de'i tshe las kyi byed pa po zhig pa las kyang rten med pas zhig pa'i phyir 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag phung po las tha mi dad pa'i phyir skad cig ma yin na de'i tshe las kyi byed pa po zhig pa las kyang rten med pas zhig pa'i phyir 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If the self were momentary because it is not different from the aggregates, then at the time the agent of the action has perished, the action would be without a basis and would perish, and so there would be no effect.

original: gal te bdag gi skad cig ma dang po las byas nas skad cig ma phyi mas 'bras bu longs spyod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bdag gi skad cig ma dang po las byas nas skad cig ma phyi mas 'bras bu longs spyod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the self that performs the action in the first moment experiences the effect in the second moment,🔽then that is illogical.

original: de yang mi rigs so zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs so zhes ston pa ni /
translated: The text states:

original: gzhan gyis bsags las gzhan gyis za bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bsags las gzhan gyis za bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Another would accumulate karma, and another would experience it.

original: skad cig ma gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu skad cig ma gzhan gyis longs spyod par 'gyur na ni lhas byin gyis las byas nas mchod sbyin gyis 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod pa por thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu skad cig ma gzhan gyis longs spyod par 'gyur na ni lhas byin gyis las byas nas mchod sbyin gyis 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod pa por thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the effect of an action done by one moment were experienced by another moment, then it would follow that Devadatta would perform the action and Yajñadatta would experience the effect.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, it is said:

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If the self were different in each moment,🔽then it would be permanent or impermanent.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma med par mya ngan @245b las 'das pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma med par mya ngan @245b las 'das pa'i tshe'o //
translated: When one passes into nirvāṇa means when one passes into nirvāṇa without any remainder of the aggregates.

original: mthar 'dzin pas mthar lta bar thal bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba de rgyas par 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: mthar 'dzin pas mthar lta bar thal bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba de rgyas par 'chad pa ni /
translated: The consequence of the extreme view of the transitory collection would follow means that the extreme view of the transitory collection would follow.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To explain this in detail, he says, Because... and so on.

original: bdag ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus su yang zhes bya ba ni phung po las tha mi dad pa'i bdag mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus su yang ngo //
analyzed: bdag ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus su yang zhes bya ba ni phung po las tha mi dad pa'i bdag mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus su yang ngo //
translated: The phrase even when the self passes into nirvāṇa means that even when the self, which is not different from the aggregates, passes into nirvāṇa.

original: gal te bdag rgyun ma chad par khas blangs na skyon ci yod snyam na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te bdag rgyun ma chad par khas blangs na skyon ci yod snyam na ma yin te /
translated: If one accepts that the self is uninterrupted, what is the problem?

original: phung po rnams kyang rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyang rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur bas so //
translated: There is the problem that the aggregates would also be uninterrupted.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the conclusion, he says,

original: de'i phyir bdag ni phung po'i bdag nyid kyis ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag ni phung po'i bdag nyid kyis ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the self is not the same as the aggregates.

original: mya ngan las 'das par zhugs pa'i sngon rol gyi gnas skabs na phung po'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag la skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par zhugs pa'i sngon rol gyi gnas skabs na phung po'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag la skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the faults of the self that has the nature of the aggregates prior to entering nirvana,

original: mya ngan las 'das par zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: he says, “In nirvana.”

original: skad cig re re la skye zhing 'jig pa la skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skad cig re re la skye zhing 'jig pa la skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the faults of arising and ceasing in every moment,

original: de'i phyir ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Therefore, how could it be said . . .” and so on.

original: nga'i lus 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lus me la sogs pas zhig pas so //
analyzed: nga'i lus 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lus me la sogs pas zhig pas so //
translated: “This body of mine will come to an end” means that the body is destroyed by fire and so on.

original: 'di yang gsung bar mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'di yang gsung bar mi 'gyur te //
translated: This also would not be said,

original: zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bdag dang nga la nu'i bdag la skad cig re re la skye zhing 'jig pas mi rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bdag dang nga la nu'i bdag la skad cig re re la skye zhing 'jig pas mi rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pas so //
translated: because the Blessed One accepts that the self and “I” are impermanent due to arising and ceasing in every moment.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show just that,

original: de'i tshe bdag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “At that time, I also . . .” and so on.

original: bstan bcos las kyang zhes bya ba ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
analyzed: bstan bcos las kyang zhes bya ba ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
translated: Also from the treatise means from the Fundamental Treatise on the Middle Way.

original: nye bar len nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nye bar len nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the line “The appropriated is not the self,”

original: gang phung po lnga zhes bya ba'i nye bar len pa de ni skad cig re re la skye zhing 'jig la bdag ni phung po las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du dad rtag pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: gang phung po lnga zhes bya ba'i nye bar len pa de ni skad cig re re la skye zhing 'jig la bdag ni phung po las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du dad rtag pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par mi nus te /
translated: the appropriated is the five aggregates. It arises and disintegrates moment by moment. The self cannot be described as being the same as the aggregates or as being different from them, as being permanent or as being impermanent.

original: skyon du ma 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyon du ma 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: This is because many errors would ensue.

original: bdag rtag pa yin na rtag par smra bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdag rtag pa yin na rtag par smra bar 'gyur la /
translated: If the self were permanent, it would follow that one would be a proponent of eternalism.

original: mi rtag pa yin na chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa yin na chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the self were impermanent, it would follow that one would be a proponent of nihilism.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba gnyis po 'di ni don ma yin pa chen po sgrub par byed pas khas blang bar 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba gnyis po 'di ni don ma yin pa chen po sgrub par byed pas khas blang bar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the two, permanent and impermanent, establish a great meaninglessness, they are not worthy of being accepted.

original: des na nye bar len pa po'i phung po rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba'i nye bar len pa de nyid bdag yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: des na nye bar len pa po'i phung po rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba'i nye bar len pa de nyid bdag yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say that the appropriated aggregates are the self.

original: gzhan yang nye bar len pa por //
analyzed: gzhan yang nye bar len pa por //
translated: Moreover,

original: ci lta bur ni 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: ci lta bur ni 'gyur ba yin //
translated: How could the appropriator🔽Be without appropriation?

original: zhes bya ba ni nye bar blang bar bya ba yin pas na nye bar len pa po ste las so //🔽de la nges par nye bar len pa po ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nye bar blang bar bya ba yin pas na nye bar len pa po ste las so // de la nges par nye bar len pa po ste /
translated: The appropriator is the agent because of appropriating.

original: sog pa po dgos par 'gyur la /🔽gal @246a * //🔽te nye bar len pa bdag nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe nye bar len pa kho na bdag yin par 'gyur bas des na byed pa po dang las dag gcig tu 'gyur bas gcod pa po dang / gcad par bya ba dang / bum pa dang /
analyzed: sog pa po dgos par 'gyur la / gal @246a * // te nye bar len pa bdag nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe nye bar len pa kho na bdag yin par 'gyur bas des na byed pa po dang las dag gcig tu 'gyur bas gcod pa po dang / gcad par bya ba dang / bum pa dang /
translated: In that regard, the appropriator would definitely be required.🔽If the appropriator is asserted to be the self, then at that time the appropriator would be the self.🔽Therefore, the agent and the object would be the same, and the cutter and the cut object, the pot and the potter, and fire and smoke, and so on, would also be the same.

original: rdza mkhan dang / me dang / du ba la sogs pa rnams kyang gcig nyid du 'gyur ba las de ltar mthong ba yang ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rdza mkhan dang / me dang / du ba la sogs pa rnams kyang gcig nyid du 'gyur ba las de ltar mthong ba yang ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: But that is not seen.

original: phung po rnams bdag ma yin no zhes brjod pa las bstan bcos kyi khungs gnyis pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po rnams bdag ma yin no zhes brjod pa las bstan bcos kyi khungs gnyis pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The second source of the treatise is taught by the statement, “The aggregates are not the self,” and so on.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The statement “In the same way” and so on is for the purpose of teaching the second source of the treatise.

original: gal te phung po rnams las bdag yin par 'gyur na phung po rnams la skye ba dang 'jig pa yod pas bdag la yang skye ba dang 'jig pa yod par 'gyur ro //🔽gal te bdag la skye ba dang 'jig pa nyid yod na skyon ci yod snyam na de la lan ni /
analyzed: gal te phung po rnams las bdag yin par 'gyur na phung po rnams la skye ba dang 'jig pa yod pas bdag la yang skye ba dang 'jig pa yod par 'gyur ro // gal te bdag la skye ba dang 'jig pa nyid yod na skyon ci yod snyam na de la lan ni /
translated: If the self were the aggregates, since the aggregates have arising and disintegration, the self would also have arising and disintegration.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa nyid yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa nyid yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If the self had arising and disintegration, what would be the problem? The response to that is stated in the lines beginning “If the self has arising and disintegration.”🔽If the self has arising and disintegration, then karma would not exist.

original: las la yang rten med pa'i phyir med pas zhes bya ba ni las kyi rten ni byed pa po yin pas de'i phyir de la rten med pas las kyang 'jig pas so //
analyzed: las la yang rten med pa'i phyir med pas zhes bya ba ni las kyi rten ni byed pa po yin pas de'i phyir de la rten med pas las kyang 'jig pas so //
translated: Since there would be no basis for karma, it would not exist. The basis of karma is the agent. Therefore, since there would be no basis for it, karma would be destroyed.

original: las rnams 'bras bu dang 'brel pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang las rnams kyi 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba'i mtshan nyid can dag byed pa po dang 'brel pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: las rnams 'bras bu dang 'brel pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang las rnams kyi 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba'i mtshan nyid can dag byed pa po dang 'brel pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Actions would be unrelated to their effects” means that the effects of actions would not be related to their agent.

original: gzhan gyis 'brel pa sgrub par byed pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'brel pa sgrub par byed pa ni /
translated: The establishment of the relation by another is

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: as stated in the lines beginning “If one person were to perform the actions…”

original: gzhan gyis bsags pa'i zhes bya ba ni lhas byin gyis bsags pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bsags pa'i zhes bya ba ni lhas byin gyis bsags pa'o //
translated: “Accumulated by another” means accumulated by Devadatta.

original: rnam par smin pa gzhan gyis longs spyod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mchod sbyin gyis rnam par smin pa longs spyod pas so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa gzhan gyis longs spyod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mchod sbyin gyis rnam par smin pa longs spyod pas so //
translated: “Because another would experience the evolution” means that Yajñadatta would experience the evolution.

original: byas pa chud zos pa dang zhes bya ba ni lhas byin byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu nyams su mi myong bas so //
analyzed: byas pa chud zos pa dang zhes bya ba ni lhas byin byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu nyams su mi myong bas so //
translated: “What is done would perish” means that Devadatta would not experience the effect of the action he has done.

original: ma byas pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mchod sbyin gyis las ma byas par 'bras bu nyams su myong bar 'gyur na ma byas pa dang phrad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma byas pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mchod sbyin gyis las ma byas par 'bras bu nyams su myong bar 'gyur na ma byas pa dang phrad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one experienced the effect of an action that one has not done, one would encounter what one has not done.

original: bstan bcos las kyang zhes bya ba ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so ;
analyzed: bstan bcos las kyang zhes bya ba ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so ;
translated: Also, in the treatise

original: / gal te 'di ni gzhan 'gyur na //
analyzed: / gal te 'di ni gzhan 'gyur na //
translated: If this were to become something else,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te da ltar ba'i bdag 'di sngon gyi bdag las gzhan yin par gyur na de'i tshe sngon gyi bdag de med par yang ste yongs su dor zhing de la ma ltos par de'i rgyu can ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te da ltar ba'i bdag 'di sngon gyi bdag las gzhan yin par gyur na de'i tshe sngon gyi bdag de med par yang ste yongs su dor zhing de la ma ltos par de'i rgyu can ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur
translated: If this present self were to become something else, that is, if the present self were different from the former self, then at that time, the former self would not exist, that is, it would be completely abandoned and the present self would not be dependent on it.🔽It would not be caused by it.

original: ro // de bzhin du ni gnas 'gyur zhing//
analyzed: ro // de bzhin du ni gnas 'gyur zhing//
translated: And likewise, it would remain as it is.

original: @246b zhes bya ba ni gal te sngon gyi bdag las bdag 'di gzhan nyid yin par gyur na ni de'i tshe gzhan yin pa'i phyir bum pa skyes nas snam bu ma zhig pa bzhin du phyis kyi bdag skye tsa na sngar gyi bdag 'gag par yang mi 'gyur
analyzed: @246b zhes bya ba ni gal te sngon gyi bdag las bdag 'di gzhan nyid yin par gyur na ni de'i tshe gzhan yin pa'i phyir bum pa skyes nas snam bu ma zhig pa bzhin du phyis kyi bdag skye tsa na sngar gyi bdag 'gag par yang mi 'gyur
translated: If this self were different from the former self, then, because it would be different, the later self would arise like a vase, and the former self would not cease, like a cloth that has not disintegrated.

original: la / ma 'gags pa'i phyir de ltar lha dang mi la sogs pa'i skye ba gang du skyes pa kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa gang gis sngar dmigs pa de'i rnam pa de nyid kyis der gnas par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: la / ma 'gags pa'i phyir de ltar lha dang mi la sogs pa'i skye ba gang du skyes pa kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa gang gis sngar dmigs pa de'i rnam pa de nyid kyis der gnas par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Because it would not cease, it would remain just as it was previously observed, with its color, shape, and so on, in whatever birth it was born in, whether as a god, human, and so on.

original: sngar gyi de nyid ma shi bar 'dir skye bar 'gyur ba las mir skyes pa'i dus su sngon lha'i bdag nyid de bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ba ni mi srid pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi de nyid ma shi bar 'dir skye bar 'gyur ba las mir skyes pa'i dus su sngon lha'i bdag nyid de bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ba ni mi srid pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Or the former self would be born here without dying. It is impossible for the self that was a god to remain as it was when it was born as a human.

original: de la gzhan dag na re sngar gyi bdag nyid yongs su dor nas 'dir mir skyes pa la skyon ci zhig yod ce na skyon mang po yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gzhan dag na re sngar gyi bdag nyid yongs su dor nas 'dir mir skyes pa la skyon ci zhig yod ce na skyon mang po yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: There would be many faults.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin par gyur na /
translated: If that were the case,🔽there would be annihilation, the destruction of karma,

original: chad pa dang las rnams chud za ba dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chad pa dang las rnams chud za ba dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: gal te sngon gyi bdag spangs pa yin par gyur na de ltar na sngon gyi bdag de der zhig pas 'dir gzhan skye ba'i phyir sngar gyi bdag chad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te sngon gyi bdag spangs pa yin par gyur na de ltar na sngon gyi bdag de der zhig pas 'dir gzhan skye ba'i phyir sngar gyi bdag chad par 'gyur la /
translated: If the former self were abandoned, then in that case, since the former self would have been destroyed, another would be born here. Therefore the former self would be annihilated.

original: bdag de chad par gyur na las kyi rten chad pas las chad pa'i phyir dang byed pa po yang med pas chud za ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag de chad par gyur na las kyi rten chad pas las chad pa'i phyir dang byed pa po yang med pas chud za ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that self were annihilated, since the basis of karma would be severed, karma would be destroyed. And since there would be no agent, karma would definitely be wasted.

original: gal te sngar gyi bdag gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu phyis kyi bdag gis myong bar 'gyur ba rtog na gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu gzhan gyis longs spyod par 'gyur la des na ma byas pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i mi🔽'dod pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sngar gyi bdag gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu phyis kyi bdag gis myong bar 'gyur ba rtog na gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu gzhan gyis longs spyod par 'gyur la des na ma byas pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i mi 'dod pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one would encounter the result of karma not done.

original: sogs pa zhes bya bas ni gzhan bcings la /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya bas ni gzhan bcings la /
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes the other faults,

original: gzhan grol ba la sogs par 'gyur ba bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan grol ba la sogs par 'gyur ba bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: such as the liberation of one who is not bound.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba'o //🔽de la gzhan dag gi phyogs snga na 'god pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba'o // de la gzhan dag gi phyogs snga na 'god pa ni /
translated: The phrase “for these reasons” and so on concludes the argument.

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, the opponent’s position is stated in the lines beginning with “In response to this, they say . . .”🔽The phrase “Even if the earlier and later moments are different . . .”

original: gal te yang skad cig snga phyi dag gzhan nyid yin mod kyi zhes bya ba ni las kyi byed pa po dang longs spyod pa po skad cig gzhan nyid yin kyang ngo //
analyzed: gal te yang skad cig snga phyi dag gzhan nyid yin mod kyi zhes bya ba ni las kyi byed pa po dang longs spyod pa po skad cig gzhan nyid yin kyang ngo //
translated: refers to the fact that even though the agent of the karma and the experiencer are different,

original: rgyud 'di gcig kho na yin pas zhes bya ba ni skad cig snga phyi dag gcig tu zhen pas so //
analyzed: rgyud 'di gcig kho na yin pas zhes bya ba ni skad cig snga phyi dag gcig tu zhen pas so //
translated: The phrase because this continuum is one alone refers to the attachment to the prior and subsequent moments as being one.

original: kho bo cag la nyes pa 'di med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kho bo cag la nyes pa 'di med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase we do not commit this error refers to the error that was just mentioned.

original: skye 'jig byed po med pas de 'bras med //🔽gzhan gyis bsags la gzhan gyis za bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skye 'jig byed po med pas de 'bras med // gzhan gyis bsags la gzhan gyis za bar 'gyur //
translated: The error is stated in the following: Since there is no agent of origination and destruction, there is no effect.

original: zhes pa'i nyes pa 'di'o //🔽de la ston pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa'i nyes pa 'di'o // de la ston pa ni /
translated: The error is stated in the following: One would enjoy the effects of actions done by another.🔽 The error is stated in the following: One would enjoy the effects of actions done by another.🔽 The teacher states the response to this in the following:

original: brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba @247a * //🔽la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba @247a * // la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: I will respond to this.

original: de nyid du rgyud yod na skyon med na zhes bya ba ni gang du de kho na nyid don dam par rgyud yod par gyur na bstan ma thag pa'i nyes pa med par 'gyur ro //🔽rnam dpyad tshe rgyud nyid la nyes bshad zin //
analyzed: de nyid du rgyud yod na skyon med na zhes bya ba ni gang du de kho na nyid don dam par rgyud yod par gyur na bstan ma thag pa'i nyes pa med par 'gyur ro // rnam dpyad tshe rgyud nyid la nyes bshad zin //
translated: The phrase if the continuum existed in reality means that if the continuum existed in reality, ultimately, then the previously mentioned errors would not occur.

original: zhes bya ba ni sngar rang rgyud la spyod pa'i skabs su byams pa dang nyer sbas zhes bya ba la sogs pas skyon brjod zin pas de'i phyir rgyud mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngar rang rgyud la spyod pa'i skabs su byams pa dang nyer sbas zhes bya ba la sogs pas skyon brjod zin pas de'i phyir rgyud mi rigs pa'o //
translated: The phrase we have already explained the error in the continuum refers to the error that was previously stated in the context of the analysis of the self-same continuum, in the passage beginning If Maitrī and Palaka . . . Therefore, the continuum is not tenable.

original: skyon gar brjod ce na /
analyzed: skyon gar brjod ce na /
translated: What is the fault?

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The answer is:

original: byams pas nyer sbas la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byams pas nyer sbas la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Maitreya and Upagupta are not in one continuum🔽because they are different in terms of their characteristics.

original: byams pas nyer sbas la brten chos rnams ni //
analyzed: byams pas nyer sbas la brten chos rnams ni //
translated: The phenomena that are based on Maitreya and Upagupta

original: gzhan phyir rgyud gcig tu ni rtogs ma yin //🔽rang gi mtshan nyid kyis kyang so sor gang //
analyzed: gzhan phyir rgyud gcig tu ni rtogs ma yin // rang gi mtshan nyid kyis kyang so sor gang //
translated: are not in one continuum because they are different.

original: yod pa de yang rgyud gcig rtogs rigs min //🔽zhes bya ba der ro //🔽gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lha las mi gzhan yin par 'gyur na de'i tshe ci ltar shing nim pa'i rgyud ni shing nim pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yod pa de yang rgyud gcig rtogs rigs min // zhes bya ba der ro // gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lha las mi gzhan yin par 'gyur na de'i tshe ci ltar shing nim pa'i rgyud ni shing nim pa yin gyi /
translated: The phenomena that are based on Maitreya and Upagupta are not in one continuum because they are different.

original: shing aa ma ni rgyud du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du mi dang lha yang rgyud gcig tu rtogs par yang mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: shing aa ma ni rgyud du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du mi dang lha yang rgyud gcig tu rtogs par yang mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If they were different, then just as the continuum of nimba trees is nimba trees and not āmalakī trees, in the same way, humans and gods would not be in one continuum.

original: des na sngar gyi zhig pa'i phyir mi rtag pa kho nar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des na sngar gyi zhig pa'i phyir mi rtag pa kho nar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, because the former is destroyed, it would definitely be impermanent.

original: gal te lha mi las gzhan yin na de'i tshe rgyud gcig tu 'jug pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ba las lha dang mi rgyud gcig tu rtogs pa yin no zhes rgyud gcig tu 'jug pa yang yod pa yin no ;
analyzed: gal te lha mi las gzhan yin na de'i tshe rgyud gcig tu 'jug pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ba las lha dang mi rgyud gcig tu rtogs pa yin no zhes rgyud gcig tu 'jug pa yang yod pa yin no ;
translated: If it were different from the god and the human, then it would not be tenable that it enters into a single continuum.  But it is understood that the god and the human are in a single continuum.

original: / des rgyud med par thal bar 'gyur ba las lha las mi gzhan du 'gyur ba dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / des rgyud med par thal bar 'gyur ba las lha las mi gzhan du 'gyur ba dag ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, there is no fault of the consequence of the absence of a continuum.  The human is not different from the god.

original: gsungs zhes bya ba ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
analyzed: gsungs zhes bya ba ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //
translated: “It is said” means in the Wisdom at the Root of the Middle Way.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary,

original: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Therefore, in that way,” and so on.

original: thal bar 'gyur ba ldog pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba ldog pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “There is also no reversal of the consequence” means

original: skye 'jig byed po med pas de 'bras med //
analyzed: skye 'jig byed po med pas de 'bras med //
translated: that because there is no agent of arising and ceasing, there is no result of that.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: phung po dang sems dag la bdag nyid med pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po dang sems dag la bdag nyid med pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary of the absence of self in the aggregates and the mind,

original: de'i phyir phung po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Therefore, the aggregates,” and so on.

original: phung po dang sems la bdag khas len pa la skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po dang sems la bdag khas len pa la skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Another fault will now be shown in the assertion that the aggregates or the mind are the self.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the passage beginning with “As was explained,”

original: ji skad bshad pa'i nyes par thal bar 'gyur ba las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i nyes par thal bar 'gyur ba las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “As was explained” refers to the faults that were mentioned, such as:

original: gal te phung po bdag na de phyir de //
analyzed: gal te phung po bdag na de phyir de //
translated: If the aggregates were the self,🔽then it follows that🔽the self would be a plurality.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa skyon gang brjod pa der thal bar 'gyur bas so //🔽'di las kyang ste zhes bya ba ni 'chad @247b par 'gyur ba'i skyon las kyang ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa skyon gang brjod pa der thal bar 'gyur bas so // 'di las kyang ste zhes bya ba ni 'chad @247b par 'gyur ba'i skyon las kyang ngo //
translated: “From this” refers to the faults that will be explained.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says:

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “The world” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa med pas lung las 'don pa de'i phyir phung po'am sems bdag yin no zhes bya ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa med pas lung las 'don pa de'i phyir phung po'am sems bdag yin no zhes bya ba mi rigs te /
translated: Since the world does not have an end and so on, it is not tenable to say that the aggregates or the mind is the self.

original: gal te phung po dang sems bdag yin par gyur na de'i tshe de rnams phung po lhag ma med par mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus su chad par 'gyur bas bdag kyang chad pa'i phyir mtha' dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ba las lung dang 'gal ba'i phyir
analyzed: gal te phung po dang sems bdag yin par gyur na de'i tshe de rnams phung po lhag ma med par mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus su chad par 'gyur bas bdag kyang chad pa'i phyir mtha' dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ba las lung dang 'gal ba'i phyir
translated: But because that contradicts the scriptures,

original: mtha' dang ldan par 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mtha' dang ldan par 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: it is not asserted that the self has an end.

original: des na phung po'am sems ni bdag ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na phung po'am sems ni bdag ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the aggregates or the mind are not the self.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that,

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Because of that . . .” and so forth.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan pa dang / 'jig rten mtha' dang mi ldan pa dang / mtha' dang ldan kyang ldan la mi ldan kyang mi ldan pa dang / mtha' dang ldan pa yang ma yin mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba bzhi dang /
