analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan pa dang / 'jig rten mtha' dang mi ldan pa dang / mtha' dang ldan kyang ldan la mi ldan kyang mi ldan pa dang / mtha' dang ldan pa yang ma yin mtha' dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba bzhi dang /
translated: The fourteen indeterminate things are the four assertions that the world is finite, the world is infinite, the world is both finite and infinite, and the world is neither finite nor infinite,🔽the four assertions that the world is permanent, the world is impermanent, the world is both permanent and impermanent, and the world is neither permanent nor impermanent,

original: 'jig rten rtag go zhes bya ba dang / 'jig rten mi rtag go zhes bya ba dang / rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag go zhes bya ba dang / rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba bzhi dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten rtag go zhes bya ba dang / 'jig rten mi rtag go zhes bya ba dang / rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag go zhes bya ba dang / rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba bzhi dang /
translated: and the four assertions that the Tathagata exists after death, the Tathagata does not exist after death, the Tathagata both exists and does not exist after death, and the Tathagata neither exists nor does not exist after death.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas med pa dang / yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa dang / yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa bzhi dang / srog de lus yin srog kyang gzhan lus kyang gzhan zhes bya ba gnyis yin pas de ltar na bcu bzhi'o//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas med pa dang / yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa dang / yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa bzhi dang / srog de lus yin srog kyang gzhan lus kyang gzhan zhes bya ba gnyis yin pas de ltar na bcu bzhi'o//
translated: The two are: life is the body and life is one thing and the body is another.

original: 'di rnams lung bstan par bya ba ma yin pas na lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams lung bstan par bya ba ma yin pas na lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called undeclared things because they are not declared.

original: sde pa thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni thams cad yod par smra ba dang / phal chen la sogs pa'i sde pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: sde pa thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni thams cad yod par smra ba dang / phal chen la sogs pa'i sde pa rnams kyis so //
translated: All schools means the Sarvastivadins and the Mahasamghika schools and so on.

original: de ltar bkag pa dang zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bkag pas so ;
analyzed: de ltar bkag pa dang zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bkag pas so ;
translated: The negation of these means the negation of permanence and so on.

original: / lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bstan pa de lung gzhan gyi sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bstan pa de lung gzhan gyi sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the undeclared things by means of another scripture, he says:

original: dge slong zhig gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong zhig gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: A monk, if he should say, “I have seen a visible form with the eye” and so on.

original: de ltar lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi par yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan no zhes bya ba @248a * //
analyzed: de ltar lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi par yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan no zhes bya ba @248a * //
translated: Thus, it should be said that the fourteen indeterminate things are also to be expelled.

original: nas bzung nas srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan no zhes bya ba'i bar gyi lta ba can la yang bskrad pa'i las bya'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nas bzung nas srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan no zhes bya ba'i bar gyi lta ba can la yang bskrad pa'i las bya'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: That is, it should be said that the action of expulsion is to be performed for one who holds the view that the world is finite and so on, up to the view that the life principle is one thing and the body another.🔽If the aggregates are taken as the referent of the word “world,”

original: 'jig rten gyi sgras phung po rnams 'dzin na zhes bya ba ni bdag dang phung po dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir phung po kho na 'jig rten gyi sgra brjod na de'i tshe 'jig rten mi rtag go zhes bya ba yang lung du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi sgras phung po rnams 'dzin na zhes bya ba ni bdag dang phung po dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir phung po kho na 'jig rten gyi sgra brjod na de'i tshe 'jig rten mi rtag go zhes bya ba yang lung du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: then the word “world” refers only to the aggregates because the self and the aggregates are not different. In that case, the statement “The world is impermanent” would be a scriptural reference.

original: gang gi phyir skyes ba mi 'jig pa la ni rtag pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes ba mi 'jig pa la ni rtag pa zhes bya la /
translated: Because that which is born and does not perish is called “permanent.”

original: phung po rnams skad cig so so la 'jig pas bdag kyang 'jig par 'gyur bas ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid du lung du ma bstan pa nyid du 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phung po rnams skad cig so so la 'jig pas bdag kyang 'jig par 'gyur bas ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid du lung du ma bstan pa nyid du 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Since the aggregates disintegrate moment by moment, the self would also disintegrate. Therefore, how could it be indeterminate with respect to impermanence?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og rol du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phung po lhag ma med par mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyis kyi dus su phung po rnams lhag ma ma lus par log pas bdag kyang log pa'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan pa
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og rol du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phung po lhag ma med par mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyis kyi dus su phung po rnams lhag ma ma lus par log pas bdag kyang log pa'i phyir 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan pa
translated: With respect to “after nirvana,” and so on, after the nirvana without remainder of the aggregates, since the aggregates are completely stopped, the self would also stop. Therefore, the world would have an end.

original: yin no zhes ji ltar lung du ma bstan par zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yin no zhes ji ltar lung du ma bstan par zhes pa'o //
translated: How could it be indeterminate?

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa la yang grongs pa'i phyis phung po mi mnga' bas de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar lung du ma bstan par 'gyur zhes pa'o //🔽de la mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa la yang grongs pa'i phyis phung po mi mnga' bas de bzhin gshegs pa grongs nas yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar lung du ma bstan par 'gyur zhes pa'o // de la mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, since the Tathāgata does not have aggregates after his death, it would be indeterminate to say that the Tathāgata exists after his death or that he does not exist after his death.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To present the summary of that, he says, “Therefore,” and so on.

original: phung po bdag nyid du khas len na ni 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po bdag nyid du khas len na ni 'jig rten mtha' dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: If one accepts the aggregates as the self, then the world would have an end.

original: skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach another fault,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Moreover,” and so on.

original: khyod kyi phyogs kyi rnal 'byor pas bdag med par mthong ba'i tshe dngos po med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyod kyi phyogs kyi rnal 'byor pas bdag med par mthong ba'i tshe dngos po med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: When your yogi sees selflessness, it follows that he would see non-entity.

original: phung po dang bdag tha mi dad pas bdag med par mthong ba'i dus su phung po med par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: phung po dang bdag tha mi dad pas bdag med par mthong ba'i dus su phung po med par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because the aggregates and the self are not different, when he sees selflessness, the aggregates would not exist.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa sungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa sungs te /
translated: he says, “If you say,” and so on.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The so-called truth of suffering has the character of the five aggregates.

original: de ltar ni 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not asserted,

original: phung po med par mthong ba bdag med par mthong ba ma yin gyi ;
analyzed: phung po med par mthong ba bdag med par mthong ba ma yin gyi ;
translated: because seeing the nonexistence of the aggregates is not seeing selflessness.

original: 'on kyang phung po las tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag gis stong pa nyid mthong ba ni bdag med par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang phung po las tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag gis stong pa nyid mthong ba ni bdag med par mthong ba'o //
translated: But the seeing of emptiness of a self that is different from the aggregates is the seeing of selflessness.

original: de la gzhan gyi phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
translated: Here, the opponent’s former position is set forth:🔽“If, at the time of the connection between action and effect,🔽the word ‘self’ is applied,

original: ci ste gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ste gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: because self and other are not possible,🔽it is applied to the aggregates alone.”

original: las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa'i dus su zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe las dang 'bras bu dag 'brel @248b pa'i dus gang gi tshe'o //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa'i dus su zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe las dang 'bras bu dag 'brel @248b pa'i dus gang gi tshe'o //
translated: If, at the time of the connection between action and effect, the word “self” is applied,

original: bdag gi sgra sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni dper na las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba ni bdag gi yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi sgra sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni dper na las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba ni bdag gi yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dir ro //
translated: the connection between action and effect would be that of the self, just as it is said, “This is mine.”

original: bdag gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because self and other are not possible,🔽it is applied to the aggregates alone.

original: phung po rnams kho na la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la bdag gi sgra zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: phung po rnams kho na la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la bdag gi sgra zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the word “self” is to be connected with this.

original: 'dis ni phung po rnams kho na la bdag yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni phung po rnams kho na la bdag yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the aggregates alone are the self.

original: gang gi tshe bdag med par mthong ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas phung po bdag med pa'i rnam pas mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag med par mthong ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas phung po bdag med pa'i rnam pas mthong ba'o //
translated: When one sees selflessness, when the yogin sees the aggregates as selfless.

original: gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa nang gi kun du byed pa'i skyes bu nyid la 'jug ste zhes bya ba ni gzhan mu stegs pas kun du brtags pa'i lus kyi nang na bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa longs spyod par byed pa'i rang bzhin can gyi
analyzed: gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa nang gi kun du byed pa'i skyes bu nyid la 'jug ste zhes bya ba ni gzhan mu stegs pas kun du brtags pa'i lus kyi nang na bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa longs spyod par byed pa'i rang bzhin can gyi
translated: One enters into the person imagined by others as the inner agent, that is, the person imagined by other tīrthikas as the nature of the experiencer of pleasure and pain, etc.,

original: skyes bu gang phung po las tha dad du gyur pa de la bdag ces bya ba'i sgra 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu gang phung po las tha dad du gyur pa de la bdag ces bya ba'i sgra 'jug pa'o //
translated: which is different from the aggregates. That is called the self.

original: des na bdag med par mthong ba'i dus su phung po med par mthong bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na bdag med par mthong ba'i dus su phung po med par mthong bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when one sees selflessness, one does not see the aggregates as nonexistent.

original: de nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reply to that, he says,

original: brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “It should be said…”

original: rtag bdag spong na de yi tshe //
analyzed: rtag bdag spong na de yi tshe //
translated: “When the permanent self is abandoned…”

original: zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe ste /
translated: means “at that time.”

original: phung po rnams bdag med pa'i rnam pas mthong ba'i dus su gal te phung po las tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag rtag pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bdag spong bar 'gyur na de'i phyir sems sam phung po ni bdag tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams bdag med pa'i rnam pas mthong ba'i dus su gal te phung po las tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag rtag pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bdag spong bar 'gyur na de'i phyir sems sam phung po ni bdag tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: At the time of seeing the aggregates as selfless, if the self is abandoned, saying “The permanent self that is different from the aggregates does not exist,” then the mind or the aggregates would not be the self.

original: des na phung po rnams bdag yin no zhes gang khas blangs pa de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na phung po rnams bdag yin no zhes gang khas blangs pa de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it would contradict the assertion that the aggregates are the self.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that with the commentary, he says,

original: gal te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “If, on the other hand…”

original: bdag gi sgras zhes bya ba ni bdag med par zhes bya ba 'dir gang dgag par bya ba'i bdag gi sgra des so //
analyzed: bdag gi sgras zhes bya ba ni bdag med par zhes bya ba 'dir gang dgag par bya ba'i bdag gi sgra des so //
translated: “By the word ‘self’ ” means by the word “self” that is the object of negation in “selflessness.”

original: phyogs nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phung po'am sems bdag yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs gang yin pa de nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phung po'am sems bdag yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs gang yin pa de nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “The position is undermined” means that the position that the aggregates or mind is the self is undermined.

original: de la gzhan gyi phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni /
translated: Here, the opponent sets forth the former position:

original: ci ste rnam pa de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ste rnam pa de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “If it is said that the yogi does not assert the self in that way, etc.”

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i yul la zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas phung po bdag med pa'i rnam pas mthong ba'i gnas la'o //🔽'di 'jug par mi 'dod de zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sgra 'di phung po la 'jug @249a * //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i yul la zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas phung po bdag med pa'i rnam pas mthong ba'i gnas la'o // 'di 'jug par mi 'dod de zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sgra 'di phung po la 'jug @249a * //
translated: “In that way” means that when the yogi sees the aggregates through the aspect of selflessness, he does not assert the self in that way.

original: par mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: par mi 'dod kyi /
translated: “He does not assert the self in that way” means that he does not assert the term self to refer to the aggregates.

original: 'on kyang gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i bdag la'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i bdag la'o //
translated: “But he does assert the self imagined by others.”

original: de'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba ni phyogs nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i skyon gang brjod pa de skyon du mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba ni phyogs nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i skyon gang brjod pa de skyon du mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Therefore there is no fault” means that the fault stated, that the position is undermined, is not a fault.

original: 'di'i don ni gal te rnam pa thams cad du tha dad du 'gyur ba'i bdag la bdag gi sgra 'jug par 'dod na de'i tshe phung po 'am sems ni bdag go zhes gang brjod pa de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba las 'on kyang bdag med par mthong ba'i
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gal te rnam pa thams cad du tha dad du 'gyur ba'i bdag la bdag gi sgra 'jug par 'dod na de'i tshe phung po 'am sems ni bdag go zhes gang brjod pa de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba las 'on kyang bdag med par mthong ba'i
translated: However, in the context of seeing selflessness,

original: skabs su bdag gi sgras gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i bdag brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: skabs su bdag gi sgras gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i bdag brjod pa yin la /
translated: the term “self” refers to the self imputed by others.

original: gzhan du ni phung po 'am sems yin pas ci ltar 'gal bar 'gyur te ;
analyzed: gzhan du ni phung po 'am sems yin pas ci ltar 'gal bar 'gyur te ;
translated: In other contexts, it refers to the aggregates or the mind. So how could there be a contradiction?

original: de dag kyang bdag med du khas blangs pas so zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang bdag med du khas blangs pas so zhe na /
translated: Since you accept that those are selfless, there is no contradiction.”

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the response to that,🔽Nāgārjuna explains:

original: 'di yang yod pa ma yin te //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di yang yod pa ma yin te // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: This also does not exist.

original: 'dod dgur spyod pa zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu phung po las tha dad pa rtag pa'i bdag la bdag gi sgras brjod la /
analyzed: 'dod dgur spyod pa zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu phung po las tha dad pa rtag pa'i bdag la bdag gi sgras brjod la /
translated: “ Enjoying as they wish” means that in some contexts the term “self” refers to a permanent self that is different from the aggregates.

original: 'ga' zhig tu phung po'am sems la bdag gi sgras brjod pa yin no zhes rang dgar spyod pa ci ltar thob ces pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu phung po'am sems la bdag gi sgras brjod pa yin no zhes rang dgar spyod pa ci ltar thob ces pa'o //
translated: In some places, the word self refers to the aggregates or the mind. How can you arbitrarily decide?

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni bdag med par mthong ba'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni bdag med par mthong ba'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Here, this refers to the stage of seeing selflessness.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa /
translated: The other party says:

original: mi srid pa'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mi srid pa'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: If you say, Because it is impossible,

original: 'dir gal te bdag med par mthong ba'i gnas skabs su bdag med pa'i sgra phung po la 'jug pa yin na de'i tshe bdag med par mthong ba'i dus su phung po med par mthong bar 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: 'dir gal te bdag med par mthong ba'i gnas skabs su bdag med pa'i sgra phung po la 'jug pa yin na de'i tshe bdag med par mthong ba'i dus su phung po med par mthong bar 'gyur ba las /
translated: here, if in the stage of seeing selflessness, the word selflessness refers to the aggregates, then at the time of seeing selflessness, the aggregates would be seen as nonexistent.

original: phung po med par mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po med par mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: But the aggregates are not seen as nonexistent.

original: des na gnas skabs 'dir phung po la bdag gi sgra 'jug pa srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gnas skabs 'dir phung po la bdag gi sgra 'jug pa srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this stage, it is impossible for the word self to refer to the aggregates.

original: des na nang gi byed pa'i rang bzhin can gyi skyes bu nyid brjod pa yin no zhe na'o ;
analyzed: des na nang gi byed pa'i rang bzhin can gyi skyes bu nyid brjod pa yin no zhe na'o ;
translated: Therefore, it expresses the person who has the nature of an inner agent.

original: / de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To explain the answer to that,

original: phung po rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phung po rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse that begins, “The self is not the aggregates, etc.”

original: 'di 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sgras 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sgras 'jug pa'o //
translated: Here, “the self is not the aggregates” means that the term “self” does not apply to the aggregates.

original: srid pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni /🔽gal te phung po bdag na de phyir te //
analyzed: srid pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni / gal te phung po bdag na de phyir te //
translated: “ It has already been shown that existence is not possible” means that it has already been shown that the term “self” does not apply to the aggregates.

original: mang bas bdag de dag kyang mang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mang bas bdag de dag kyang mang bar 'gyur //
translated: As it has been said, “If the self were the aggregates, then because the aggregates are many, the self would be many.”🔽The verse that begins, “Therefore, the self is not the aggregates,” etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas phung po rnams la bdag gi sgra 'jug pa srid pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin pa'o //🔽mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas phung po rnams la bdag gi sgra 'jug pa srid pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin pa'o // mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The verse that begins, “Therefore, the self is not different from the aggregates,” etc.🔽The verse that begins, “Therefore, the self is not the support of the aggregates,” etc.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽gzhan du yang mi 'dod par bya dgos so zhes bya ba ni las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / gzhan du yang mi 'dod par bya dgos so zhes bya ba ni las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa'i dus su'o //
translated: The verse that begins, “Therefore, the self does not possess the aggregates,” etc.🔽The verse that begins, “Therefore, the self is not the appropriator of the aggregates,” etc.

original: ci ste gzhan @249b du zhes bya ba ni sngar bzhin du'o //🔽de 'dir yang 'dod par bya dgos so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan @249b du zhes bya ba ni sngar bzhin du'o // de 'dir yang 'dod par bya dgos so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The verse that begins, “Therefore, the self is not the appropriator of the aggregates,” etc.🔽The verse that begins, “Therefore, the self is not the appropriator of the aggregates,” etc.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa'i zhes bya ba 'dir yang ngo //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa'i zhes bya ba 'dir yang ngo //
translated: The verse that begins, “Therefore, the self is not the appropriator of the aggregates,” etc.

original: skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir / gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach another fault,🔽he says, “Moreover, if the yogi sees the self as different from the aggregates, he would not understand the reality of the aggregates.”

original: khyod kyi phyogs kyi rnal 'byor pas phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag med pa mthong na phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag med par yongs su shes pas gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams kyi de kho na nyid rtogs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: khyod kyi phyogs kyi rnal 'byor pas phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag med pa mthong na phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag med par yongs su shes pas gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams kyi de kho na nyid rtogs par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If the yogi of your system sees the self as different from the aggregates, he would not understand the reality of the aggregates, because he would understand the self as different from the aggregates.

original: des na de'i ngo bo rtogs med phyir te /
analyzed: des na de'i ngo bo rtogs med phyir te /
translated: Therefore, because he would not understand its nature,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma rtogs pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma rtogs pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: attachment and so on would arise, because he would not understand the nature of the aggregates such as form.

original: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa bdag la dmigs nas 'jug pa'i phyir skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa bdag la dmigs nas 'jug pa'i phyir skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if attachment and so on do not arise because they engage the self as their object,

original: lan ni gzugs la dmigs nas 'jug phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: lan ni gzugs la dmigs nas 'jug phyir zhes smos so //
translated: the response is, “Because they engage form and so on.”

original: de dpe'i sgo nas 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dpe'i sgo nas 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that by way of an example,

original: ze 'bru la sogs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ze 'bru la sogs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, “For example, if one sees a bee and so on.”

original: de tsam gyis ni zhes bya ba ni khu byug yod ces brjod pa tsam gyis so //🔽de'i zhes bya ba ni ze 'bru'i'o //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni zhes bya ba ni khu byug yod ces brjod pa tsam gyis so // de'i zhes bya ba ni ze 'bru'i'o //
translated: Just that much means just by the statement the cuckoo exists.🔽Its means the stamen's.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni ze 'bru la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni ze 'bru la'o //
translated: On that means on the stamen.

original: der rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni ze 'bru'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: der rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni ze 'bru'i dgos pa'o //
translated: The realization of that means the purpose of the stamen.

original: de ltar dper bstan nas don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar dper bstan nas don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the example in that way, in order to teach the meaning, he says:

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In the same way, here too, etc.

original: de'i rang bzhin yongs su ma shes pas zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su ma shes pas so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yongs su ma shes pas zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su ma shes pas so //
translated: Not fully understanding its nature means not fully understanding the nature of form, etc.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa la'o //
translated: On that means on the yogi.

original: 'dir khu byug dang mtshungs pa ni bdag med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir khu byug dang mtshungs pa ni bdag med pa yin te /
translated: Here, the absence of self is similar to the cuckoo.

original: ci ltar khu byug yod pa yongs su shes kyang ze 'bru'i mngar ba nyid mi rtogs pa de bzhin du bdag med pa yongs su shes kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo ma dmigs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar khu byug yod pa yongs su shes kyang ze 'bru'i mngar ba nyid mi rtogs pa de bzhin du bdag med pa yongs su shes kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo ma dmigs pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Just as the sweetness of the stamen is not realized even though the existence of the cuckoo is known, in the same way, even though the absence of self is fully understood, the nature of form, etc. is not observed.

original: yang na gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa spong na yang zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa spong yang ngo //
analyzed: yang na gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa spong na yang zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa spong yang ngo //
translated: Or else, “if one abandons the attachment, etc. to that, i.e., to the form, etc.,” means that one abandons the attachment, etc. to the form, etc. which are the objects.

original: bdag gi dngos po med pa la ci zhig 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni des cung zad kyang byas pa ma yin te /🔽gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pas 'dod chags la sogs pa spong zhing bdag med pa yongs @250a * //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po med pa la ci zhig 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni des cung zad kyang byas pa ma yin te / gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pas 'dod chags la sogs pa spong zhing bdag med pa yongs @250a * //
translated: What would happen if there were no self? Nothing would happen, because the self does nothing.🔽The attachment, etc. to form, etc. is abandoned by the full understanding of the nature of form, etc.

original: su shes pas gzugs la sogs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa yongs su mi spong bas so //
analyzed: su shes pas gzugs la sogs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa yongs su mi spong bas so //
translated: The attachment, etc. to form, etc. is not abandoned by the full understanding of selflessness.

original: 'dir yang khu byug med ces pa ni bdag med pa dang mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang khu byug med ces pa ni bdag med pa dang mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: Here, “the cuckoo is not” is similar to “selflessness.”

original: ci ltar khu byug med par yongs su shes kyang ze 'bru'i mngar ba nyid dmigs pa dang mngar ba'i yul can gyi mngon par zhen pa ldog par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: ci ltar khu byug med par yongs su shes kyang ze 'bru'i mngar ba nyid dmigs pa dang mngar ba'i yul can gyi mngon par zhen pa ldog par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Just as, even though one understands that there is no cuckoo, one does not stop perceiving the sweetness of the honey, nor does one stop the attachment to sweetness as an object.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang bdag med pa yongs su shes kyang gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i yul can gyi mngon par zhen pa mi ldog pas 'dod chags la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba kho na yin no ;
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang bdag med pa yongs su shes kyang gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i yul can gyi mngon par zhen pa mi ldog pas 'dod chags la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba kho na yin no ;
translated: Likewise, here, even though one understands selflessness, since one does not turn back the manifest clinging to objects such as form, attachment and so on will arise, because one observes form and so on.🔽What is the point of making the non-existence of the self?🔽In order to explain this in detail, he says:

original: / bdag gi dngos po med pa la ci zhig byas par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'dis rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / bdag gi dngos po med pa la ci zhig byas par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'dis rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: By what means,

original: gang gis na zhes bya ba ni yul bden pa dang yongs su dor bas so //🔽de med pas yongs su shes pa las zhes bya ba ni nang gi byed pa'i rang bzhin can gyi skyes bu med par shes pa las so //
analyzed: gang gis na zhes bya ba ni yul bden pa dang yongs su dor bas so // de med pas yongs su shes pa las zhes bya ba ni nang gi byed pa'i rang bzhin can gyi skyes bu med par shes pa las so //
translated: by what means,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: Therefore, etc.🔽🔽is the summary.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa 'dod chags la sogs pa spong ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags spong ba'i rgyur gyur pa gang zag la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pa de med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa 'dod chags la sogs pa spong ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags spong ba'i rgyur gyur pa gang zag la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pa de med pa'i phyir te /
translated: That is to say, because there is no complete understanding of the intrinsic reality of the person and so on that would serve as the cause for the abandonment of attachment.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo yongs su shes pa spong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo yongs su shes pa spong ba yin gyi /
translated: Attachment and so on that take form and so on as their objects are abandoned through the complete understanding of the intrinsic reality of form and so on.

original: bdag med pa yongs su shes pa ni ma yin te zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa yongs su shes pa ni ma yin te zhes pa'o //
translated: They are not abandoned through the complete understanding of selflessness.

original: de la dpe ston pa ni /🔽phyi rol pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni gsungs te /
analyzed: de la dpe ston pa ni / phyi rol pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni gsungs te /
translated: To illustrate this, he says:🔽Like non-Buddhists.

original: ci ltar 'dis sangs rgyas pa las phyi rol pa la gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pa med pas 'dod chags la sogs pa spong bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ci ltar 'dis sangs rgyas pa las phyi rol pa la gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pa med pas 'dod chags la sogs pa spong bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as non-Buddhists do not abandon attachment and so on because they do not completely understand the intrinsic reality of form and so on, so it is.

original: de la gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To anticipate another’s doubt, he says:

original: ci ste kho bo cag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ste kho bo cag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “But if we say ‘we’ and so on.”🔽

original: lung tshad mar byed pa la zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag gi lung tshad mar khas len pa'o //
analyzed: lung tshad mar byed pa la zhes bya ba ni kho bo cag gi lung tshad mar khas len pa'o //
translated: “Accepting scripture as valid” means accepting our scripture as valid.

original: rtog ge pa'i tshad mas gnod pa ma yin la zhes bya ba ni rtog ge'i bstan bcos @250b las tshad ma gang brjod pa des gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog ge pa'i tshad mas gnod pa ma yin la zhes bya ba ni rtog ge'i bstan bcos @250b las tshad ma gang brjod pa des gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: “Not undermined by the valid cognition of logicians” means not undermined by whatever valid cognition is expressed in the treatises of logic.

original: kho bo cag gis lung gsungs pa kho na tshad mar 'dod pas so //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis lung gsungs pa kho na tshad mar 'dod pas so //
translated: Because we assert only the scripture that we state to be valid.

original: des na ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lung gis phung po rnams kho na bdag yin no zhes khas blang bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lung gis phung po rnams kho na bdag yin no zhes khas blang bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, by the scripture beginning with “thus,” one should accept that the aggregates alone are the self.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says,

original: lung gis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lung gis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Even by scripture” and so on.

original: de bzhin du 'dir zhes bya ba ni phung po bdag tu khas len pa'i gnas skabs na yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir zhes bya ba ni phung po bdag tu khas len pa'i gnas skabs na yang ngo //
translated: “Likewise here” means even in the context of accepting the aggregates as the self.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the response to that, he says,🔽“The aggregates are not the self” and so on.

original: gang phyir ston pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang phyir ston pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The response to that is stated in the passage beginning with “Because the Teacher said…”🔽Since the Teacher said that the aggregates are the self, therefore you assert that the aggregates alone are the self.

original: gang gi phyir ston pas phung po rnams bdag yin no zhes gsungs pa de'i phyir khyod kyis phung po rnams kho na bdag yin par 'dod na zhes phyogs snga ma rjes su brjod nas lan 'debs pa ni /🔽de'i phung po las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ston pas phung po rnams bdag yin no zhes gsungs pa de'i phyir khyod kyis phung po rnams kho na bdag yin par 'dod na zhes phyogs snga ma rjes su brjod nas lan 'debs pa ni / de'i phung po las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The response to that is stated in the passage beginning with “The aggregates are not the self.”

original: dge slong dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'i lung gis phung po rnams bdag nyid du bstan pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dge slong dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'i lung gis phung po rnams bdag nyid du bstan pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The passage beginning with “Monks…” does not teach that the aggregates are the self.

original: 'on kyang phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag 'gog pa ston pa ni 'di ltar de dag ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag kho na la yang dag par rjes su blta'o zhes gsungs pas phung po rnam pa lnga las tha dad du gyur
analyzed: 'on kyang phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag 'gog pa ston pa ni 'di ltar de dag ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag kho na la yang dag par rjes su blta'o zhes gsungs pas phung po rnam pa lnga las tha dad du gyur
translated: Rather, it teaches the refutation of a self that is different from the aggregates. It says, “Monks, those who see me through the perishable aggregates, who hear me through the perishable aggregates, and who think of me through the perishable aggregates, they are seeing me, they are hearing me, they are thinking of me.”

original: pa'i bdag de dag gis mthong ba ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i bdag de dag gis mthong ba ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It says that the self that is different from the five aggregates is not seen by them.

original: des na phung po rnam pa lnga las tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag dgag pa kho na lung gi don yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: des na phung po rnam pa lnga las tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag dgag pa kho na lung gi don yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the scriptures is the refutation of a self that is different from the five aggregates.

original: gal te lung gi don phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag 'gog pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te lung gi don phung po las tha dad pa'i bdag 'gog pa yin la /
translated: If the meaning of the scriptures is the refutation of a self that is different from the aggregates,

original: phung po rnams bdag nyid du bstan pa ma yin no zhes pa de gang las rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: phung po rnams bdag nyid du bstan pa ma yin no zhes pa de gang las rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: from what can it be understood that the aggregates are not taught to be the self?

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the answer to that,

original: gzugs bdag min sogs mdo gzhan gsungs phyir ro //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs bdag min sogs mdo gzhan gsungs phyir ro // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Because another sutra says, ‘Form is not the self, etc.’ ”

original: gang gi phyir mdo gzhan las gzugs ni bdag ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas phung po rnams las bdag nyid bkag pas de'i phyir phung po las tha dad du 'gyur ba'i bdag kho na lung gi don yin no zhes khong du chud pa yin no
analyzed: gang gi phyir mdo gzhan las gzugs ni bdag ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas phung po rnams las bdag nyid bkag pas de'i phyir phung po las tha dad du 'gyur ba'i bdag kho na lung gi don yin no zhes khong du chud pa yin no
translated: Because another sutra says, “Form is not the self,” etc., the self is refuted as being different from the aggregates. Therefore, it should be understood that the meaning of the scriptures is the self that is different from the aggregates.

original: // de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the commentary on that,

original: mdo 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “This sutra says, etc.”

original: yid ches par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni nges par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yid ches par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni nges par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “One becomes confident” means one becomes certain.

original: dgos pa la dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: dgos pa la dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the purpose of the purpose?

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The answer is:

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la ltos nas zhes bya ba @251a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa la ltos nas zhes bya ba @251a * //
translated: In dependence on the conventional truth.

original: gsungs te / ci ltar mu stegs pa rnams kyis bdag phung po las tha dad du 'gyur ba dang / rtag pa la sogs pa'i yon tan ldan pas kun tu brtags pa de kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gsungs te / ci ltar mu stegs pa rnams kyis bdag phung po las tha dad du 'gyur ba dang / rtag pa la sogs pa'i yon tan ldan pas kun tu brtags pa de kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not the case that the self imagined by the tīrthikas, which is different from the aggregates and possesses the qualities of permanence and so on, exists even conventionally.🔽In order to clarify the conventional truth without error.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa phyin ci ma log par gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin pa'i bdag la sogs pa yongs su ma btags pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i phyin ci ma log par gsal bar 'gyur
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa phyin ci ma log par gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin pa'i bdag la sogs pa yongs su ma btags pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i phyin ci ma log par gsal bar 'gyur
translated: By not superimposing the self and so on, which do not exist even conventionally, one clarifies the conventional truth without error.

original: ba'o // de 'di ltar gang las nges she na zhes bya ba ni dge slong dag dge sbyong ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lung 'di phung po las tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag 'gog pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: ba'o // de 'di ltar gang las nges she na zhes bya ba ni dge slong dag dge sbyong ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lung 'di phung po las tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag 'gog pa kho na yin la /
translated: The statement “Monks, the self is the dharma of the aggregates” is a refutation of a self that is different from the aggregates.

original: phung po rnams la bdag nyid du ston par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang las nges she na'o //
analyzed: phung po rnams la bdag nyid du ston par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang las nges she na'o //
translated: It does not teach that the aggregates themselves are the self.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the answer to that,

original: mdo gzhan las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo gzhan las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the root text says, “In another sūtra,” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir mdo gzhan las gzugs la sogs pa rnams bdag nyid yin pa bkag pa de'i phyir dge slong dag ces bya ba la sogs pa der phung po rnams kho na bdag yin no zhes mdo'i bzhed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mdo gzhan las gzugs la sogs pa rnams bdag nyid yin pa bkag pa de'i phyir dge slong dag ces bya ba la sogs pa der phung po rnams kho na bdag yin no zhes mdo'i bzhed pa ma yin no //
translated: Because in another sūtra it is said that form and so on are not the self, therefore the statement “Monks, the self is the dharma of the aggregates” does not represent the view of the sūtra that the aggregates themselves are the self.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the root text says, “Therefore,” and so on.

original: gang phyir gzugs tshor bdag ma yin ;
analyzed: gang phyir gzugs tshor bdag ma yin ;
translated: Form and feeling are not the self.

original: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dgongs pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dgongs pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the intention of such statements,

original: gang las gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang las gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Even form and so on are not real,” and so on.

original: brten nas gdags pa'i bdag ces bya ba ni phung po la brten nas tha snyad btags pa'i bdag go //🔽phung po'i nye bar len pa can ;
analyzed: brten nas gdags pa'i bdag ces bya ba ni phung po la brten nas tha snyad btags pa'i bdag go // phung po'i nye bar len pa can ;
translated: The self that is designated in dependence means the self that is designated in dependence on the aggregates.🔽The appropriator of the aggregates

original: / zhes bya ba ni phung po nye bar len pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni phung po nye bar len pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: means that which has the appropriation of the aggregates.

original: gang phung po la brten nas tha snyad btags pa'i bdag de yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang phung po la brten nas tha snyad btags pa'i bdag de yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the self that is designated in dependence on the aggregates does not exist.

original: gal te kun rdzob tu tha snyad du gdags par bya ba bdag yod pa yin pas ci ltar 'gegs par byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob tu tha snyad du gdags par bya ba bdag yod pa yin pas ci ltar 'gegs par byed ce na /
translated: If the self exists conventionally, as a designation, how can it be refuted?

original: lan ni de kho na nyid sems pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lan ni de kho na nyid sems pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The answer is that this is because this is the context of reflecting on reality.

original: don dam pa la spyod pa'i gnas skabs yin pas brten nas gdags par bya ba'i bdag kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya'o //🔽bdag bkag pa'i dgos pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam pa la spyod pa'i gnas skabs yin pas brten nas gdags par bya ba'i bdag kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya'o // bdag bkag pa'i dgos pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Since it is the occasion of engaging in the ultimate, the self that is to be dependently designated does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba gsungs @251b te ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba gsungs @251b te ;
translated: In order to demonstrate the purpose of the refutation of the self, he says:🔽Because the appropriator is not observed, its appropriation also does not exist.

original: nye bar len pa po mi dmigs na zhes bya ba ni phung po nye bar len par byed pa'i bdag ma dmigs pas so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po mi dmigs na zhes bya ba ni phung po nye bar len par byed pa'i bdag ma dmigs pas so //
translated: Since the self that appropriates the aggregates is not observed,

original: de'i nye bar len pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa la ltos nas nye bar len pa'i rnam gzhag byed pa yin pas nye bar len pa po med na nye bar len pa yang med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i nye bar len pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa la ltos nas nye bar len pa'i rnam gzhag byed pa yin pas nye bar len pa po med na nye bar len pa yang med pa'o //
translated: its appropriation also does not exist. Since the presentation of appropriation is made in dependence on the appropriator, if the appropriator does not exist, appropriation also does not exist.

original: des na phung po la sogs pa med pas kho bo'i mngon par zhen pa ni dngos po dang bral ba yin pas phung po la sogs pa'i yul can gyi 'dod chags sogs pa rnams log par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des na phung po la sogs pa med pas kho bo'i mngon par zhen pa ni dngos po dang bral ba yin pas phung po la sogs pa'i yul can gyi 'dod chags sogs pa rnams log par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, since the aggregates and so on do not exist, my clinging is free from things. Thus attachment and so on that have as their object the aggregates and so on will cease.

original: des na brten nas gdags pa'i bdag bkag pa'i dgos pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: des na brten nas gdags pa'i bdag bkag pa'i dgos pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i don du'o //
translated: Therefore, the purpose of refuting the self that is dependently designated is in order to become free from attachment to form and so on.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary, he says

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “because” and so on.

original: mdo gzhan las de skad du gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdo gzhan las de skad du gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In that way it is stated in another sūtra” means

original: gang gi phyir gzugs bdag min zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs bdag min zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “because form is not the self” and so on.

original: sngar gyi zhes bya ba ni dge slong dag dge sbyong ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi zhes bya ba ni dge slong dag dge sbyong ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Previously” refers to the statement “Monks, regarding the one who says ‘the ascetic or brahmin’ ” and so on.

original: skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach another fault, he says

original: gzhan yang mdo sde zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo sde zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Moreover, in the sūtra” and so on.

original: mdo sde bstan pa 'di ni zhes bya ba 'di ni dge slong dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde bstan pa 'di ni zhes bya ba 'di ni dge slong dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “This teaching of the sūtra” refers to “Monks, regarding the one who says ‘the ascetic or brahmin’ ” and so on.

original: sgrub pa'i tshul du nges kyang zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams bdag nyid du bstan pas sgrub pa'i tshul du nges kyang ngo //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i tshul du nges kyang zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams bdag nyid du bstan pas sgrub pa'i tshul du nges kyang ngo //
translated: Even though it is ascertained in the manner of proof, it is not possible to teach it.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ston par mi nus pa ci'i phyir zhe na'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ston par mi nus pa ci'i phyir zhe na'o //
translated: Why? means why is it not possible to teach?

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the answer to that,🔽he says,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Because of the expression 'the aggregates are the self,' and so on.

original: phung po rnams bdag nyid ces pa brjod pas na phung po mang po tshogs pa bdag tu 'gyur gyi phung po re re ni bdag gi rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po rnams bdag nyid ces pa brjod pas na phung po mang po tshogs pa bdag tu 'gyur gyi phung po re re ni bdag gi rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: Since the aggregates are expressed as the self, the collection of many aggregates would be the self, but each individual aggregate is not the nature of the self.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, For example, and so on.

original: shing gi ngo bo ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni shing re re'i rang bzhin can ni nags tshal du mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: shing gi ngo bo ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni shing re re'i rang bzhin can ni nags tshal du mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: The phrase not the nature of a tree means that the individual natures of each tree would not be a forest.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The answer to that is

original: shing re re zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shing re re zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, Because of the expression 'each tree,' and so on.

original: phung po tshogs pa nyid bdag yin gyi phung po re re ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phung po tshogs pa nyid bdag yin gyi phung po re re ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The collection of aggregates is the self, but each individual aggregate is not.

original: phung po tshogs pa bdag nyid du 'gyur na skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: phung po tshogs pa bdag nyid du 'gyur na skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the fault if the collection of aggregates is the self?

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reply to that,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Therefore, the self is not the aggregates,” and so on.

original: ci yang ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni @252a * //
analyzed: ci yang ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni @252a * //
translated: “ Because it is nothing at all” and so on

original: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas dngos po med pa yang mgon nam 'dul ba 'am dbang po nyid du rigs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas dngos po med pa yang mgon nam 'dul ba 'am dbang po nyid du rigs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: means that because it is the nature of non-entity, it is not tenable that the non-entity is the protector, the one to be disciplined, or the lord.

original: des na tshogs pa yang bdag nyid du mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: des na tshogs pa yang bdag nyid du mi rigs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the collection is not tenable as the self.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that with a commentary,

original: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Whatever the Bhagavān said,” and so on.

original: bdag nyid bdag gi mgon yin te //
analyzed: bdag nyid bdag gi mgon yin te //
translated: “ The self is the protector of the self”

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid bde 'gror 'gro ba'i las la sems 'jug par byed pa yin pas mgon yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid bde 'gror 'gro ba'i las la sems 'jug par byed pa yin pas mgon yin te /
translated: means that because the self engages the mind in the karma that leads to happy rebirths, it is the protector.

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pas so //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pas so //
translated: because it is the one that benefits.

original: bdag nyid bdag gi dgra yang yin //
analyzed: bdag nyid bdag gi dgra yang yin //
translated: The self is also one's own enemy.

original: zhes bya ba ni ngan 'gror 'gro bar byed pa'i las la 'jug par byed pas so //🔽legs dang ngan par byas pa la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngan 'gror 'gro bar byed pa'i las la 'jug par byed pas so // legs dang ngan par byas pa la //
translated: Because it engages in the karma that leads to bad destinies.

original: bdag nyid bdag gi dbang po yin //🔽zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las byas pa la bdag nyid dbang po yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid bdag gi dbang po yin // zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las byas pa la bdag nyid dbang po yin te /
translated: The self is the lord of good and bad karma.🔽Because the self is the lord of the karma that is virtuous and nonvirtuous.

original: des nyams su myong ba yin pas so //
analyzed: des nyams su myong ba yin pas so //
translated: Because it experiences the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: de la gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to anticipate objections to that, he says:

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If the self is the lord of karma, why is it🔽not the experiencer of the results of karma?🔽Because the collection is not different from the members of the collection.

original: tshogs pa tshogs pa can las tha dad du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga las tha dad du gyur pa'i tshogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa tshogs pa can las tha dad du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga las tha dad du gyur pa'i tshogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no collection that is different from the five aggregates such as form.🔽The result of karma is experienced by the self.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshogs pa ni bdag yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig 'dis tshogs pa bdag tu bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshogs pa ni bdag yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig 'dis tshogs pa bdag tu bstan pa yin la /
translated: This statement teaches that the collection is the self.

original: bdag tu bstan pa de'i tshig gi 'bras bu yin pas 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu bstan pa de'i tshig gi 'bras bu yin pas 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Since the self is indicated as the result of the words, it is a result.

original: de yang tshogs pa mi srid pas phung po re re bdag nyid du gtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yang tshogs pa mi srid pas phung po re re bdag nyid du gtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, since the collection is impossible, each of the aggregates belongs to the self.

original: bdag rdzas su yod pas bdag la mgon dang 'dul ba nyid dang dbang po nyid du rigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bdag rdzas su yod pas bdag la mgon dang 'dul ba nyid dang dbang po nyid du rigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Since the self substantially exists, it is reasonable that the self is a protector, a controller, and an owner.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the response to that,

original: 'di yang yod pa ma yin te //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di yang yod pa ma yin te // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “This also does not exist.”🔽Since the faults have already been explained,

original: nyes pa bshad zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phung po re re bdag tu 'dod pa'i phyogs la /
analyzed: nyes pa bshad zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phung po re re bdag tu 'dod pa'i phyogs la /
translated: with regard to the position that asserts that each of the aggregates is the self,

original: gal te phung po bdag 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te phung po bdag 'dod na //
translated: if the aggregates were the self,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa skyon sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir phyogs 'di ni mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa skyon sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir phyogs 'di ni mi rigs pa'o //
translated: since the fault has already been explained, this position is unreasonable.

original: skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate another fault,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Moreover,” and so on.

original: gal te phung po'i tshogs la bdag / ces brjod pa ni tshogs pa can bdag nyid du khong du chud pa yin na de'i tshe yan lag gi tshogs la shing rta zhes brjod pa na yan lag can shing rta nyid du @252b rtogs pas shing rta'i dbyibs su
analyzed: gal te phung po'i tshogs la bdag / ces brjod pa ni tshogs pa can bdag nyid du khong du chud pa yin na de'i tshe yan lag gi tshogs la shing rta zhes brjod pa na yan lag can shing rta nyid du @252b rtogs pas shing rta'i dbyibs su
translated: If the statement “the self is the collection of the aggregates” is understood to mean that the collection of the aggregates is the self, then when a chariot is said to be the collection of its parts, the chariot itself would be understood to be the collection of its parts.

original: ma byas pa'i spungs nas gnas pa'i shing rta'i yan lag rnams kyang shing rta nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma byas pa'i spungs nas gnas pa'i shing rta'i yan lag rnams kyang shing rta nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the parts of the chariot, which are not arranged in the shape of a chariot, would be the chariot itself.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason for this,

original: de'i yan lag tshogs zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i yan lag tshogs zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, “the collection of its parts.”

original: shing rta'i yan lag yin pas so //
analyzed: shing rta'i yan lag yin pas so //
translated: Because they are the parts of the chariot.

original: shing rta dang bdag mtshungs zhes bya ba ni ci ltar 'khor lo la sogs pa shing rta'i yan lag gi tshogs pa la brten nas shing rtar 'dogs pa de bzhin du phung po la brten nas bdag tu btags pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: shing rta dang bdag mtshungs zhes bya ba ni ci ltar 'khor lo la sogs pa shing rta'i yan lag gi tshogs pa la brten nas shing rtar 'dogs pa de bzhin du phung po la brten nas bdag tu btags pa tsam yin no //
translated: The statement “the chariot and the self are similar” means that just as a chariot is imputed in dependence on the collection of parts such as wheels, in the same way, the self is merely imputed in dependence on the aggregates.🔽In order to demonstrate that meaning,

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: he says,

original: mdo las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽bdag ces bya ba 'dod byed na //
analyzed: mdo las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / bdag ces bya ba 'dod byed na //
translated: The sutra also says:🔽If you assert the existence of a self,

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag yod do zhes sems par byed na'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag yod do zhes sems par byed na'o //
translated: if you think “a self exists,”

original: khyod kyi bdud lta'i rnam pa yin //
analyzed: khyod kyi bdud lta'i rnam pa yin //
translated: your view is like that of Mara.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag yod do zhes khyod kyis sems par byed na ni bdud kyi lta ba'i rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag yod do zhes khyod kyis sems par byed na ni bdud kyi lta ba'i rnam pa yin te /
translated: If you think “a self exists,” your view is like that of Mara.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'du byed phung po 'di stong ste //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / 'du byed phung po 'di stong ste //
translated: Why?🔽This aggregate of compounded

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi phung po ste /
translated: phenomena is empty.

original: tshogs ni stong pa yin pas so //
analyzed: tshogs ni stong pa yin pas so //
translated: The aggregate of compounded phenomena, such as form, is a collection that is empty.🔽Therefore,

original: des na / 'di la sems can yod ma yin //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: des na / 'di la sems can yod ma yin // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: there is no sentient being here.

original: 'du byed kyi tshogs rnams stong pa'i phyir sems can gyi rten med pas sems can ga la yod ces pa'o //🔽gal te sems can med na bdag /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi tshogs rnams stong pa'i phyir sems can gyi rten med pas sems can ga la yod ces pa'o // gal te sems can med na bdag /
translated: Because the collection of compounded phenomena is empty, there is no basis for a sentient being. How could there be a sentient being?

original: ces bya ba'i tha snyad ci ltar byed ce na /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tha snyad ci ltar byed ce na /
translated: If there is no sentient being, how can you make the convention “self”?

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The answer to that is this:

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The line Just as, etc. is stated.

original: ci ltar shing rta'i yan lag gi tshogs pa la brten nas shing rtar 'dogs pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams la brten nas sems can zhes tha snyad byed pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar shing rta'i yan lag gi tshogs pa la brten nas shing rtar 'dogs pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams la brten nas sems can zhes tha snyad byed pa'o //
translated: Just as a chariot is imputed in dependence upon the collection of its parts, so a sentient being is conventionally designated in dependence upon the aggregates of form, etc.

original: des na bdag med du zin kyang sems can btags pa tsam du yod pa'o //
analyzed: des na bdag med du zin kyang sems can btags pa tsam du yod pa'o //
translated: Therefore, although there is no self, sentient beings exist as mere designations.

original: yang phung po'i tshogs pa bdag nyid yin pa la skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang phung po'i tshogs pa bdag nyid yin pa la skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate another error in the position that the collection of aggregates is the self, [Nāgārjuna] states:

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In that case, etc.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In that case means🔽just as, in that way, the chariot

original: de bzhin phung po rnams brten nas //
analyzed: de bzhin phung po rnams brten nas //
translated: is imputed in dependence upon the parts,🔽so the conventional sentient being

original: kun rdzob sems can zhes brjod do //
analyzed: kun rdzob sems can zhes brjod do //
translated: is said to exist in dependence upon the aggregates.

original: zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis mdo las phung po rnams la brten nas bdag btags pa yin no zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis mdo las phung po rnams la brten nas bdag btags pa yin no zhes gsungs la /
translated: Thus, the sutra states that the self is imputed in dependence upon the aggregates.

original: des na phung po'i tshogs tsam ni bdag ma yin no //
analyzed: des na phung po'i tshogs tsam ni bdag ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mere collection of aggregates is not the self.

original: ci ltar phung po'i tshogs tsam bdag ma yin pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ltar phung po'i tshogs tsam bdag ma yin pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how the mere collection of aggregates is not the self,

original: gang zhig la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang zhig la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “That which is designated in dependence on the aggregates, etc.”

original: @253a * // phung po la sogs pa'i spyi tsam la brten nas gang bdag la sogs par btags pa'i dus su spyi de dag la sogs 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin du zin kyang bdag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: @253a * // phung po la sogs pa'i spyi tsam la brten nas gang bdag la sogs par btags pa'i dus su spyi de dag la sogs 'dogs pa'i rgyu yin du zin kyang bdag ni ma yin no //
translated: When the self, etc., are designated in dependence on the mere collection of the aggregates, etc., those universals are the causes of designation, but the self is not.

original: de la rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason, he says,

original: brten nas btags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: brten nas btags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “because it is designated in dependence.”

original: phung po la sogs pa'i tshogs la brten nas btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i tshogs la brten nas btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is designated in dependence on the collection of aggregates, etc.

original: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the example, he says,

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa bzhin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa bzhin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “like that which is derived from the elements.”

original: ci ltar 'byung ba rnams la brten nas 'byung ba las gyur par btags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ci ltar 'byung ba rnams la brten nas 'byung ba las gyur par btags pa yin gyi /
translated: Just as that which is derived from the elements is designated in dependence on the elements,

original: 'byung ba kho na 'byung ba las gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba kho na 'byung ba las gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: but the elements themselves are not that which is derived from the elements.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa yang reg par bya bar thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa yang reg par bya bar thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: because it would follow that what is derived from the elements would also be touchable.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang phung po'i tshogs tsam la brten nas bdag tu btags pa'i phyir phung po'i tshogs tsam bdag tu 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang phung po'i tshogs tsam la brten nas bdag tu btags pa'i phyir phung po'i tshogs tsam bdag tu 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, here, because the self is imputed in dependence on the mere collection of the aggregates, the mere collection of the aggregates does not become the self.

original: de rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that extensively, he says:

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Just as, etc.”

original: 'dir phyi dang nang gi dbye bas dpe rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'dir phyi dang nang gi dbye bas dpe rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Here, the examples are twofold, distinguished in terms of external and internal.

original: de la gzhan dag gis brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de la gzhan dag gis brjod pa ni /
translated: Regarding that, others say:

original: bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “By means of pots, etc.”

original: ci ltar gzugs la sogs pa la brten nas bum par 'dogs kyi /
analyzed: ci ltar gzugs la sogs pa la brten nas bum par 'dogs kyi /
translated: Just as a pot is imputed in dependence on form, etc.,

original: gzugs la sogs pa spangs pa'i bum pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa spangs pa'i bum pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: a pot that is separate from form, etc., does not exist at all.

original: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa tsam bum pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa tsam bum pa'o //
translated: However, the mere collection of form, etc., is the pot.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang phung po la brten nas bdag tu 'dogs pa'i phyir phung po'i tshogs pa tsam ni bdag yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang phung po la brten nas bdag tu 'dogs pa'i phyir phung po'i tshogs pa tsam ni bdag yin no //
translated: Likewise, here also, because the self is imputed in dependence on the aggregates, the mere collection of the aggregates is the self.

original: des na bum pa la sogs pas ma nges gtan tshigs 'di bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na bum pa la sogs pas ma nges gtan tshigs 'di bsgrub par bya ba sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the example of the pot, etc., is not established, and this reason is inconclusive.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reply to that,🔽it is said:

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: That also does not exist.

original: ma nges pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma nges pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “inconclusive” does not exist.🔽Because it is not established that it is merely form, etc.,

original: gzugs la sogs pa tsam nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni gal te phung po la sogs pa gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa tsam yin par gyur na de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa thams cad la bum pa'i blo skye bar
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa tsam nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni gal te phung po la sogs pa gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa tsam yin par gyur na de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa thams cad la bum pa'i blo skye bar
translated: if the collection of form, etc., were the mere collection of form, etc., then at that time the cognition of pot would arise in regard to all collections of form, etc.,

original: 'gyur ro // des na gzugs la sogs pas dbyibs khyad par can gang bskyed pa de'i bum pa yin pas des na ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // des na gzugs la sogs pas dbyibs khyad par can gang bskyed pa de'i bum pa yin pas des na ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since whatever is generated by a particular shape of form, etc. is a pot, it is not indeterminate.

original: brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs @253b pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa kho na bum pa yin na ni tshogs pa ci yang med pa yin pas bum pa yang med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs @253b pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa kho na bum pa yin na ni tshogs pa ci yang med pa yin pas bum pa yang med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the objection and analysis are the same. If the collection of form, etc. were a pot, then since the collection would be nothing at all, it follows that the pot would be nothing at all.

original: gal te tshogs pa med pas tshogs pa can bum pa nyid yin na de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa re re bum par thal bar 'gyur ba dang ; gzhan yang 'ga' zhig la brten nas gang btags pa de las tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te tshogs pa med pas tshogs pa can bum pa nyid yin na de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa re re bum par thal bar 'gyur ba dang ; gzhan yang 'ga' zhig la brten nas gang btags pa de las tha dad pa yin te /
translated: If the pot were the collection of form, etc., then it follows that each individual form, etc. would be a pot. Moreover, whatever is imputed in dependence on something is different from it.

original: dper na 'byung ba las gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'byung ba las gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the derivative is different from the elements.

original: bum pa yang brten nas btags pa'i phyir ci ltar tha dad par mi 'gyur ba des na bdag dang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bum pa yang brten nas btags pa'i phyir ci ltar tha dad par mi 'gyur ba des na bdag dang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Since the pot is also imputed in dependence on something, how could it not be different? Therefore, the objection and analysis are the same.

original: de la gzhan dag gis phung po dang bdag dag 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba dag dang mtshungs par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /🔽ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽'phang lo la sogs pa tsam ni shing rta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'phang lo la sogs pa tsam shing rta nyid du 'gyur na 'byung ba las gyur pa bzhin du brten nas btags par mi 'gyur gyi 'on kyang dbyibs la sogs pa khyad par can
