analyzed: de la gzhan dag gis phung po dang bdag dag 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba dag dang mtshungs par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir / ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / 'phang lo la sogs pa tsam ni shing rta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'phang lo la sogs pa tsam shing rta nyid du 'gyur na 'byung ba las gyur pa bzhin du brten nas btags par mi 'gyur gyi 'on kyang dbyibs la sogs pa khyad par can
translated: In response to that, others say that the aggregates and the self are established as being similar to the elements and that which is derived from the elements.🔽To respond to that, Nāgārjuna explains, “If the mere collection of parts were the chariot,” and so on.

original: dang ldan pa 'phang lo la sogs pa ni shing rta yin gyi 'phang lo la sogs pa'i tshogs pa tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dang ldan pa 'phang lo la sogs pa ni shing rta yin gyi 'phang lo la sogs pa'i tshogs pa tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: The mere collection of parts such as the wheels is not the chariot. If the mere collection of parts such as the wheels were the chariot, it would not be imputed in dependence on the parts, like that which is derived from the elements. However, the chariot is the collection of parts such as the wheels that possess a special shape and so on.

original: des na dbyibs khyad par can dang ldan pa'i shing rta ni 'phang lo la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las tha dad pa'i phyir brten nas btags par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na dbyibs khyad par can dang ldan pa'i shing rta ni 'phang lo la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las tha dad pa'i phyir brten nas btags par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore the chariot, which possesses a special shape, is imputed in dependence on the collection of parts such as the wheels because it is different from the collection of parts such as the wheels.

original: dpe de don dang sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe de don dang sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to apply that example to the meaning, Nāgārjuna explains,

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Likewise, etc.

original: shing rta bzhin du dbyibs khyad par can dang ldan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams bdag yin la gzugs la sogs pa tsam ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: shing rta bzhin du dbyibs khyad par can dang ldan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams bdag yin la gzugs la sogs pa tsam ni ma yin no ;
translated: Just as in the case of a chariot, the self is the form, etc. that have a distinctive shape, not merely form, etc.

original: / des na dbyibs khyad par can dang ldan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa de tshogs pa tsam las tha dad pa'i phyir brten nas btags pa'i tha snyad 'thad pa yin no snyam na'o //
analyzed: / des na dbyibs khyad par can dang ldan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa de tshogs pa tsam las tha dad pa'i phyir brten nas btags pa'i tha snyad 'thad pa yin no snyam na'o //
translated: Therefore, since that collection of form, etc. that has a distinctive shape is different from the mere collection, it is tenable to designate it in dependence.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In order to demonstrate the reply to that,🔽it is said,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: That also does not exist.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan 'dri ba ni ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan 'dri ba ni ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The reason for that is asked: Why?

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The reply to that is

original: dbyibs zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dbyibs zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: If you say it is shape, etc.

original: gal te gzugs can gyi chos rnams kyi dbyibs kyi khyad par la bdag ces brjod na de'i tshe dbyibs de gzugs can mig la sogs pa kho na la yod pa'i phyir @254a * //
analyzed: gal te gzugs can gyi chos rnams kyi dbyibs kyi khyad par la bdag ces brjod na de'i tshe dbyibs de gzugs can mig la sogs pa kho na la yod pa'i phyir @254a * //
translated: If you say that the special shape of physical things is the self, then at that time, since that shape exists only in physical things such as the eyes,

original: khyod kyi phyogs la gzugs can kho na bdag gi ming 'thob par 'gyur gyi rnam par shes pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi tshogs pa rnams bdag nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyod kyi phyogs la gzugs can kho na bdag gi ming 'thob par 'gyur gyi rnam par shes pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi tshogs pa rnams bdag nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: in your system, only physical things would obtain the name “self,” and the collections of consciousness, feeling, perception, and mental formations would not be the self.

original: de rnams la dbyibs med pas so //
analyzed: de rnams la dbyibs med pas so //
translated: Because they do not have shape.

original: des na gzugs kyi phung po kho na bdag nyid du 'gyur gyi phung po lnga ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gzugs kyi phung po kho na bdag nyid du 'gyur gyi phung po lnga ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, only the form aggregate would be the self, and not the five aggregates.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says,

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽yang bdag dang nye bar len pa dag gcig yin pa la skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // yang bdag dang nye bar len pa dag gcig yin pa la skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: “Why is that?” and so on.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate the error in the self and the appropriated being the same, he says,🔽“Moreover, if the self and the appropriated were the same,” and so on.

original: nye bar len pa po bdag nyid ni nye bar len pa ste nye bar blang bar bya ba'i phung po lnga dang cig car du rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po bdag nyid ni nye bar len pa ste nye bar blang bar bya ba'i phung po lnga dang cig car du rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The appropriator, the self, is not simultaneously with the five appropriated aggregates, which are to be appropriated.

original: de lta na las dang byed pa po gcig nyid 'gyur zhes bya ba ni len pa po dang nye bar len pa dag gcig nyid du khas len na las dang byed pa po dag kyang gcig nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na las dang byed pa po gcig nyid 'gyur zhes bya ba ni len pa po dang nye bar len pa dag gcig nyid du khas len na las dang byed pa po dag kyang gcig nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “ In that case, the object and agent would be the same” means that if one accepts that the appropriator and the appropriated are the same, then the object and agent would be the same.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir / 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to explain that, he says:🔽Here, the appropriator and the appropriated would be the same.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa po dang nye bar len pa'i gnas skabs na'o //🔽byed pa po dang las gcig nyid du 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni byed pa po ste nye bar len pa po bdag dang las te /
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa po dang nye bar len pa'i gnas skabs na'o // byed pa po dang las gcig nyid du 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni byed pa po ste nye bar len pa po bdag dang las te /
translated: Here means in the context of the appropriator and the appropriated.

original: nye bar blang bar bya ba'i phyir phung po rnams gcig nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar blang bar bya ba'i phyir phung po rnams gcig nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The object and agent would be the same means that the agent, the appropriator, the self, and the object, the appropriated, the aggregates, would be the same.

original: gyur na skyon ci zhig yod snyam na /
analyzed: gyur na skyon ci zhig yod snyam na /
translated: If they were the same, what would be the problem?

original: de la lan ni de ni 'dod pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la lan ni de ni 'dod pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The response to that is stated in the lines beginning, “But that is not maintained by us. ”

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //🔽gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shing ste bsreg par bya ba'i bsreg bya shing la sogs pa ni las su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i shes rab las so // gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shing ste bsreg par bya ba'i bsreg bya shing la sogs pa ni las su 'gyur ro //
translated: As to the question, “How so? ”🔽The lines beginning, “If fuel were fire, then object and agent would be the same”

original: de sreg par byed pa po'i byed pa po ste me'o //
analyzed: de sreg par byed pa po'i byed pa po ste me'o //
translated: indicate that the fuel, which is the object of burning, the thing to be burned, such as wood, would be the agent of burning, the fire.

original: de la gal te bud shing de nyid me nyid du yongs su rtog na de'i tshe las dang byed po dag gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la gal te bud shing de nyid me nyid du yongs su rtog na de'i tshe las dang byed po dag gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: If you imagine that the fuel itself is the fire, then it follows that object and agent would be the same.

original: de ltar yang mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: But that is not seen.

original: bum pa dang rdza mkhan dag kyang gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: bum pa dang rdza mkhan dag kyang gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: It follows that the pot and the potter would be the same.

original: de ltar khas len pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar khas len pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But that is not accepted.🔽The lines beginning, “If fire were different from fuel”

original: me dang shing gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de la nye bar blang bar bya ba yin pas na nye bar blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: me dang shing gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de la nye bar blang bar bya ba yin pas na nye bar blang bar bya ste /
translated: indicate that the object to be appropriated is that which is to be appropriated.

original: nyer len gyi phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: nyer len gyi phung po lnga'o //
translated: The five appropriated aggregates are the object to be appropriated.

original: de la brten nas gang btags pa de la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga len par byed cing sgrub par byed pa'i bdag ces brjod par @254b bya ste ;
analyzed: de la brten nas gang btags pa de la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga len par byed cing sgrub par byed pa'i bdag ces brjod par @254b bya ste ;
translated: In dependence on that, that which is designated is called the self that appropriates and establishes the five appropriated aggregates,

original: ngar 'dzin gyi yul yin pas so //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin gyi yul yin pas so //
translated: because it is the object of the conception of “I.”

original: bdag dang nye bar len pa grub pa'i rim pa gang yin pa de me dang bud shing gi bshad pa yin no zhes khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag dang nye bar len pa grub pa'i rim pa gang yin pa de me dang bud shing gi bshad pa yin no zhes khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that the process of establishing the self and the appropriated aggregates is the same as the explanation of fire and fuel.🔽Just as fire and fuel are not established as being different, so it is for the self and the appropriated aggregates.

original: ci ltar me dang bud shing dag tha mi dad par ma grub pa de bzhin du bdag dang nye bar len pa dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: ci ltar me dang bud shing dag tha mi dad par ma grub pa de bzhin du bdag dang nye bar len pa dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: This is what it means.

original: / de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: 'dir ji ltar zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Here, how?

original: de la gzhan dag gi phyogs snga ma bstan par bya ba'i phyir ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la gzhan dag gi phyogs snga ma bstan par bya ba'i phyir ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the opponent’s position, he says, “Why is it said . . . ?”

original: nye bar len pa po ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams nye bar len pa ste byed pa po 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams nye bar len pa ste byed pa po 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: “There is no appropriator at all” means that there is no agent whatsoever that appropriates the aggregates.

original: nye bar len pa tsam gcig tu zad do zhes bya ba ni bdag ces gang brjod pa de ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga 'dus pa tsam zhig tu zad do snyam pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa tsam gcig tu zad do zhes bya ba ni bdag ces gang brjod pa de ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga 'dus pa tsam zhig tu zad do snyam pa'o //
translated: “It is just mere appropriation” means that whatever is called a self is just the mere collection of the five appropriated aggregates.

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the response to that, [the root text] says,

original: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽byed po me las yod snyam blo yin na //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / byed po me las yod snyam blo yin na //
translated: “That too . . .” and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ni len pa po ni yod pa ma yin la nye bar len pa tsam yod pa yin no snyam na ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni len pa po ni yod pa ma yin la nye bar len pa tsam yod pa yin no snyam na ste /
translated: The thought is that the agent does not exist, but mere appropriation exists.

original: phyogs snga ma rjes su brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: phyogs snga ma rjes su brjod pa yin la /
translated: This is a restatement of the opponent’s position.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin te /
translated: The response is “No . . .” and so on.

original: ma yin zhes bya ba ni phyogs de yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba ni phyogs de yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “No” means that position does not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The response to that is🔽.

original: gang phyir byed po med las med //
analyzed: gang phyir byed po med las med //
translated: Because without an agent there is no action.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gang gi phyir byed pa po med na las med pa de'i phyir nye bar len pa po med na nye bar len pa yang med par thal bar 'gyur ro //🔽'di'i don ni nye bar len pa po dang nye bar len pa dag phan tshun ltos nas rang bzhin 'grub pa'i phyir nye bar len pa po yod na nye bar len pa yod pa dang nye bar len pa po la ma ltos pa'i nye bar len pa yod
analyzed: gang gi phyir byed pa po med na las med pa de'i phyir nye bar len pa po med na nye bar len pa yang med par thal bar 'gyur ro // 'di'i don ni nye bar len pa po dang nye bar len pa dag phan tshun ltos nas rang bzhin 'grub pa'i phyir nye bar len pa po yod na nye bar len pa yod pa dang nye bar len pa po la ma ltos pa'i nye bar len pa yod
translated: Because without an agent there is no action, therefore it follows that without a appropriator there is no appropriation.

original: pa ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this is that since the appropriator and appropriation are established as having an essence in mutual dependence, if the appropriator exists, appropriation exists, and it is not logical that appropriation exists without depending on the appropriator.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it is said:

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te //
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te //
translated: That is not so.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rgyu med pa'i zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa ni nye bar len pa po la ltos pa yin pas nye bar len pa po med na rgyu med pa'i nye bar len pa de ci ltar yod par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa ni nye bar len pa po la ltos pa yin pas nye bar len pa po med na rgyu med pa'i nye bar len pa de ci ltar yod par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Since appropriation depends on the appropriator, how could there be a causeless appropriation without an appropriator?

original: bstan bcos las kyang zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i shes rab las so //🔽de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
analyzed: bstan bcos las kyang zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i shes rab las so // de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
translated: The treatise is the Wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽de bzhin zhes bya ba 'dis ni bstan ma thag @255a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / de bzhin zhes bya ba 'dis ni bstan ma thag @255a * //
translated: The root text says, “One should understand appropriation in the same way.”

original: pa'i las dang byed pa po bzhin du btags par ston pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i las dang byed pa po bzhin du btags par ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase “in the same way” indicates that the appropriator is imputed in the same way that the action and the agent are imputed.

original: nyer len shes par bya zhes bya ba 'dis bya ba nye bar len pa tsam brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: nyer len shes par bya zhes bya ba 'dis bya ba nye bar len pa tsam brjod pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “one should understand appropriation” indicates that the action of appropriation is merely a designation.

original: de rang gi sgrub par byed pa po dang nye bar blang bar bya ba las la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: de rang gi sgrub par byed pa po dang nye bar blang bar bya ba las la ltos pa yin no //
translated: The appropriator is established in dependence on the appropriated and the action.

original: des na nye bar len pa'i sgra ni nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang bar bya ba brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na nye bar len pa'i sgra ni nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang bar bya ba brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore the term “appropriation” expresses both the appropriator and the appropriated.

original: nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang bar bya ba de dag kyang phan tshun la ltos nas byed pa po dang las lta bur grub pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang bar bya ba de dag kyang phan tshun la ltos nas byed pa po dang las lta bur grub pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: The appropriator and the appropriated are established in mutual dependence, like the agent and the action, but not in terms of their own intrinsic reality.

original: ngo bo'i sgo nas ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /🔽lan ni / las dang byed po bsal phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo'i sgo nas ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na / lan ni / las dang byed po bsal phyir ro //
translated: Why is it not so by way of their nature?

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te ;
translated: The answer is: Because the agent and action are refuted.

original: kho bo cag gis byed pa po dang las gtan tshigs gang gis bkag pa'i gtan tshigs de nyid kyis nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang bar bya ba de dag kyang bkag pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis byed pa po dang las gtan tshigs gang gis bkag pa'i gtan tshigs de nyid kyis nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang bar bya ba de dag kyang bkag pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: By whatever reason we refute the agent and action, through that very reason one should understand that the appropriator and that appropriated are also refuted.🔽Not only do they exist in mutual dependence,

original: de dag kho na phan tshun ltos nas 'grub pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'on kyang /
analyzed: de dag kho na phan tshun ltos nas 'grub pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'on kyang /
translated: but also

original: byed pa po dang las dag gis ;
analyzed: byed pa po dang las dag gis ;
translated: by the agent and action,

original: / dngos po lhag ma'ang shes par bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: / dngos po lhag ma'ang shes par bya // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the remaining things should be understood.

original: las dang byed pa po dang nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang bar bya ba las tha dad du gyur pa'i skyed pa po dang / bskyed par bya ba dang / 'gro ba dang / 'gro bar bya ba dang / lta ba po dang /
analyzed: las dang byed pa po dang nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang bar bya ba las tha dad du gyur pa'i skyed pa po dang / bskyed par bya ba dang / 'gro ba dang / 'gro bar bya ba dang / lta ba po dang /
translated: Apart from action, agent, appropriator, and that appropriated, the remaining things are the producer and that produced, going and that gone over, the seer and🔽the seen, the hearer and the heard, the toucher and the touched, the knower and the object of knowledge.

original: blta bar bya ba dang / mtshan nyid dang / mtshan gzhi dang / de bzhin du cha shas dang / cha shas can dang / yon tan dang / yon tan can dang / tshad ma dang gzhal bya la sogs pa dngos po lhag ma ma lus pa gang yin pa de rnams la yang las dang byed pa po dpyad pa'i sgo nas ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa bkag nas phan tshun ltos nas grub pa yin no zhes shes rab can🔽gyis khong du chud par gyis shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: blta bar bya ba dang / mtshan nyid dang / mtshan gzhi dang / de bzhin du cha shas dang / cha shas can dang / yon tan dang / yon tan can dang / tshad ma dang gzhal bya la sogs pa dngos po lhag ma ma lus pa gang yin pa de rnams la yang las dang byed pa po dpyad pa'i sgo nas ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa bkag nas phan tshun ltos nas grub pa yin no zhes shes rab can gyis khong du chud par gyis shig ces pa'o //
translated: The object of seeing, the characteristic, the characterized, and likewise the parts, the whole, the quality, the qualified, the valid cognition, the object of comprehension, and so on—all remaining things—should be understood by the wise to be mutually dependent, having negated intrinsic existence by means of the analysis of action and agent.🔽🔽

original: de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
analyzed: de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
translated: The wise should understand that all remaining things, such as the object of seeing, the characteristic, the basis of characteristics, and likewise the parts, the whole, the quality, the qualified, the valid cognition, the object of comprehension, and so on, are established in mutual dependence, having been refuted as established by their own entities through the analysis of action and agent.

original: zhes bya ba ni don de nyid bshad pa ni 'dir dngos po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don de nyid bshad pa ni 'dir dngos po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The meaning of that is explained by “Here, in regard to things…” and so on.

original: au pa dha zhes bya ba'i sgra'i dbyings la bhu ta'i rkyen phyin na nye bar len pa zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: au pa dha zhes bya ba'i sgra'i dbyings la bhu ta'i rkyen phyin na nye bar len pa zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
translated: The verbal root upa-da- has the affix -bhūta, and it becomes “appropriation.”

original: des na nye bar len pa'i sgra'i don ni nye bar len pa tsam gyi rang bzhin can gyi bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: des na nye bar len pa'i sgra'i don ni nye bar len pa tsam gyi rang bzhin can gyi bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the term appropriator is that which has the nature of the mere act of appropriation.

original: dngos po yang sgrub par byed pa med par 'byung ba ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i bya ba ni las dang byed pa po gnyis la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po yang sgrub par byed pa med par 'byung ba ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i bya ba ni las dang byed pa po gnyis la ltos pa yin te /
translated: And since an entity does not occur without an agent, the act of appropriation depends on both the object and the agent.

original: 'di ltar nye bar blang bar bya ba gang gis len pa de la byed pa po zhes bya la @255b gang nye bar blang bar bya ba de la las zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar nye bar blang bar bya ba gang gis len pa de la byed pa po zhes bya la @255b gang nye bar blang bar bya ba de la las zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, that which is appropriated is called the object, and that which appropriates is called the agent.

original: des na nye bar len pa'i bya bas byed pa po dang las dag 'phen pas las dang byed pa po dag tu 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na nye bar len pa'i bya bas byed pa po dang las dag 'phen pas las dang byed pa po dag tu 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the act of appropriation impels both the object and the agent, they are asserted to be the object and the agent.

original: des na de bzhin nyer len shes par bya ba 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na de bzhin nyer len shes par bya ba 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Thus, the meaning of this statement, “One should understand appropriation in the same way,” is as follows.

original: las dang byed pa po bzhin du nye bar len pa po dang nye bar len pa dag kyang shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: las dang byed pa po bzhin du nye bar len pa po dang nye bar len pa dag kyang shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Just as the object and the agent are posited, one should understand the appropriator and the appropriated in the same way.

original: nye bar blang ba dang zhes bya ba ni las so //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba dang zhes bya ba ni las so //
translated: “The appropriated” is the action.

original: nye bar len pa po ni zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po ni zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'o //
translated: “The appropriator” is the agent.

original: de ltar nye bar len pa'i sgras bya ba nye bar len pa brjod par bya na don de sngar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar nye bar len pa'i sgras bya ba nye bar len pa brjod par bya na don de sngar bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, if the word “appropriation” is to be taken as expressing the action of appropriation, that meaning has already been explained.

original: da ni nye bar len pa'i sgras rjod par byed pa'i phyogs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽nye bar len pa'i sgras ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni nye bar len pa'i sgras rjod par byed pa'i phyogs bstan par bya ba'i phyir / nye bar len pa'i sgras ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to show the position in which the word “appropriation” is to be taken, he says,🔽“The word ‘appropriation’ also expresses the object that is to be appropriated.”

original: nye bar len pa'i sgras ni nye bar blang bar bya ba'i las kyang brjod pa nyid do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i sgras ni nye bar blang bar bya ba'i las kyang brjod pa nyid do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “The word ‘appropriation’ also expresses the object that is to be appropriated” should be supplied.

original: gal te l+yu ta'i rkyen gyis bya ba tsam brjod pa'i phyir las ci ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te l+yu ta'i rkyen gyis bya ba tsam brjod pa'i phyir las ci ltar brjod ce na /
translated: If the action is expressed by the suffix -tva because it is merely an action, how is the object expressed?

original: lan ni tri ta dang l+yu ta ni phal cher ro zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: lan ni tri ta dang l+yu ta ni phal cher ro zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: The answer is: “The suffix -tva and -tva are mostly.”

original: tri ta dang l+yu ta ni phal cher ro zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig phal cher ro zhes bya ba'i ma nges pa ston pa'i sgra de las la yang l+yu ta brjod pa srid pas nye bar len pa'i sgra'i don nye bar blang bar bya ba'i las kyang
analyzed: tri ta dang l+yu ta ni phal cher ro zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig phal cher ro zhes bya ba'i ma nges pa ston pa'i sgra de las la yang l+yu ta brjod pa srid pas nye bar len pa'i sgra'i don nye bar blang bar bya ba'i las kyang
translated: The words “for the most part” indicate that the word “for the most part” is a term that shows uncertainty. Since it is possible to express the meaning of “for the most part” by the word “lyut,” the object of the verbal action is also the meaning of the verbal root.

original: yin no // las kyang byed pa po la ltos nas nye bar len pa'i sgra'i don ni nye bar blang bar bya ba dang / nye bar len pa po dag go //
analyzed: yin no // las kyang byed pa po la ltos nas nye bar len pa'i sgra'i don ni nye bar blang bar bya ba dang / nye bar len pa po dag go //
translated: The object of the verbal action is also the meaning of the verbal root, because the object of the verbal root is the object of the verbal action.

original: des na phyogs gnyis ka ltar na yang nye bar len pa'i sgra'i don ni nye bar blang bar bya ba dang / nye bar len pa po yin no //
analyzed: des na phyogs gnyis ka ltar na yang nye bar len pa'i sgra'i don ni nye bar blang bar bya ba dang / nye bar len pa po yin no //
translated: Therefore, in both cases, the meaning of the verbal root is the object of the verbal root and the agent of the verbal root.

original: des na don ci ltar 'gyur ba de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na don ci ltar 'gyur ba de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show how this is so,

original: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says “therefore” and so on.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i sgra'i don nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i sgra'i don nyid yin pas so //
translated: “Therefore” means because it is the meaning of the verbal root.

original: gzhung 'dis ni nye bar len pa gcig pu yod pa ma yin no zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhung 'dis ni nye bar len pa gcig pu yod pa ma yin no zhes pa yin no //
translated: This treatise states that the self does not exist apart from the appropriated aggregates.

original: yang de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab nyid las so //
analyzed: yang de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab nyid las so //
translated: The passage beginning with “In that case” and ending with “the root text of the Middle Way” refers to Fundamental Wisdom.

original: de ltar nye bar len pa las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag dang ni nye bar len pa las gzhan du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar nye bar len pa las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag dang ni nye bar len pa las gzhan du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The passage beginning with “In that case, the self would not be different from the appropriated aggregates” and ending with “the self would not be different from the appropriated aggregates” means that the self would not exist as different from the appropriated aggregates.

original: nye bar len pa la ma ltos par tha dad du 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur bas so //🔽de nyid nyer len nyid kyang min //
analyzed: nye bar len pa la ma ltos par tha dad du 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur bas so // de nyid nyer len nyid kyang min //
translated: This is because it would follow that the self would be apprehended as separate without depending on the appropriated aggregates.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag de ni nye bar len pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag de ni nye bar len pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: The passage beginning with “It would also not be the appropriated aggregates themselves” and ending with “the appropriated aggregates themselves” means that the self would not be the appropriated aggregates themselves.

original: nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa po dag gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba dang / skye ba dang 'jig par @256a * //🔽thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa po dag gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba dang / skye ba dang 'jig par @256a * // thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: This is because it would follow that the appropriated aggregates and the appropriator would be identical, and it would follow that the appropriated aggregates would arise and disintegrate.

original: 'o na nye bar len pa dang bral ba yin no zhe na /🔽de la lan ni /
analyzed: 'o na nye bar len pa dang bral ba yin no zhe na / de la lan ni /
translated: If you say that the self is free from the appropriated aggregates,

original: nye bar len pa med min zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa med min zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the response to that is stated in the line “It is not that the self does not exist in dependence on the appropriated aggregates.”

original: nye bar len pa la mi ltos par tha dad du 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa la mi ltos par tha dad du 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: because it would follow that it would be apprehended separately, without depending on the appropriated aggregates.

original: 'o na bdag yod pa ma yin no snyam na de la lan ni /
analyzed: 'o na bdag yod pa ma yin no snyam na de la lan ni /
translated: If you think that the self does not exist, the response to that is:

original: med pa nyid du yang de ma nges zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: med pa nyid du yang de ma nges zhes gsungs te /
translated: “It is not ascertained that it does not exist.”

original: gang phung po la brten nas btags pa de med pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang phung po la brten nas btags pa de med pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How could it be that what is imputed in dependence on the aggregates does not exist?

original: mo gsham gyi bu ci yang med pas phung po la brten nas 'dogs pa ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu ci yang med pas phung po la brten nas 'dogs pa ni ma yin pas so //
translated: Because the son of a barren woman does not exist at all, he is not imputed in dependence on the aggregates.

original: nye bar len pa yod la nye bar len pa po med pas so zhes bya ba de ci ltar rigs des na 'di med pa nyid kyang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa yod la nye bar len pa po med pas so zhes bya ba de ci ltar rigs des na 'di med pa nyid kyang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: How could it be tenable to say that the appropriator does not exist when the appropriated aggregates exist? Therefore it is not tenable that it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir bdag med do zhes nges pa de mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag med do zhes nges pa de mi rigs pa'o //
translated: Therefore it is not tenable to ascertain that the self does not exist.

original: 'dir skabs su bab pa ni med pa nyid du'ang de ma nges zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir skabs su bab pa ni med pa nyid du'ang de ma nges zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
translated: Here, the relevant point is that it is not ascertained that it does not exist.

original: nye bar len pa yod na nye bar len pa po nyid med pa mi srid pas so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa yod na nye bar len pa po nyid med pa mi srid pas so //
translated: Because it is impossible that the appropriator does not exist when the appropriated aggregates exist.

original: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the summary, it is said:

original: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he says “thus” and so on.

original: gal te lung las byed pa po ni ma dmigs kyi las kyang yod la rnam par smin pa yang yod do zhes ci ltar gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te lung las byed pa po ni ma dmigs kyi las kyang yod la rnam par smin pa yang yod do zhes ci ltar gsungs te /
translated: If one asks, “How is it said in the scriptures that the agent is not perceived, but that there is karma and there is ripening?”

original: der nye bar len pa po med pa'i nye bar len pa po yod do zhes ci ltar gsungs te /
analyzed: der nye bar len pa po med pa'i nye bar len pa po yod do zhes ci ltar gsungs te /
translated: How is it said there that there is appropriation without an appropriator?

original: de ltar lung dang mi 'gal snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu nas lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar lung dang mi 'gal snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu nas lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: Anticipating such an objection, he replies:

original: yang gang las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yang gang las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “From what scripture is it known that the agent is not perceived, but that there is karma and there is ripening?”

original: gang las zhes bya ba ni lung las so //
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba ni lung las so //
translated: “From what scripture” means from the scriptures.

original: byed pa po dang rang bzhin du gyur pa bkag pa shes par bya ba'i zhes bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin pa gzhan la mi ltos pa byed pa po bkag pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa po dang rang bzhin du gyur pa bkag pa shes par bya ba'i zhes bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin pa gzhan la mi ltos pa byed pa po bkag pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: “It is known that the agent and the intrinsic nature are refuted” means that the non-artificial, non-dependent agent is refuted.

original: de la brten nas gdags par bya ba zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de la brten nas gdags par bya ba zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of “that which is to be designated in dependence on that” is:

original: tha snyad kyi yan lag tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi yan lag tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “that which is a part of conventional usage.”

original: don dam pa'i byed pa po bkag pa yin la tha snyad kyi byed pa po bkag pa ma yin pa la khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de skad du yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i byed pa po bkag pa yin la tha snyad kyi byed pa po bkag pa ma yin pa la khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de skad du yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The source that shows that the ultimate agent is refuted, but the conventional agent is not refuted, is stated in the passage beginning with “In that way . . .🔽”

original: lung 'dir gang zag byed pa nyid du gsungs pas sngar gyi lung las rnam pa thams cad du byed pa po bkag pa ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lung 'dir gang zag byed pa nyid du gsungs pas sngar gyi lung las rnam pa thams cad du byed pa po bkag pa ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Since this passage states that the person is an agent, it should be understood that the agent is not refuted in every way in the previous passage.

original: phung po bdag nyid du 'dod pa'i phyogs la skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po bdag nyid du 'dod pa'i phyogs la skyon gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate another fault in the position that the aggregates are the self, it is said:

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, since the Sage said🔽that the self is imputed in dependence on the six elements,🔽the self is not different from the six elements.

original: gang gi phyir thub pas sa dang chu dang @256b me dang ; rlung dang rnam par shes pa dang / nam mkha' zhes bya ba'i khams drug la brten nas bdag nye bar btags pa yin no zhes gsungs pas des na khams drug las bdag gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thub pas sa dang chu dang @256b me dang ; rlung dang rnam par shes pa dang / nam mkha' zhes bya ba'i khams drug la brten nas bdag nye bar btags pa yin no zhes gsungs pas des na khams drug las bdag gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Since the Sage said that the self is imputed in dependence on the six elements called earth, water, fire, wind, consciousness, and space, therefore the self is not not different from the six elements.

original: brten nas btags pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no snyam du bsams pa'o /
analyzed: brten nas btags pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no snyam du bsams pa'o /
translated: Because it is imputed in dependence on them, like form and so on.

original: gal te mdo las phung po brten nas yin gsungs pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te mdo las phung po brten nas yin gsungs pas de'i phyir /
translated: If the sutra states that the self is imputed in dependence on the aggregates,

original: phung po 'dus tsam bdag ma yin //
analyzed: phung po 'dus tsam bdag ma yin //
translated: then why does the present verse state that the self is not the mere assembly of the aggregates?

original: zhes bya bas don 'di nyid sngar gsungs pa'i phyir yang brjod pa la dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na /🔽bden te 'on kyang blo gros dman pa 'ga' zhig la phung po'i tshogs pa bdag ma yin kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya bas don 'di nyid sngar gsungs pa'i phyir yang brjod pa la dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na / bden te 'on kyang blo gros dman pa 'ga' zhig la phung po'i tshogs pa bdag ma yin kyang /
translated: This point was already made earlier, so what is the need to state it again?🔽This is true, but it is stated again in order to eliminate the qualm of those of lesser intelligence who think, “The assembly of aggregates is not the self,

original: khams la sogs pa bdag tu 'gyur ram snyam pa'i dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir yang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: khams la sogs pa bdag tu 'gyur ram snyam pa'i dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir yang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: but the elements and so on would be the self.”

original: khams la sogs pa'i yul can gyi ngar 'dzin pa spang ba'i ched du'o //🔽mig sogs reg pa'i rten drug ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: khams la sogs pa'i yul can gyi ngar 'dzin pa spang ba'i ched du'o // mig sogs reg pa'i rten drug ces bya ba ni /
translated: It is stated in order to eliminate the apprehension of “I” that has as its object the elements and so on.🔽The six bases of contact such as the eyes are the six sense spheres.

original: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa'o ;
analyzed: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa'o ;
translated: The condition of the six sense spheres is contact.

original: / zhes gsungs pas mig la sogs pa drug ni reg pa'i rten yin la mig la sogs pa de rnams la bdag 'di tha mi dad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: / zhes gsungs pas mig la sogs pa drug ni reg pa'i rten yin la mig la sogs pa de rnams la bdag 'di tha mi dad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the six such as the eye are the basis of contact, but the self is not nondifferent from those such as the eye.

original: yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba rnams sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo yin pas chos yin pa'i phyir chos sems dang sems las byung ba yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba'i mtshan nyid can la brten nas bdag tu nye bar 'dogs pa'i phyir sems dang sems las
analyzed: yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba rnams sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo yin pas chos yin pa'i phyir chos sems dang sems las byung ba yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba'i mtshan nyid can la brten nas bdag tu nye bar 'dogs pa'i phyir sems dang sems las
translated: Since the mental applications are the nature of mind and mental factors, they are phenomena. Therefore, the self is imputed in dependence on the mind and mental factors that have the characteristic of mental applications.

original: byung ba las bdag nyid tha mi dad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: byung ba las bdag nyid tha mi dad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the self is not nondifferent from the mind and mental factors.

original: rgyu mtshan ni sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni sngar bzhin no //
translated: The reason is as before.

original: gal te khams la sogs pa las tha mi dad pa nyid du mi 'dod kyi de ltar na yang khams la sogs pa'i tshogs nyid bdag yin no snyam na /
analyzed: gal te khams la sogs pa las tha mi dad pa nyid du mi 'dod kyi de ltar na yang khams la sogs pa'i tshogs nyid bdag yin no snyam na /
translated: If you do not assert that the self is nondifferent from the elements and so on, but still think that the collection of elements and so on is the self,

original: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: then to demonstrate the response to that,

original: tshogs tsam nyid min te zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: tshogs tsam nyid min te zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “It is not mere collection.”

original: sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas khams la sogs pa'i tshogs tsam bdag ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas khams la sogs pa'i tshogs tsam bdag ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The collections of elements, etc. are not the self, as was previously explained by the reasonings.

original: de'i phyir ngar 'dzin blo de rnams la min //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngar 'dzin blo de rnams la min //
translated: Therefore, the mind that apprehends an “I” does not arise in regard to them.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gang gi phyir khams la sogs pa bdag ma yin zhing de rnams kyi tshogs pa tsam yang ma yin pa de'i phyir khams la sogs pa rnams la ngar 'dzin gyi blo skye bar rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khams la sogs pa bdag ma yin zhing de rnams kyi tshogs pa tsam yang ma yin pa de'i phyir khams la sogs pa rnams la ngar 'dzin gyi blo skye bar rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Since the elements, etc. are not the self and their mere collection is also not the self, therefore it is not reasonable for the mind that apprehends an “I” to arise in regard to the elements, etc.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: mdo sde de las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo sde de las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In that sutra, etc.

original: skyes bu @257a * //🔽gang zag 'di ni zhes bya ba ni skyes bu ni bdag go //
analyzed: skyes bu @257a * // gang zag 'di ni zhes bya ba ni skyes bu ni bdag go //
translated: “Person” is the self.

original: de nyid kyis yang dang yang du 'gro ba dang de len par byed pas na gang zag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis yang dang yang du 'gro ba dang de len par byed pas na gang zag ces bya'o //
translated: Since he himself repeatedly goes and takes up that [self], he is called a “person.”

original: rgyal po chen po zhes bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po zhes bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig go //
translated: “Great king” is a term of address.

original: khams drug dang zhes bya ba ni khams drug la brten nas skyes bu dang gang zag tu bstan pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: khams drug dang zhes bya ba ni khams drug la brten nas skyes bu dang gang zag tu bstan pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The six elements means that the person and the individual are taught in dependence on the six elements.

original: reg pa'i skye mched drug dang zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa la brten nas btags pa yin pas so //
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched drug dang zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa la brten nas btags pa yin pas so //
translated: The six bases of contact means that they are imputed in dependence on the eye and so on.

original: yid kyi nye bar longs spyod pa bco brgyad do zhes bya ba ni yid kyi nye bar longs spyod pa bco brgyad la brten nas btags pas so //
analyzed: yid kyi nye bar longs spyod pa bco brgyad do zhes bya ba ni yid kyi nye bar longs spyod pa bco brgyad la brten nas btags pas so //
translated: The eighteen kinds of mental activity means that they are imputed in dependence on the eighteen kinds of mental activity.

original: de la bco brgyad ni phyis 'grel pas 'chad par 'gyur ro //🔽de rnams la yid kyi nye bar longs spyod pa zhes brjod pa yin te /🔽gang gi phyir yid la brten nas yid bde ba la sogs pa rnams yul la longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bco brgyad ni phyis 'grel pas 'chad par 'gyur ro // de rnams la yid kyi nye bar longs spyod pa zhes brjod pa yin te / gang gi phyir yid la brten nas yid bde ba la sogs pa rnams yul la longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eighteen will be explained later in the commentary.🔽They are called the mental activities.🔽Because the mental activities such as the mental faculty and so on are the enjoyments of the mind, they are called the mental activities.

original: gzhan dag na re yul rnams la yid longs spyod par byed pa'i phyir yid kyi nye bar longs spyod pa zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: gzhan dag na re yul rnams la yid longs spyod par byed pa'i phyir yid kyi nye bar longs spyod pa zhes bya ste ;
translated: Others say that the mental activities are called the mental activities because the mind enjoys objects.

original: tshor ba'i dbang gis yid yul rnams la yang dang yang du longs spyod pas so //
analyzed: tshor ba'i dbang gis yid yul rnams la yang dang yang du longs spyod pas so //
translated: Because the mind repeatedly enjoys objects due to the power of feeling.

original: khams drug bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khams drug bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the six elements,

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Therein,” and so on.

original: reg pa'i rten brten par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: reg pa'i rten brten par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the support and the supported of contact,

original: mig la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “The eye,” and so on.

original: yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the eighteen movements of the mind,

original: yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba la gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i dbye bas drug tu 'gyur la de bzhin du yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba yang yin zhing btang snyoms nye bar rgyu ba yang yin pas yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco
analyzed: yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / yid bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba la gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i dbye bas drug tu 'gyur la de bzhin du yid mi bde ba'i nye bar rgyu ba yang yin zhing btang snyoms nye bar rgyu ba yang yin pas yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco
translated: he says, “The movements of the mind,” and so on.🔽The movements of the mind are of six kinds, distinguished by their objects, such as form, and so on. The movements of the mind are of eighteen kinds, distinguished by their objects, such as form, and so on.

original: brgyad du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: brgyad du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The movements of the mind are of eighteen kinds, distinguished by their objects, such as form, and so on.🔽The movements of the mind are of eighteen kinds, distinguished by their objects, such as form, and so on.

original: de dag la brten pa dang zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams nye bar gzung na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la brten pa dang zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams nye bar gzung na zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation of “based on those” is “when the phenomena of mind and mental factors are apprehended.”

original: ji skad bshad pa'i chos de rnams zhes bya ba ni khams drug la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i chos de rnams zhes bya ba ni khams drug la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The “those phenomena that have been explained” are the six elements and so on.

original: da ni gang zag gi bdag bkag pa bstan pa'i dgos pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gang zag gi bdag bkag pa bstan pa'i dgos pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the purpose of the refutation of a self of persons, he says:🔽When the aggregates are not the self, and there is no self without the aggregates,

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: then what is it that comes to rebirth?

original: phung po rnams ngar 'dzin pa'i yul yang ma yin la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phung po rnams ngar 'dzin pa'i yul yang ma yin la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The aggregates are not the object of the conception of “I,”

original: sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas phung po rnams bdag nyid du ma grub pas so //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas phung po rnams bdag nyid du ma grub pas so //
translated: because, as has been previously explained, the aggregates are not established as the self.

original: phung po las tha dad pa yod pa ma yin pas @257b zhes bya ba ni /🔽phung po ma gtogs de 'dzin ma grub phyir //
analyzed: phung po las tha dad pa yod pa ma yin pas @257b zhes bya ba ni / phung po ma gtogs de 'dzin ma grub phyir //
translated: Since it does not exist separately from the aggregates,🔽it is not tenable to say that the self exists.

original: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it has been refuted by the reasoning that goes, “Apart from the aggregates, it is not apprehended.”

original: bdag gi ba yang snying po dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du shes shing zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ba ni bdag la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi ba yang snying po dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du shes shing zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ba ni bdag la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And he knows that what is mine is also devoid of a core. What is mine is so called because it is dependent on the self.

original: 'dus byas mtha' dag ces bya ba ni phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: 'dus byas mtha' dag ces bya ba ni phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The entire conditioned is characterized by the five aggregates.

original: nges par len pa med par mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni nyer len gyi phung po lhag ma med pa nges par mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nges par len pa med par mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni nyer len gyi phung po lhag ma med pa nges par mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: He attains nirvana without appropriating anything further. He attains nirvana without a remainder of the appropriated aggregates.

original: rnam par dpyod pa 'di ni ches mdzes so //
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa 'di ni ches mdzes so //
translated: This analysis is very beautiful.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag dpyad pa'i dgos pa mya ngan las 'das pa yin pas so ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag dpyad pa'i dgos pa mya ngan las 'das pa yin pas so ;
translated: Since the purpose of the analysis of the self is nirvana.

original: /'ga' zhig gis 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dmigs pa ni phung po'am sems yin no zhes 'dod pa de la skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: /'ga' zhig gis 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dmigs pa ni phung po'am sems yin no zhes 'dod pa de la skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Some believe that the object of the view of the perishable collection is either the aggregates or the mind. In order to demonstrate the error in this, he says:

original: ngar 'dzin pa'i yul ni zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa'i yul ni zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The object of the conception of “I” is the self.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi dngos po yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ngar 'dzin pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phung po dang sems kyi mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi dngos po yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ngar 'dzin pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phung po dang sems kyi mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because the basis of the conception of self exists” means that the aggregates, which are the basis of the conception of “I,” and the entity characterized by the mind exist.

original: de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that point in detail, he says:

original: bdag med rtogs tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag med rtogs tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “When one realizes selflessness” and so on.

original: gal te bdag med par rtogs pa'i dus su bdag med do snyam pa'i rnam pas yongs su spong na'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag med par rtogs pa'i dus su bdag med do snyam pa'i rnam pas yongs su spong na'o //
translated: If, when one realizes selflessness, one abandons it by thinking that there is no self.

original: 'di ni ngar 'dzin rten du yang mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bdag 'di ni ngar 'dzin pa'i rten du yang mi 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni ngar 'dzin rten du yang mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bdag 'di ni ngar 'dzin pa'i rten du yang mi 'dod pa yin te /
translated: “We do not assert that it is the basis of the conception of ‘I’” means that we do not assert that this self is the basis of the conception of “I.”
